On April 19, 1885 a vigilante mob of over a hundred fifty men stormed the jail, and dragged out Elias, along with Jim Evans, Jesse Miller, and D.B. Nott. All four of them were hanged in an abandoned barn behind the jail.

Elias survived, against the odds, when he was cut down minutes after his short-drop attempted execution, by Deputy 'Clay' Beckwith - he and ten lawmen broke up the vigilante gathering. The records state that thirty men were arrested that moon-lit April night, but the records do not tell if the other prisoners survived.

After being taken to Surgeon's Hall, the authorities decided to reprieve Elias and his sentence was commuted to transportation for four years. While serving his sentence, Elias turned to the teachings of the Good Book for guidance - returning to Repentance Springs a changed man. Soon, he found that his gunfighting and horse-handling skills had attracted the recognition of Ned McReady, who gave the man a badge.

When Jack Colty rained bullets about town, Elias was one of the first to ride with Ned. The rest is history...

108194.description:
Originally from Ireland, Brady Logan had a chequered career before finding himself a deputy at Repentance Springs - he joined the navy in 1856 aged 15 years and 9 months, and spent most of his early career aboard HMS 'Royal Adelaide'. He also spent three months of his service in diving bells in the Mediterranean.

The records show that he married on September 14th 1867 in St Senan's Church in Kilrush. It is not recorded if the couple had any children.

Brady was later discharged (referred to as a 'bad chicken dinner') from HMS Liverpool for reasons unstated, but guessed to be insobriety on duty.

After his wife died of 'The Shakes', Brady sobered up and travelled to America, visiting his sister and her mining engineer husband - both were employed by the Cottonwood Mining Company.

Brady worked at Rattlesnake Creek for a time, utilising his knowledge of rifles and explosives to make a few bucks - even completing a contract for Fort Murphy up at Lincoln County.

Colonel Ned McReady deputised Brady when the McSween brothers and gang kidnapped Jackie Peppin. During the gunfight at Peppin farm, on Sept 1st, 1891, Brady shot both brothers in the face at one hundred yards, and also 'Turkey' Joe in the buttocks. Ned is reported to have called Brady Logan 'The best shot with a rifle the Lord has ever seen."

Noted to have an eagle tattoo on his left forearm, from his service days, Brady also sports a small scar on his upper lip - he insists it was cut by an Apache knife, others whisper that it was from years of playing the Mouth Harp. Badly.

Married his second wife, Josie Hopkins, at St Ezekiel's Episcopal Church.

Was also once struck by lightning during the summer of 1890.

108204.description:
Goal: Hit the men in the tub with the balls and tip them out

1. Place the three figures back of the tub so that their fingers rest very slightly on the edge of the tub and the feet of each figure shows through one of the openings at the bottom of the tub

2. Object of the game is to snap or roll the balls at the opening, hitting the feet of the three figures and tipping them out of the tub and into the imaginary water

3. Each player has 3 shot at a turn and scores 5 points for each figure which is thrown clear of the tub into the "water".
A figure which is hit and still retains a grip on the tub does not score

4. The first player to score 100 points wins the game

108211.description:
Titanium Age is new, fast paced sci-fi strategy game for two players that is based on hit RTS video games.

It is the 23rd century. Mankind has finally united under the Terran Star Empire, and has taken fledgling steps to colonize the solar system. However, another power has similar plans. The scions of the first attempt to colonize mars, the Hegemony of Ares has risen to form a military super power that rival the Terran forces. Now the two Empire's must fight for the future of the human race with new, terrible weapons and vehicles. Now begins the Titanium Age.

Titanium Age is a hex based game that combines city building, civilization syle research, and mass strategic warfare into one epic light-wargame. There are even some very light deck-building elements, allowing you to customize your play style with artillery attacks and buffs for your army, which can contain over 100 units at once! All these elements are combined under a single, simple dice based ruleset that has two modes of play; Skirmish , which is a streamlined version for beginers and nonwargamers, and Warzone, which adds tactical depth by adding cards, an upgrade tree for your units, and a terifying unit called the ultra mech. The objective of the game is to destroy your enemies HQ structure, winning a battle in the war for the red planet.

108214.description:
It's 1984 and this is the last summer before you and your friends head off in different directions to college. You have all packed up the essentials and headed out in Billy's van for the camping trip of a lifetime. The camping spot Billy's family has always enjoyed is so secluded you have to ditch the van for the weekend and hike a couple of miles to reach it.

The gang finally arrives at a small clearing, sets up camp and begins to enjoy a weekend that should be wrought with pranks and campfire stories and memorable moments... but the first night proves it to be an unforgettable event for a much different reason as a violent storm rips the campsite apart and forces your gang of friends to abandon the camp set out for the van. But, through the storm, Billy gets turned around and leads everyone in a different direction. After a half hour of trudging through the forest and being assaulted by the torrential rain and heavy winds, you all break through the treeline and happen upon a small group of cabins. You lead the way and rush to one. Finding refuge inside the dark, musty cabin, you discover that the lights don't work and the phone is dead, yet you all take comfort in the belief that everyone is finally safe.

But for some idiotic reason, you all decide it's more important to explore the other cabins on a dark and stormy night than just rest in this one until daylight. WHY?! Why would you do something so stupid?!!! Oh... wait... of course, you're in a slasher movie... that's why.

Soon you and your group of friends come to realize that you are all being stalked and murdered by a seemingly unstoppable mad man known as Hackin' Hank who roams the grounds of his family's abandoned summer camp ground... Camp Hackaway.

In BODY COUNT, you get to step into the role of a stereotypical slasher flick teenaged summer camper or as the silently stalking slasher flick psychopath.

2 ways to play!!!

As a camper, cooperate with your fellow campers to find items and weapons that may help you survive the night as you attempt to escape Camp Hackaway alive. Do you have what it takes to outwit Hackin' Hank, find the items you need and make it out in one piece or are you going to end up just another number in Hank's Body Count?

As Hackin' Hank, use a bit of strategy and a bit of luck to silently stalk and hack the campers to pieces one by one, gaining more power and becoming a more efficient killing machine with each camper you add to your Body Count.

name.#text: BODY COUNT: Terror at Camp Hackaway

108224.description:
The Manticore, a bonus card for Cyclades: Hades, included in Plato magazine #40 (October 2011).

Effect of the card: the Manticore eliminates an opponent's hero! If a hero is on the same island as Chiron, it cannot be targeted by Manticore.
108224.name: Cyclades: Hades  The Manticore

108225.description:
Deathmatch is a fast and tactical wargame for 1-4 players, which is based on different video game shooters. Each player takes the role of a group of soldiers who are fighting in a arena for victory.

Deathmatch uses only cards and some markers for the characters. The different card types are:

- Character Cards:
Every character in the game is represented by a Character Card, which contains all necessary information (e.g. Attack-, Defense-Value, Action Points, Portage Capacity and their Special Abilities). Each Character Card has a normal and a wounded side.

- Equipment Cards:
Equipment Cards represented the different equipment in the game, like a M16, a PSG-1 or a Bulletproof Vest. Characters can be equipped with Equipment Cards, to increase their fight or defense ability. The equipment cards also serve as dice rolls. Each card has a Fate Number printed on it, which is between 0 and 5. In Combat you can play an Equipment Card from your hand to boost your Attack- or Defense-Value and then you always adds the Fate Number from top card of your Equipment Deck to determine the outcome of this action. Equipped Cards are no longer in your Equipment Deck and so their Fate Numbers are no longer in the dice pool. If your characters have good equipment, than the player will have fewer good Fate Numbers in his Deck. So each player has to find the right balance between right equipment and the remaining Fate Numbers in his deck.

- Terrain Cards:
A Terrain Card represents a part of the arena, where the characters compete against each other. Every card is divided in 6 (3x2) squares and has a different setup of covers and obstacles, like Metal Walls and Mud Pits.

- Scenario Cards:
Each Scenario Card represents a game mode, like Deathmatch, Capture the Flag or Domination. All necessary information is given on these cards. This includes information such as the special rules, the way to lay out the Terrain Cards to create the arena or the Winning Conditions.

- Marker Cards:
The Marker Cards represent the characters, special markers or items for the different scenarios. Before the first play, the players have to cut out the markers to use them.

108227.description:
The game uses the divisional system for American Civil War operations introduced in Hampton Newsome's At all Hazards for a very small and quick simulation of the two-day 2nd Battle of Corinth. Like their real counterparts, units accumulate fatigue and disorder, and stop working long before they are eliminated by combat. Corps and armies are activated by chitpulls, a simple order system (no writing!) captures the delays inherent in 19th century campaigning and the unreliability of individual leaders.

Scale:
half mile per hex
3.5 hours per daylight turn (4 daylight, one night turn per day)
division level units
Individual army and corps commanders

108228.description:
Using the new Napoleonic version of the ACW operational March into Battle system from Corinth and Hampton Newsome's At All Hazards, this game portrays the two largest battles of the 1809 campaign: Aspern, Napoleon's first defeat, and Wagram, the fourth largest battle of the Napoleonic Wars (and, as Massena put it, at that time the largest battle in history where one person could overlook the whole battlefield).

Using a system that lets armies and units behave in historical fashion but makes it possible to play these multi-day battles in a couple of hours, this is an army commander's view of how to conclude a campaign. Fatigue, morale, supply and command are as important as fighting prowess and sheer numbers. Units not just take physical losses but will become ineffective from fatigue and disorder long before they run out of men - unless you, in command, can manage them effectively and maintain their edge over two days of fighting. Corps are normally activated by chitpulls, but for PBEM play a less interactive version is provided that still provides a significant advantage to the side that grabs the initiative in the battle.

Map scale: 1km per hex
Unit scale: divisions, 1000 men per strength point
Time scale: 3.5 hours per daylight turn, 8 hours per night turn

108230.description:
This is a Monopoly game by every standard. The artwork and titles have all been replaced to match the theme of Final Fantasy. Places, names, and people, have been taken from Final Fantasy I to Final Fantasy XIII, also from Final Fantasy Tactics, Final Fantasy Unlimited, Final Fantasy Adventure.

The Monopoly games are the most commercially successful and one of the oldest game franchises in the US. The family of games are re-themed versions of the original Monopoly. The original game was released in 1935 and almost every year sees the launch of rethemed and rebranded editions. The games are published by Parker Brothers, a subsidiary of Hasbro. Gameplay consist of the players trying to acquire wealth through stylized economic system involving the buying, renting, and trading of properties using play money, the roll of the dice for movement a long the board. The object of the game is to own every piece of property and drive the other players into bankruptcy.

110882.description: A surprise promo card originally given out in Essen 2011 with Ghost Stories: Black Secret. Steven Qi-Gal is an extra Wu-Feng only playable with the Ghost Stories: White Moon Expansion, because you need white Tao Dice or Moon Crystals to exorcise him. But he will let the Taoists save a villager when he comes into play and is replaced by a Buddha after he is exorcised.

110886.description:
This promo card was handed out at the Z-Man booth at Spiel 2011 in Essen.

The card reads: The King is attending SPIEL Essen.
In turn order, each player tries a Secret Amorous Liaison with the Queen until one player succeeds.

It is to be used with the base game as it has a normal F-back.
110886.name: Feudalherren: Der König Promokarte

108266.description: Basketus is a 20-minute basketball game. Each player manages a team of 5 chips basketball players who are available to move around the court, throws the ring, passes, steals the ball. The game uses two dice, but winning the game depends largely on the actions of the players. Print and play.

108272.description:
The Talons of Weng-Chiang is an unauthorised, non-profit, and non-collectable expansion for the The Twelve Doctors: Doctor Who Card Game.

Much as including the Gelth, Vervoids, the Doctor's Daughter, a Cybermat, or the The Flood interests the designer(s), there has to be a limit to the card pool - unless you declare the game a Living Card Game (which this regeneration is not).

While the game remains unofficial, and without a publisher, this expansion will be the last.

The expansion consists of the following cards:

Zero Room play-area card (new gadget for the Doctor)
Bad Wolf play-area card (new gadget for the Doctor)
2x Alternate Master regeneration cards (for variant deck construction)

Master's Deck:







Robomen
Green Death
Auton Invasion!
Experimental Prototype Robot K1
Magnus Greel
Terileptil Ruse
Swarm of Vashta Nerada
Prisoner Zero
Legion of Weeping Angels
Li H'Sen Chang
Crucible - Dalek Empire Flagship
Cacophony of Silents
Nugget of Jethrik






Rutan Imposter
Impossible Astronaut
House of the Dragon
Weng-Chiang's Time Cabinet
Time Lord Presidency
Osirian Servo Robots
Madame Kovarian
Mandrels
New Paradigm Daleks
Miniaturised Planet Calufrax
Army of Scarecrows
“Are You My Mummy?”
Mehendri Solon






Doctor's Deck:







K9 Mark II
Jago and Litefoot
Oswin Oswald
Great Seal of Diplos
Crooked Smile
Cricket Ball
UNIT HQ
Face of Boe
Wilfred Mott
Amy Pond (Alternate)
Victorian London





Cold Logic
Chancellery Guards
“We’re the only two left"
Fowling Piece
"Miss Dvoratrelundar"
Grachtian Statue
Sally Sparrow
“When I say run, RUN!”
"Well, if one has God-like powers, one ought to be able to use them, oughtn't one?"
Spectrox Toxemia
"Well, it's probably your Tyroidal Time Dilators. They're usually the first to go."








Some of the cards possess the Key to Time icon.

name.#text: The Twelve Doctors: The Talons of Weng-Chiang

108281.description:
Goal: Collect as many (visiting = recruits) counters as possible before a player reaches Dover

Game is played on a board carrying a map of the British Isles.
Players move round the map according to the throw of dice.
Similar to 'Snake and Ladders' you gain or loose movement points, depending on the space your turn ends (==> see table on the board). Luckily you also may collect counters entering the big cities.
The player who reaches Dover finishes the game, collecting 10 additional counters.

Historical background:
Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum and Broome, 1850 - 1916, British field-marshal.
His excellent reputation was used to recruit men for the 'killing fields' of WW I. He and most of his staff drowned when his ship struck a mine off Orkney.

108287.description:
There is a vertical 2-sided window with blocks between players with fishes and other sea creatures on the blocks.
Bottom of the window is 2 rotary dials where 2 pictures appear every round.
Both players run at the same time the rotary dial. If it stops, players must find four pictures which are on the two rotary dials. If they find, they must push these blocks through the game window,

Player with the least blocks is the winner if there are no blocks left inside the window.
108287.name: Ploppster

108309.description: An expansion for Vex with 50 new cards containing new challanges

108310.description:
This is a stand-alone game, not an expansion.

Flashing Steel is a skirmish miniatures game (one figure = one combatant) in the Song of Blades and Heroes family. The flavour is smack in the middle of The Three Musketeers and pirate action of all kinds. Swing from those chandeliers or ratlines. Kick the chair or skewer the roast chicken.

Flashing Steel was written to address a couple of key changes needed from Song of Blades and Heroes for this genre. One was to reflect the slower rate of fire for matchlock weapons. That was easy enough.

The second was to bring in the flair and 'swashbuckling' aspects of the period into the rules. It is often forgotten that schools of martial arts were as thorough and widespread in Europe as they were in Japan in the 1500's through the 1600's. There were all kinds of flashy moves and clever tricks.

So the rules weave in this kind of option to do more than simply move-attack-resolve-repeat. More than just strict combat options, the Swashbuckling rules allow you to be more interactive with your terrain. It opens up more of the game to narrative, or story-telling wargaming. All of which is part of the great Songs engine, of course. With Flashing Steel we have tried to extend and strengthen that side of the system. -Andrew Boswell, designer

108327.description:
Massive combat walkers tread the streets, armored troops storm the buildings of Southern England, and Dust Tactics pushes deeper into urban warfare with the campaign expansion Operation "Cerberus", which features:


New rules for multilevel combat. Squads can move up and down floors of the structures they enter, gaining advantages as they fire against foes outside the walls. This campaign expansion comes with parts for a customizable three-dimensional building, allowing players to construct terrain up to three stories tall.
New skills for NCO Command Squads and heavy walkers.
Two new heroes: The Axis assassin, Angela, and the Chef, who fights with two flamethrowers.
A chronology of the alternate-reality World War II and profiles some of the war's greatest heroes.
Seven new scenarios.

publishers: The United States Playing Card Company
108332.description: Trivia game featuring questions relating to The Young and the Restless TV series. Each card has 6 categories. A die is rolled and that indicates the question subject to be answered,

name.#text: Soap Opera Challenge: The Young and the Restless

108338.description:
Goal: Be the first to race to position '100' (alpine cabin with a warm welcome)

Typical 'Snakes and Ladders' game from the 30's in Germany

Roll the die by turns and step forward - until you will be transported
nice & cute, individually designed pawns

Cover/design according spirit of the time (in Germany)

108341.description:
In a mysterious world of swords and sorcery, you are the chief (or the nurse) of a temple hospital. Around the world, heroes entered dangerous dungeons in search of fame and fortune. Your job is to nurse and make better all of these heroes from injuries, sickness, and curses of underworld. But watch out! Rival hospitals are waiting for the chance to get in your way. Will you manage to earn the world's respect as a master doctor? Or will you end up as an infamous "dynamite nurse"?

In Dynamite Nurse Returns, a card game with deck-building mechanisms, players represent hospitals that are trying to cure wounded heroes. Each hospital has only so many beds, however, and having too many patients will result in players not being able to take care of them. Thus, players try to dump annoying patients onto each other in order to stay famous as a good hospital chief – and not as the "dynamite nurse"...

Dynamite Nurse Returns is based on two card games from the 1980s – Dynamite Nurse and Dynamite Nurse 2: Bloody Temple – from the same designer.
108341.name: Dynamite Nurse

families: TCS Battles of the Middle Ages System
108343.description:
Print & play wargame on the most important battle of the period for Central Europe, forging the domain of Hapsburgs over Bohemia for several centuries to come.
It is part of the Battles of the Middle Ages series, a simple to medium complexity system, with variable activation based on chit pulling, variable unit strength (with a system similar to SPI's Victory in the West series), low unit density and high mortality.
Special rules for commander, charges, missile units, make the game a good introduction to wargaming, without being too difficult or too dumb

name.#text: Battles of the Middle Ages: Marchfeld

108344.description:
In Might & Magic Heroes: The Board Game, each player becomes a leader of one of four different factions hoping to conquer and govern the realms of Ashan.

At first, players control just one hero, a small army, and a city — but with every passing round, their heroes gain experience and grow in power, armies become more numerous, and small towns turn into enormous capitals. Players recruit new characters, take control of mines that produce resources and gold for their factions, defeat monsters prowling the game board, and search for magical artifacts. As time passes, they inevitably approach the final confrontation of great, magical kingdoms. The winner must prove that his faction is the best developed, boasting many heroes, multiple armies and a large capital. Whoever manages to acquire the most power becomes the new heir and the supreme ruler of the realm of Ashan — and by achieving this wins the game!
108344.name: Might & Magic Heroes

108348.description:
Fields of Battle is a simple tabletop wargaming ruleset published in Warlock Magazine issue #12. The game is designed to introduce Fighting Fantasy gamebooks readers to tabletop gaming.

The rules are derived from the Fighting Fantasy rules: each unit has a STRIKE and a STRENGTH rating (which work like FF's SKILL and STAMINA), and a MOVE and ATTACK score. Move is the distance the unit can move in inches, Attack the number of attacks per turn (most units have only one).

Each game turn, units move or fire, then combat between units in contact is resolved (each unit adds a 2d6 roll to its STRIKE rating, the unit with the lowest result loses 2 points of STRENGTH). After combat resolution, units that have suffered losses must pass a morale test or rout. A routing unit must test morale again in the next turn and is removed from the game if it fails that second test.

The rules also include a few special rules for flank attacks, cover, fortifications and siege engines.

The rules come with a scenario (The Battle of Grey Rock) for which colour counters are included in the magazine.

108355.description:
Market Mayhem is a simple Fighting Fantasy-inspired boardgame published in Warlock Magazine issue #3: http://rpggeek.com/rpgissue/49833/warlock-issue-3-volume-1-n...

The game takes place in the marketplace of Port Blacksand (the city of thieves in the Fighting Fantasy universe). One of the players is chosen to be the gamemaster, each of the other players is given a character with a secret objective. The gamemaster controls non-playing characters and is the only one to know each character's goal. Each character has three stats (SKILL, STAMINA and MOVE), some of them have extra rules, like a spell they can cast or a magic item they can use.

Each turn, players move their character on the board, then characters adjacent to each other can interact, often by fighting but other interactions are possible (like exchanging objects, talking...). Combat is resolved using standard Fighting Fantasy rules.

The goal of the game is to be the last character standing, having fulfilled his/her objective.

108360.description:
Risqué version of Charades. The fun is in the subject matter and probably best played by teenagers a and older.
As the box says, can you handle;
Free Willy (Movie)
Sexual Healing (Song)
Naked Gun (Movie)
and they get a lot more suggestive than that!
"Rude You Win, Prude You Lose"

108364.description:
The pieces are scattered at the start of all the squares except the finish squares. In corners only movement to adjacent squares is allowed. In central zones pieces may jump over each other with the exception of the four central squares that allow travel diagonally.

Player who moves all his game-pieces to his finish-corner is the winner.

Carré 2000 is available in two versions: the small version with nine pieces per player, and the larger version with twenty-five pieces per player.

108366.description:
"No Safe Port" is a board game covering Operational and Tactical-level naval combat during the Second World War.

"No Safe Port" is designed to cover many of the major navies that fought during WW2 and includes submarines, carriers, aircraft, battleships, battlecruisers, heavy cruisers, light cruisers, destroyers, coastal batteries, land units, and more. User printable data/record sheets show the combat details of each individual class of ship, sub, and aircraft, each with a side view graphic. Solitaire and multiplayer rules are included.

This is a significant revision of the original 'NW:WW2' game series, and adds additional details and rules to the system (including floatation loss and individualized weapon data). The Rules are modular, allowing for Basic, Advanced, and Optional/Expanded rules systems that you can choose to use or not as you wish.

This game is professionally printed with mounted couters and full color heavy cardstock maps. The 'data cards' from the previous game series has been discarded in favor of user-printable data sheets on a CD-ROM included with the game; each sheet contains combat logs for up to 7 ships/subs or squadrons of aircraft.

Features include:


Countries included: United States, Great Britain, Germany, France, Japan, Italy, Soviet Union, Australia, Denmark, and Netherlands.



Detailed yet streamlined combat mechanics including basic, advanced, optional, and solitaire rules.



Data CD-ROM with fully printable data/record sheets covering 230 ship classes (including merchants, raiders, and transports), 100+ aircraft models, 35 submarine classes, 16 types of land units.



Each printable Data/Record Sheet contains the combat statistics for the unit, condensed combat tables to help during combat, a side view of the unit, with logs for ammunition/damage records for 7 ships/subs or aircraft squadrons pre-printed on each sheet.



58 page printed Rules Manual with 24 scenarios, including historical and hypothetical scenarios.



9 Color maps 11" x 17", a color combat matrix, and 280 die-cut 1/2" color counters.



Search Matrix, 2 Play Sequence charts and 5 color reference charts.



Includes 4 six-sided dice (only standard 6-sided die are used for play).



Semi-historical Campaigns covering the Pacific, North Atlantic, Mediterranean, and Arctic theatres.



Tactical and Operational battles covering surface combat, seaplane carriers, convoys, submarines, aircraft, amphibious operations, bombardments, etc...



Combat examples are included as well as condensed combat tables on each unit data/record sheet.



The game is inteded to be played either as as a board game or with miniatures.

name.#text: No Safe Port: WW2 Naval Warfare

108367.description:
The game covers the Polish-German war campaign of the first days of the World War II. Players can take command of the German Army trying to defeat Poland as fast as possible, or play as Polish generals struggling to stop the German Army.
One turn is one day of war.

Every turn is divided into 3 phases:
- logistics
- movement
- fighting

Box contents:
- Rulebook including 3 scenarios
- 2 Boards (map of Poland and tactical board)
- ca. 200 cards (weather cards, fighting cards)
- lots of counters

108368.description:
"Steel and Resolve" is part of our Naval Warfare series of next generation comprehensive naval wargames covering entire time periods of naval combat. Easy to learn yet fun to play and detailed for the scale represented thus giving quality combat results. "Steel and Resolve" is designed to cover many of the major navies that fought during WW1 and includes submarines, seaplane carriers, aircraft, dreadnoughts, pre-dreadnoughts, battlecruisers, armored cruisers, light cruisers, destroyers, coastal batteries, land units, and much more! User printable data/record sheets show the combat details of each individual class of ship, sub, and aircraft, each with a side view graphic. Solitaire and multiplayer rules are included.

This is a significant revision of the original "NW:Naval Warfare" series, and adds additional details and rules to the system (including floatation loss and individualized weapon data). The Rules are modular, allowing for Basic, Advanced, and Optional/Expanded rules systems.

This game is professionally printed with mounted couters and full color heavy cardstock maps. The 'data cards' from the previous game series has been discarded in favor of user-printable data sheets on a CD-ROM included with the game; each sheet contains combat logs for up to 7 ships/subs or squadrons of aircraft.

Features include:


Countries included: Britain, Germany, France, Russia, Italy, and Austria-Hungary.



Detailed yet streamlined combat mechanics including basic, advanced, optional, and solitaire rules.



Data CD-ROM with fully printable data/record sheets covering 200 ship classes (including merchants, raiders, and transports), 36 aircraft/airship types, 30 submarine classes, 12 types of land units.



Each printable Data/Record Sheet contains the combat statistics for the unit, condensed combat tables to help during combat, a side view of the unit, with logs for ammunition/damage records for 7 ships/subs or aircraft squadrons pre-printed on each sheet.



60 page printed Rules Manual with 20 scenarios, including the full Battle of Jutland.



6 Color maps 11" x 17", a color combat matrix, and 280 die-cut 1/2" color counters.



Search Matrix, 2 Play Sequence charts and 5 color reference charts.



Includes 4 six-sided dice (only standard 6-sided die are used for play).



Semi-historical Campaigns covering the North, Baltic, and Mediterranean Seas.



Tactical and Operational battles covering surface combat, seaplane carriers, convoys, submarines, aircraft, amphibious operations, bombardments, etc...



Combat examples are included as well as condensed combat tables on each unit data/record sheet.



The game is intended to be played either as as a board game or with miniatures.

name.#text: Steel and Resolve: WW1 Naval Warfare

108377.description:
Finally, the international space industry is beginning to grow! To encourage the development, global funds are awarding prizes to companies that are outstanding in different areas. You control one of those companies and want to compete for the biggest, best and most beautiful space station the world has ever seen. But the competition is hard...

In Space Station you start your space station with a core module card on the table, then over six years (rounds) you expand it by paying and placing new module cards. Each year you start with a five card hand, crew tokens and new MegaCredits (money), with the amount of crew and money determined by the structure of your space station. You use money primarily to pay for new modules, and the crew gives you special effects on many of your modules.

During the year, the players take turns doing actions such as building, using module actions, playing event cards, repairing or passing. When everyone passes, the year ends and victory points are awarded: There are six kinds (colors) of modules and for each kind, the player(s) with the most modules of that kind is awarded a victory point. Players' crew tokens are then reset, and player may discard a card beore refilling their hand and getting money for the next year.

At the end of the sixth year, the player with most victory point wins.

108381.description:
B.C. is a strategic tile laying game using elements of abstract strategy and deck building games to tell the story of four rival tribes battling it out for control of vital resources on the Pre-Historic earth of Leakey, Von-Daniken, and "Eegah!"

Each player takes control of one of four tribes: The Aliens, Great Apes, Homo Sapiens, or Neanderthals, and attempts to gain control of the largest part of the prehistoric landscape, as represented by a grid marked by variable terrain features. Each tribe begins with a small selection of Tiles, and then must spend further actions to place those Tiles and earn "Enlightenment Points", which can be spent on new tiles and new options for the game.

The game is over when there are no further plays left on the board. Victory goes to the Tribe whose player has taken control of the most sections of the board. In the case of a tie, victory is determined by the number of Enlightenment Points still controlled by the Tribes at the end of play.

108384.description:
A knight rider themed card game in which players try to build a road and then drive K.I.T.T. to safety. The game begins with each player playing a "Start" card, and placing their K.I.T.T. token upon it. Then, each player draws a card. The player with the highest number card wins all of the other cards, and then may do one of four things:
1. Build a section of their road by playing a card horizontally.
2. Move K.I.T.T. one space (if not hindered by a Hazard)
3. Play a Hazard card on another player's road
4. Play a Turbo Boost card to bypass a Hazard

The first player to build the correct length of road (7 units for 2p, 6 units for 3p and 5 units for 4p), play an "END MISSION" card, and drive K.I.T.T to the "END MISSION" card wins.

name.#text: Knight Rider: K.I.T.T. Challenge Card Game

108385.description:
Twenty-nine is a simple adding game played with traditional playing cards.

Are cards are dealt equally to all players, setting aside any remainder. Each player lays a card in turn, adding its face value to a communal total. (Aces and royals count as '1'.) The total cannot exceed twenty-nine; a player who has no legal play must pass. The player who brings the total to twenty-nine gets a point, and the total is reset to zero for the next player. When every player passes, the game is over. The player or partnership with the most points wins.

108387.description: An old roll-and-move type game. Per the publisher ... "A fun packed rally race game over rugged alpine mountains".

108392.description:
Speak and remember: can you introduce yourself properly and get the number of eyes, noses or ears right like all good Mishmashian Martians from planet Mishmash?

In this game, each player is a Martian. In the beginning of the game, each player receives a portrait, which indicates how many eyes, ears and noses he has.

Each turn, a player plays a card with an eye, ear or nose on it. He then has to call another player, using a prescribed phrase which includes the count of eyes (or ears, or noses, depending on the card place) the calling player and the called player have.

If a player gets the phrase wrong (or hesitates to long), he gets an extra eye, ear or nose (again depending on the card played) which is added to his forehead by means of a ribbon each player wears on his head. This extra feature has to be taken into account in future turns.

If a player gains his fifth additional ear, eye or nose, he is out of the game. The last player to remain wins.

108396.description: Konsensus is an imaginative and innovative board game in which you try to put yourself in the mindset of the other players and answer the same as them. You are faced with a series of tasks that may seem easy, but quickly becomes difficult because your brain is affected by visual impressions, feelings, and imagination. Can you link it all together and find the answers that will earn you points?

108402.description:
The goal is to get an egg in the nest opposite the central square of the first line in the 9x12 grid game board.
Players move his eggs.

The movement of the eggs is determined by the line where they are at the time to move.
At start egg may move one square straight, Once an egg is above the fifth line, its possibilities are largely increased. It can move straight or diagonally one square. It can also move faster to a number of spaces determined by the number of eggs on his line.

108403.description:
There is a 8 balls for each player, 9 white balls and one black ball in 5x5 grid game board (26 balls)

In his turn player pushes a row with the 26th ball, placing a ball in front of this row leaving a ball from the end of the same row to be the 26th ball.

The goal is to achieve an alignment of five balls of their color or 4 balls of their color and the black ball, which acts as a wildball.

108405.description:
A music trivia game (think Music-themed Trivia Pursuit)!

A diamond disc race ensues between players! They can be earned directly on the "Diamonds" boxes or exchanged for a 5 vinyl discs.

The questions are all in the form of multiple choice and offer 3 major categories: 'Reprises', "Artists' and 'screens and boards"

Each player has 2 pawns of the same colour, which go through the corridors of the plateau board, in an inward-spiraling player track. The questions trace the life of french and international hits in categories of Top 50, rap, rock, etc... from 1984 to present day.

name.#text: Muz Hit: Le Jeu du top!

108406.description:
Fire and Water, the raging elements, play the main roles in this clever tactical game for 2 to 4 players. Who will get the upper hand? With the unrestrained strength of the elements on one hand, and with the help of the tender elementals on the other, a clever player will direct the outcome of the struggle of the elements and become the Master of the Elements...

Each turn, players have to decide whether to increase their influence by placing an appropriate marker or to secure their square by placing a possession token. But then, there are the elementals who can't be conquered with pure strength...

The player who can place all his possession tokens wins the game.

This game was released as a PnP game on October 26th 2011, the author's 38th birthday.

This game came in the final round (i.e. Top 12) of the Hippodice contest 2012.
108406.name: Feuer & Wasser

108415.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Fame and Fortune expansion for Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game provides players with new game options, and brings a host of enhancements.


Four new civilizations: The Arabs, the Spanish, the Greeks, and the Indians.



A new deck of "Great Person" cards that allows players to recruit the aid of specific figures from history, such as Joan of Arc, Marco Polo, Hannibal, or Gustavus Adolphus.



New map tiles, tech cards, culture event cards, and the introduction of the investment deck, which features cards that allow players to spend hard-earned coin to reap ongoing benefits.



Components for a fifth player.


With eleven new map tiles, over 150 cards, plus more than 120 markers and tokens, Fame and Fortune offers a remarkable set of engaging new options to guide your people to greatness!

New Faction Microbadges:

- Civ - I am a Greek Fan
- Civ - I am an Arabs Fan
- Civ - I am a Spanish Fan
- Civ - I am an Indians Fan
108415.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: Das Brettspiel – Ruhm und Reichtum

108420.description:
Overview

R.I.G.S. has players acting as newly appointed future captains of industry on a newly colonized world. Within a set period of a time, they must generate, trade, and gather as much wealth as possible with the holder of the most wealth being the controller of industry for this colony. This won't be a trivial task. The world experiences strange weather, pirates and gangs loot, and other players get revenge for your own actions against them (or just simply doing better than they are). Technology isn't exactly your friend as the cranky and failure prone (Reconfigurable Industrial Gathering Systems) RIGS will produce but with the risk of spontaneously blowing up. Unfortunately, they are the key tools for industry... and the only one available.

Players are grant plots of land, survey the land for Luxuries (the only thing the rest of the universe wants), place RIGS on plots, and hope for the best as Disaster and other players strike. Weather the disasters that affect your production, resources, and RIGS. Manage to produce not only Luxuries, but other needed Energy, Metal, Supply resources to keep your operation running and growing. Then, sell the Luxuries on the ever-changing market. Make deals with other players for simple trades or pacts against other players. In the end, final value of all resources a player has (except RIGS... no one wants those troublesome things) is determined. The player with the greatest wealth wins.


Contents

Content Checklist
Rule Book


Decks

Plot Deck: 27 cards
Survey Deck: 27 cards
Karma Deck: 36 cards
Market Deck: 32 cards
Disaster Deck: 18 cards


Tokens

Energy Tokens x 50
Metal Tokens x 50
Supply Tokens x 50
Luxury Tokens x 50
RIGS Tokens x 75


Money

1 Credit Bill x 40
5 Credit Bill x 40
10 Credit Bill x 40
20 Credit Bill x 40
50 Credit Bill x 20
100 Credit Bill x 20


Vinnie (Loan) Script

Energy Vinnie Script x 20
Supply Vinnie Script x 20
Metal Vinnie Script x 20


Other

Six-sided die
108420.name: R.I.G.S.

108421.description:
The 7-card Nations Expansion for The Manhattan Project allows each player to play the role of a real-world nation (Britain, China, France, Germany, Japan, Soviet Union or USA) in the race to build the bomb!

Each card is essentially a "building" that is immune to Air Strikes and Espionage. This allows each nation to have its own unique ability throughout the game.

108422.description:
The board for this Edition is based on a map of Lyon.
As with other Ticket to Ride games, players are collecting sets of cards to claim routes necessary to complete destination tickets.

name.#text: Les Aventuriers du rail à Lyon (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

108423.description:
The Game of Little n Big!

Move the Slider Tiles to try to discover a Little Baby Tile that matches one of your Big Mommy Tiles. Reunite the most Big N Little pairs to win the game!

The box is a crucial part of the game setup. There is a tray which fits in the box, and the 25 Little Baby Tiles are placed randomly on the tray. A plastic punchout overlay sits on these tiles, and 24 slider tiles are placed on this with one space open. This will give you something similar to a Sliding Puzzle.

Players each have 3 face-up Big Mommy Tiles. On your turn, choose one of your face-up tiles and announce that you're looking for its associated Little Baby Tile. You get up to 5 slide-moves to try to find it. A slide-move consists of moving an adjacent Slider Tile into the open space. This will uncover a different Little Baby Tile where the tile used to be. You may continue sliding tiles until you either find the match for the Big Mommy Tile you named, or you have moved five Slider Tiles.

Tiles match if they have a Mommy and Baby of the same animal (the game rules includes pictures of all the matching sets). They also will have the upper and lower case versions of the same letter. If you uncover a match on your turn, take a "MATCH" Scoring Token and cover the Big Mommy Tile. Draw a new tile so you always have three face-up tiles.

After the last Big Mommy Tile is drawn, continue playing until the next MATCH is scored. The game ends immediately, and the player with the most matches wins!

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Concept of Big & Small, Upper & Lower Case Recognition, Memory & Matching

families: HABA My Very First Games series
108424.description:
There are six elements in the center of the table - 2 caps, 2 bodies and 2 pair of feet. The eight cards are placed in a pile on one side, face down. The nine chips are placed another side: they form the reserve.

The first player to win three rounds wins.

Cards are shuffled and dealt out one to three players, who do not watch them. Players turn them face-up together and try to find which element of elf must catch to win the race.
Two cases may arise:
- If the three elves have one thing in common is that element that must be caught.
- If no element is common to all three elfs appear, then there are three common each in two elves. Two of these elements are present on the same two cards. Then this is the third element that must be caught.
108424.name: Meine ersten Spiele: Würfelwichtel

108425.description:
Flames of War: Hellfire and Back! is a hardcover supplement for the Flames of War World War II miniatures game system. It is about the Early War battles in North Africa in 1940 and 1941. It contains armylists, scenarios, painting guides and background information about the battles that took place.

Armylists included in this book are:

Italian:
Compagnia Carri (Tank Company)
Compagnia Bersaglieri (Light Infantry Company)
Compagnia Motociclisti (Motorcycle Infantry Company)
Posizione de Fucilieri (Fortified Infantry Position)

German:
Leichte Panzerkompanie (Light Armoured Company)
Mittlere Panzerkompanie (Medium Armoured Company)
Schutzenkompanie (Rifle Company)
Panzerschutzencompanie (Armoured Rifle Company)
Kradschutzenkompanie (Motorcycle Rifle Company)
MG-Kompanie (Machine-Gun Company)
Leichte Pionierkompanie (Light Pioneer Company)
Infanteriekompanie (Infantry Company)
Stutzpunkt (Strongpoint)

British:
Armoured Regiment
Crusader Armoured Regiment
Honey Stuart Armoured Squadron
Armoured Car Squadron
Jock Column (a motorized infantry company)
Infantry Tank Company
Divisional Cavalry Squadron (of Australians or New Zealanders)
Rifle Company (of British or Indian Riflemen)
Commonwealth Rifle Company (of Australian, New Zealand or South African infantry)
Tobruk Strongpoint

In addition to the army lists included, there are rules on motorcycle reconnaissance, variable terrain, fortifications, plus the missions Tobruk Raid, Dust-up and Witch's Cauldron.

name.#text: Flames of War: Hellfire and Back!

108429.description:
Set in the latter half of the 18th century, Age of Reason (a.k.a. Zeitalter der Vernunft) makes players take on the role of regents for Great Britain, the Netherlands, France, Spain, Prussia, Austria and Russia who want to increase their home country's power in Europe while simultaneously establishing colonial empires in Africa, India and the Western Hemisphere.

One country working on its own will not be able to achieve its goals, so players must take part in shifting alliances, with whose help they hope to achieve their plans - or at least stave off direct competition from a potential enemy.

While Age of Reason can be played with only two players with the existing rules, the publisher recommends against this.
108429.name: Age of Reason

108430.description:
Fuentes de Onoro 1811 focus on the last events of the fight between Masséna and Wellington in Portugal and Spain. It includes three battles: Foz do Arouce, Fuentes de Oñoro and El Bodon 1811 which are thus be the 32nd, 33rd and 34th battles of the series.

The game is also the 6th entry in the Vae Victis Wargame Collection. The main battle, Fuentes de Oñoro, has an A2 map and the two smaller ones have A3 maps. The game include 216 counters and markers.

Foz do Arouce, 15th March 1811
The fight took place just after Redhina and Casal Novo but before Sabugal and Fuentes de Onoro, as Wellington followed Massena out of the lines of Torres Vedras. It included two popular British divisions, the 3rd and the Light. The French under Ney held a ridge with a river behind it that was crossed by a single bridge. The French ridge on their left was much higher than the one on the right. In the centre there was a gap of about 200 yards, occupied by the village of Foz d'Arouce. Some companies of the 95th rifles penetrated down a hollow road there, almost unopposed, quite close to the bridge. The rest of the Light division held Marchand in a frontal fight on the French right. Half of Mermet’s division on the French left faced the 3rd Division. The 39th lost its eagle in the river as they tried to cross a deep ford below the bridge, and many men were drowned.

Fuentes de Oñoro, 3rd to 5th May 1811
On the 3rd of May, Masséna launched a frontal assault against the British-Portuguese pickets holding the barricaded village, while subjecting the British-Portuguese on the heights east of the village to a heavy artillery bombardment. The village was the centre of the fighting for the whole day, with French soldiers of Ferey's and Marchand's divisions clashing with the British redcoats of the 1st and 3rd Divisions. May 4 saw little combat. Both sides recovered from the ferocity of the previous day of fighting and reconsidered their options and battle plans. A French reconnaissance revealed that Wellington's right flank was weakly held by a unit of partisans near the hamlet of Pozo Bello. Action began again at dawn on the 5th of May. Wellington had left the 7th Division exposed on his right flank. Masséna launched a heavy attack on the weak British-Portuguese flank, led by Montbrun's dragoons and supported by the infantry divisions of Marchand, Mermet and Solignac. Right away, two 7th Division battalions were roughed up by French light cavalry. This compelled Wellington to send reinforcements to save the 7th Division from annihilation. This was only achieved by the efforts of the Light Division and the British and King's German Legion cavalry. In response, Wellington counterattacked with units from the 1st and 3rd Divisions, plus the Portuguese 6th Caçadores. Led by the 88th Connaught Rangers Foot, this effort broke Drouet's attack and the tide began to turn. Low on ammunition, the French had to resort to the bayonet in a futile attempt to drive the British back. Drouet launched a second attack on the town. This time it was led by three battalions of converged grenadiers from IX Corps. With their old-fashioned bearskin hats, the grenadiers were mistaken for the Imperial Guard. Again, the British fell back. Drouet threw in about half of the battalions from both Conroux and Claparède's divisions, seizing almost the entire town. The French artillery tried to bombard the new British line into submission, but they were outgunned by Wellington's cannon. Finally, with their artillery ammunition dangerously low, the French attacks came to an end. Wellington's men entrenched during the evening.

El Bodon 25th September 1811
The fight included a French cavalry force of 2500, against a mixed force of Picton’s 3rd Division consisting of 1000 men, 500 cavalry and two Portuguese batteries. The French attacked in 3 columns of cavalry with a 4th column in reserve, "since only parts of the hillside were open ground suitable for cavalry." The attack fell upon the isolated part of Wallace’s Brigade covering the road. As the French columns came up the slope they were attacked by Alten’s light cavalry one squadron at a time "with the slope in their favour.” The individual squadrons then rallied behind their supports. The British had to hold on, to allow time for the widely separated parts of 3rd Division to retire.

Fuentes de Onoro 1811 includes:

A 59 x 40 cm map,
216 double-sided die-cut counters and markers,
A color rulebook with scenarios and a player aid.




Units : Regiments and brigades
Map scale : 500 m/hex.
Turn : 120 minutes

Complexity : 6 / 9

Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).

108433.description:
Hoolihan is a game of luck, skill and chance. It was copyrighted in 1973 by Sam Reeves.

It captures all of the realism of the RODEO circuit because you choose your own events, pay entry fees, have small setbacks and win prize money just like the cowboys on the Rodeo circuit. Events include Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Calf Roping, Steer Wrestling , Team Roping and Bull Riding.

There are 5 rodeos that you enter all across the Southwest with the object of being the largest winner of cash at the end of the rodeo season.

Scoring of events is that are timed events is dependent of the spin of a spinner. Some events are judged events and you win by picking a correct card

108439.description:
Card game with a sexual pleasures theme. The goal is to collect 69 pleasure points. This can be reached by getting involved into different kinds of sexual activities.
Each player represents a male or a female character. During the game, a player can get a relationship with an opposite sex card (no same sex possibilities in the rules, although it might be adapted). In each turn, a player plays three cards and draws three new cards. Cards can be played on oneself or on opponents or their partners. Card effects can be positive, as in having sex or making up etc., or negative, blocking others. When a sexual act card is played, one or two dice are rolled and the result is added to the pleasure point total of the player, until one of them has reached a total of 69 points.

108456.description:
Designed by Tadatoshi Jinbo.

Covering the campaign between Genji and Heishi from Kyoto to Kyushu area in Juei 2nd.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genpei_War
The game engine is a card-driven and the map is divided into areas.
This game covers the period from battle of Ujigawa to the end of the campaign. Due to the period and the map, the battles are fought around Seto-inside sea.
1 map
80 counters
4 pages rulebook
30 cards
108456.name: Battle of GenPei, ran of Juei

108458.description: Each player controls a scoop, made in the likeness of a pig. Marbles are released into a central reservoir and the player must direct his pig's tongue in such a way that it 'licks up' a marble and then the player must carefully take that marble to his storage area. The player with the most marbles after they have all been taken, is the winner.

108459.description:
The Strat-o-matic line of games simulates sports games with dice and cards for the individual players. The player cards have the odds of events that happen during the course of the game. The dice are used to determine the outcomes of events according to odds on the cards of the players involved. For example, in baseball, a plate appearance involves a pitcher and batter and the outcome determined by the dice can range from an out to a home run. The game can be played head to head or solo. Games can be simulated or even entire seasons.

The game contains 42 cards that represent various Major League Baseball players during the peak of their careers. Players must use their managing abilities to gain an edge in a game that uses cards to represent both pitcher and batter, charts to represent fielders, and dice to represent the bat and pitches.

Baseball express is a slimmed down version of Strat-o-matic Baseball (both in play and size). This set includes 43 All Star player cards, 4 dice (3d6 and 1d20), 4 game markers, instructions, and playing tray.

108464.description:
From the back of the Booklet:

"Squad Leader, Avalon Hill's game of tactical combat in the second world war, together with its companion games Cross of Iron, Crescendo of Doom and GI, Anvil of Victory, is one of the most popular wargames of all time. Now, World Wide Wargamers, in association with Avalon Hill, offer 10 more scenarios for the Squad Leader series. These varied and exciting scenarios include commando raids, bitter rearguard actions, combat in the snowy wastes of the north, river assaults and much more. Designed by Andy Bagley, Simon Haines, and Courtney Allen, doyen of SL scenario designers, these scenarios have been specially created to capture the fullest excitement of Squad Leader, Cross of Iron, Crescendo of Doom and GI, Anvil of Victory."

The following scenarios are included:

81: A BRIDGE TOO NEAR; April 21st, 1940; Verdal, Central Norway
82: TO LOSE A BATTLE; May 16th, 1940; Clairfayts, France
83: THE FINAL ATTEMPT; May 22nd, 1940; Cambrai, France
84: LE PARADIS; May 26th, 1940; Le Paradis, France
85: THE FAR BANK; July 7th, Ulla, Russia
86: RAID ON VAAGSO; December 27th, 1941; South Vaagso, Norway
87: THE BRUNEVAL RAID; February 28, 1942; Channel Coast
88: THE BACKWATER OF WAR; May 6th, 1942; Near Kestenga, Northern Russia
89: CHERKASSKOYE; July 5th, 1943; Cherkasskoye, Russia
90: THE BRIDGE AT KANEV; September 23rd, 1943; Kanev, Russia

This collection of scenarios had a lower standard of production than the original in-box sets.
The actual games tried to set some more novel scenarios. The Raid on Bruneval being particualrly good.

108465.description:
Fluchmory, an auditory memory game, is played with 24 cards and 24 tiles, which come in pairs. On each pair, a proverb is printed (both on the card and on the tile).

At the start of the game, the tiles placed face-down on the table in a grid, and the cards are shuffled placed face-down in a stack. The first player draws the first card and reads its text out loud. Now, the players take turns picking up one tile (without showing it to the other players) and reading the text out loud. If the player has found the tile matching the card, he keeps the tile, and the next card is read. Otherwise, the tile is returned to its spot on the table, face-down.

The game ends when all tiles have been claimed. The player who has collected the most tiles wins.

110921.description:
The topic chips for human - natural - heavenly - terrestrial are sorted and laid out as stated in the rules, as are the randomly chosen and shuffled obstacle tiles. These obstacles can only be mastered by discarding of topic chips. The questions cards are sorted in order of the topics, but if so desired can be shuffled.

In your turn you are the questioner, you draw the front card and name the topic, the facts, the questions and all answers. Then all players in turn choose and name one of the answers. Then the correct answer is read. If you answered correctly you can either move your pawn or take a corresponding topic chip from stock. If you reach a face-down topic chip first, you get it. If all answer wrong, the questioner gets a chip. If you answer correctly "all wrong", you move one step and get a chip. A spot containing an obstacle tile may only be entered if you can discard 2 corresponding topic chips. The rules also provide for players who have dropped back very far.

108474.description:
Play golf on the mini table and get Your balls in the holes with smallest number of kicks.

Contents:

1 Plastic pool table
1 Plastic pool ball rack
1 Metal golf club
2 White weighted golf balls

108475.description: Each player (or team) tries to answer as many questions as possible, in order to be the first to advance from the start and around the playing board back to finish. The first player to do this is the winner of the game.

108482.description: Rummz Z is played with 106 tiles which correspond to two decks of cards, including two jokers. The regular suites - Clubs, Spades, Hearts and Diamonds - are replaced by four colors bearing numbers 1 through 13 consecutively. The numbers, 1, 11, 12, and 13 replace the Ace, Jack, Queen and King respectively. The primary object of each round is to be the first to play all of your tiles from your rack to the table. The secondary objective is to hold as few points as possible at the end of each round. The winner of the game is the player to first score minus 1000 points.

108490.description: Monopoly-like game produced for the Indian market. Includes an additional four games. Properties are Indian locations and prices are in rupees.

108492.description:
In Slag om Amersfoort (Battle for Amersfoort) the players try to conquer the Dutch city of Amersfoort. The game is situated in the 16th century, when the forces of field marshal Maarten van Rossum occupied the city.

Every turn, players can try to have one of their pawns enter the city. Then they roll the dice to move the pawns that are already in a city. Whenever pawns of different players are on the same spot, the players roll the dice to fight. The losing pawn is thrown out of the city. Instead of moving their pawns, a player can also try to answer a trivia question to "acquire" the location of one of their pawns.

The game ends when one of the players has acquired the four location on their secret mission card. Alternatively, the game can also end when a certain number of pawns have been ejected from the city; in this case Maarten van Rossem wins, together with the player who won the most fights.

Rules for a simplified game for children "Amersfoort op Drakenpoten" (Amersfoort on Dragon's Feet) are also included.

108493.description:
Dirty Dice is a Dice-Within-A-Dice game for gambler lovers! There are 4 types of ways to play Dirty Dice:
Blanket Craps
Twenty-One
Dirty Casino Craps
Upsmanship

"Twenty-One" - Players takes turn with both dice. Each player gets one roll per turn and every roll produces a score.
2 "outer dice" totals count as "plus" score. 2 "inner dice" totals as "minus" score. So the "inner dice" must substract from the total of "outer dice". The object of the game is to accumulate a score of "21" first. Either +21 or -21.

For Craps variants look at the game Craps

108523.description:
This is a tactical space combat game in the Warriors of the Dark Star: The Age of the Neutron Wars series, and includes the second edition rulebook for that game (as a series rulebook).

From a GFG catalog (reproduced verbatim):


This pits the Fast Omega Ship "Formidable" Class, their Deadly Alpha Battleship "Victorious" Class, and their Fast Beta Battle Cruiser "Vengeance" Class, against the "Odin" and "Thor" Class Dreadnaught with its Monadian Web and the Thor Battleships' Death Ray and Satellite Defensive systems. This game consists of a reliving of the Famous Battles with the Great Admirals, Star Marshals, and Battleship Conmanders in various Historical Engagements that occurred during the Monad Wars - the Exploits of the Black Prince, the Xenon Battle Cruiser "ACE" that had 20 "kills" to his Credit, etc. Includes the Famous Scenario "The Charge Against the Monad Star Base", and the "Battle of Masters". This Game is the Companion Game to the BFA game "Star Wars of the Xenon Empire". Vengeance Crusaders is the opposite of Sun Slayers: it is the active seeking of enemy vessels and smashing them in individual encounters and small fleet engagements. In the first game the knowledge of weapons systems is vital; in this one Maneuver is paramount - weapons only second!

108524.description:
Miniature Wargame Rules for Warfare in the Age of Transition 1861-1871

Zouave 2 is a revised version of Zouave, a member of the Repique System, and the latest miniatures rule set by Bob Jones of Piquet fame.

Unlike Zouave, Zouave 2 uses a rondel system for command control.

The game offers command level and grand tactical options, for 6mm to 28mm miniatures.

The period covers the ACW, but also the Franco Prussian War, 1866 and the Maximilian Adventure.

108525.description:
Horse and Musket miniatures rules for the period 1700 to 1900.

This is an innovative set of miniatures rules that uses both cards and dice to control various aspects of tactical battles, designed by Bob Jones of Piquet and Zouave fame.

Play templates are provided to enable several wars within the period to be played immediately, while the players can easily adapt and modify other periods or even the base rules.

The rules allow for a tactical scale battle and will work with most figure sizes, with the emphasis on 28mm.

Update: The game has been reissued as Die Fighting II with many improvements and new mechanisms. It is now in a Enhanced DVD Multimedia format which includes a 1 hour professionally produced and chaptered video; a slide show in both PDF and Quick Time Movie formats, and printable PDFs which include templates for a wide variety of periods from 1699-1902, player aids, Phase cards,a Rule Summary keyed to the video and slide show, and several other player aids.

110931.description:
Objective: Try to (visit and) solve as many accidents as possible - collecting points/acting by turns

1 There are accidents - spread all over the board
2 If your die shows a 'five' - your car may start
3 Choose a route on which you can solve these accidents as quick as possible
3 Game ends if the last accident was followed up

102741.description:
From the Publisher's Website,

"Written by Barry Hill, Gladiator enables players to recreate the brutal arena combat of the Roman Empire on the wargames table.

This full colour 144 page hardback rulebook contains rules for gladiatorial arena contests featuring human combatants, wild animals, elephants and chariots as well as mass battle spectacles and mock sea battles. Full rules and background are provided for gladiators of both the Imperial and Republican eras, along with ten action-packed scenarios and a detailed campaign system that allows rival gladiatorial schools to compete in several different periods of Roman history.

The Gladiator rulebook is packed with inspirational photography and a detailed hobby section covering collecting, assembling and painting gladiatorial miniatures.

The Gladiator rulebook contains:

Full rules for movement, shooting and combat as well as rules for including wild animals, elephants and chariots in your games.

Rules and background for gladiators of both the Republican and Imperial eras.

A brief history of gladiatorial combat.

Ten action packed scenarios.

Rules for the naumachiae - gladiatoral sea battles!

Rules for Roman chariot racing, including the famous chariot race featured in Ben Hur.

A detailed campaign system for developing your fighters, including rules for setting your campaigns during different periods of Roman History.

Inspiring photographs and hobby section for reference when collecting and painting your gladiator miniatures."

name.#text: Gladiator: Deadly Arena Combat in Ancient Rome

108546.description:
Another 16 scenarios from the East Side Gamers and an additional 2 bonus scenarios. From the publisher:

01. #53) "MAD MIKE'S" PART TWO - Mogaung, Burma, June 7, 1944
02. #54) PULSE OF STEEL - East of Lvov, Poland, July 17, 1944
03. #55) PHILIPPINE FIREMEN - Binalonan, Luzon, Philippines, December 24, 1941
04. #56) COST OF ALLEGIANCE - Hohenruppersdorf, Austria, April 12, 1945
05. #57) MADAGASCAR SNAKE PIT - East of Majunga, Madagascar, September 21, 1942
06. #58) THE VINDICATORS - Floridia, Sicily, September 8, 1943
07. #59) SPEED KILLS - Izyum Bulge, South of Lozovaya, Russia, May 18, 1942
08. #60) GROUPEMENT MOLINIE'S HONOR - Lille Pocket, France, May 29, 1940
09. #61) THE 24 HOUR PASS - South of Thebes, Greece, April 25, 1941
10. #62) STOP GAP - Velletri Gap, Anzio Beachhead, Italy, May 25, 1944
11. #63) ARMOR TACTICS 101 - Ochota, Poland, September, 1939
12. #64) HACK AND MANGLE - Sverdlikovo, Russia, August 2, 1941
13. #65) OUTFLANKED - Sebemji-Mantusovo, Russia, July 3, 1942
14. #66) STRONGARMED - Ubach, Germany, October 4, 1944
15. #67) KEEP'EM SEPARATED - Lydavenai, Lithuania, June 23, 1941
16. #68) ATTACK PLAN "R" - Shkoder, Albania, April 8, 1941

BONUS SCENARIOS:
DEFENDING NORWEGIAN WOODS - MwTW lst PLACE - Rom, Norway, April 13, 1940
DOORWAY TO NORWAY - MwTW 3rd PLACE - Rom, Norway, April 13, 1940

108547.description:
A scenario pack of 12 scenarios. From the publisher:

01. #69 BRUSHWOOD BUZZSAW - Casablanca, French Morocco, November 10, 1942
02. #70 OPENING THE BURMA ROAD - Northeast of Lungling, Yunnan Province, China, November 1, 1944
03. #71 OBLITERATION - Bessang Pass, Northwestern Luzon, Philippines, May 17, 1945:
04. #72 BRUTALITY ALLEY - Berezovka, South of Kursk, Russia, July 15, 1943
05. #73 ORGY OF GORE - Duenaburg, Latvia, July 19, 1944
06. #74 SCORPIONS IN A BOTTLE - Slonin, Russia, June 24th, 1941
07. #75 CHOPPED OFF AT THE KNEES - La Macta, Algeria, November 9, 1942
08. #76 NEHRING'S ROVING CAULDRON - Gaffron, Steinau Bridgehead, Oder River, Germany, February 2, 1945
09. #77 THE TROUBLE WITH TITO - Trnovska Mountains, Slovenia, December 19, 1944
10. #78 CARRIER ASSAULT ON POPLAR RIDGE - Poplar Ridge, Esquelmes, Belgium, May 21, 1940
11. #79 BLASTING THROUGH - Hill 300, 3 Miles South of La Coucourde, France, August 25, 1944
12. #80 ARCTIC AMBUSH - Between Lakes Verehneye and Motti, Finland, December 6, 1943

110934.description:
Objective: Be the first to move your car over the finish line
(field 90)
Simple 'roll and move' GDR game learning traffic signs and rules
as typical for comparable products: Individual meeples (cars) and detailed coloured map

108554.description:
"Use superpowers to recreate the back-and-forth struggle between Hero and Villain! Pitting Brawn, Speed, and Wits against one another as you chase mayhem around the city-grid."

This is a small box 'filler' game.

The game starts by randomly dividing the 18 cards, of which there are 9 green villain cards and 9 white hero cards. Whichever color you get a majority of will determine which Super you are. (You play cards of both colors, and you always know exactly which cards your nemesis has remaining in hand)

The Board is a 6x6 grid and each round the dice are used to find a space on it where 'Mayhem' happens. Players move and play a card face down after the first die roll (before the exact location of Mayhem is known), and then move again after the second die roll.

Players can end in 3 configurations- Sharing a space, one player at the mayhem, or neither player at the mayhem. Each configuration results in 1 of 3 showdowns (Brawn, Speed, and Wits, respectively) where cards resolve differently.
-Sometimes the high card wins, sometimes a Decoy wins, and sometimes cards of the same color are lost.

Victorious cards are set by one side of the board, and defeated cards are set by another. Win when there are 5 victory cards of your color, or 5 defeated cards of your nemesis' color.

The object of the game is to anticipate what your opponent will do, and to trick him into thinking he knows what you're up to.

108559.description:
Volume 4, Number 1 of Critical Hit Magazine comes with new expansions for Advanced Squad Leader.

Included are the following articles:
- Fighting Soldiers from the Sky (ASL paradrops)
- Big Cat's Den (Designer Notes and play notes for that scenario)
- Cold Reception (Scenario replay of that scenario)
- Dictum Concentrate (ASL strategy article)
- SW Teams and MG Crews (variant rules)
- The Weapons Pit (variant rules)

There is also a countersheet with a few new vehicles and the "Weapons Pit"

Also, it contains the following scenarios:
CH73: THE STAND OFF; 18 September, 1941; Outside of Romny, Russia
CH74: TROTEVAL FARM; 24 July, 1944; Near Verrieres, France
CH75: THE BIG CAT'S DEN; 19 August, 1944; St. Lambert-Sur-Dives, France
CH76: HURTGEN HELL; 6 October 1944; Hurtgen Forest, Germany
CH77: DROP ZONE A; 24 March 1945, Two miles west of Hamminkeln, Germany
CH78: THE OUTSKIRTS OF LEMBERG; 12 September 1939; Lemberg, Poland
CH79: BAR's AGAINST PANZERS; 26 December 1944; Verdenne, Belgium
CH80: CUT THE LINE; 17 December 1941; Route 1 near Ragay, Bicol Peninsula, the Philippines

108560.description:
Volume 4, No. 2 of Critical Hit's ASL Magazine containing articles about Advanced Squad Leader and 8 new scenarios.

Included are the following articles:
- Aussie '97 Pack Designer Notes
- Magical History Tour (a comparison of the Baraque de Fraiture map with the actual landscape in France)
- ASL SSR Walkaround (a collection of Special Scenario Rules from various sources)
- Semovente 90 da 53 (a history article about that AFV)

The magazine contains the following scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader:
PBP#19: HOUSE OF PAIN; 21 July 1943; Gerbini, Sicily
PBP#20: HARD TO KILL; 24 December 1944; Freineux, Belgium
ASL NEWS#2: AN ABORTED COUNTER ATTACK; 11 July 1943; Favarotta, Sicily
PB-CH (A): ON DEADLY GROUND; 6 April 1943; Roumana Ridge, Tunisia
PB-CH (B): POWDERWORDS; 11 August 1942; Ulyanovo, Russia
PB-CH (C): BALKAN DAWN; 6 August 1942; Livno, Hercegovina
CH#81: HARD CACTUS; 16 February 1943; Sbeitla, Tunisia
CH#82: MY GOD, DID YOU SEE WHO THEY WERE ...; 16 February 1941; Nofilia, Libya

108561.description:
Volume 5, No. 1 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine. It contains articles, variant rules and new scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader.

The following articles are included:
- Preparing for Battle (a strategy article about setup)
- Kampfschweine Designer Notes (notes about scenario CH90)
- Platoon Leader 2.12 (latest version of the Platoon Leader Campaign Rules)
- Row well and Live (ASL River Assaults strategy article)
- Gammon Bombs (variant rules for this weapon)

The following 2-player scenarios are included:
CH90: KAMPFSCHWEINE; 25 April 1945; Brandenburg, Germany
CH91: LONG MINUTES; 23 May 1940; Selzaete, Belgium
CH92: PIONEER SPIRIT; 13 March 1943; Kharkov, Russia
CH93: THE PRUSSIAN WAY; 8 January 1942; Demyansk, Russia
CH94: THE ULLA CROSSING; 7 July 1941; On the banks of the Dvina River near Ulla, Russia
CH95: SHAMBLES; 19 August 1944; St Lambert Sur Dives, Normandy, France

Also, there is a new Platoon Leader Campaign Game:
PLFH: FROZEN HELL; 25 December 1939, Kelja, Finland

and a new Solitaire Mission:
DTW-1: RECON IN FORCE; 13 October 1942; Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works, Russia

108563.description:
Volume 5, No. 2 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine, containing articles and 8 new scenarios for use with Advanced Squad Leader.

The following articles are included:
- 1998 ASL Open (tournament report)
- Dads in World War II (history article)
- Combat (an introduction to the game "Combat")
- Introduction to TRBH (an introduction to "Those Ragged Bloody Heroes" ASL module)
- Aussie '98 Pack (strategy tips for this ASL scenario pack)

The following ASL scenarios are included:
PB-CH (D): KELLER'S HEROES; 23 May 1940; Guines, France
PB-CH (E): MORNING TRAFFIC; 20 May 1940; Amiens, France
PB-CH (F): BEDLAM BRIDGE; 19 September 1944; Arnhem, Holland
CH96: DC PARTY; 6 June 1944; "Dog White", Le Hamel-au-Pretere, Normandy, France
CH97: FINAL CRISIS AT BLACKPOOL; 24 May 1944; Near Namkwin, Burma
CH98: WELCOME TO SUNNY ITALY; 4 January 1944; Mount Porchia, Italy
CH99: PURPLE HEART CORNER; 11 July 1944; La Meauffe, France
CH100: DAWN OF A NEW AGE; 1 September 1939; Mokra, Poland

108564.description:
A special edition of Critical Hit's ASL magazine featuring articles, scenarios and a new campaign game with a map of the Stalingrad Grain Elevator.

The following articles are included:
- A chat with Mac & Charlie (interview with Bob McNamara and Charlie Kibler)
- Prinses Irene's Warriors (the famous Dutch brigade in ASL terms)
- Converting 15mm Miniatures to ASL (using miniatures in ASL)
- The Russian M1927 Regimental Howitzer (history article about that weapon)

The following 2-player scenarios are included:
TW-A: ZHOLUDEV'S GUARDS; 7 October 1942; Stalingrad, Russia
CH83: JUNGLES OF STONE; 6 March 1945; Near Hill 362B, Iwo Jima
CH84: EVERY MAN A FORTRESS; 14 September 1942; Stalingrad, Russia
CH85: A KICK IN THE PANTS; 22 January 1944; Sant' Angelo, Italy
CH86: THE BROKEN BLADE; 1 December 1942; Chouigui, Tunisia
CH87: ROLLING DOWN ROLLBAHN D; 17 December 1944; Honsfeld, Belgium
CH88: HANGMAN'S HILL; 18 March 1944; Monte Cassino, Italy
CH89: OLD MAN FORWARD; 26 April 1945; Brandenburg, Germany

The following solitaire mission is included:
xTW-1: KNIGHT'S CROSS; 15 October 1942; Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works, Russia

The following Campaign Game with a new ASL map is included:
CG-GE1: THE GRAIN ELEVATOR; 14 September 1942; Stalingrad, Russia

108565.description:
Volume 6, No. 1 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine, featuring articles and scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader.

The following articles are included:
- Arnhem: The Third Bridge (designer's notes for the ASL module of the same name)
- Tumult from the Skies (ASL air support rules explained)
- Tasty SALSA! (an article about the SALSA SASL computer program)
- Shout for PIATS (strategy article for that scenario)
- Carnage at Cassino (an introduction to that ASL module)

The following scenarios are included:
CH101: IN THE RUINS OF A CHURCH; 7 July 1944; Äyrapää, Finland
CH102: THE CAUQUIGNY BRIDGEHEAD; 6 June 1944; Cauquigny, Normandy, France
CH103: A SPLENDID COUNTERATTACK; 25 May 1940; North of Deynze, Belgium
CH104: SHOUT FOR PIATS; 27 June 1944; Le Haut du Bosq, Normandy, France
CH105: WIDE DIAMOND; 28 June 1944; Grainville-sur-Odon, Normandy, Frrance
CH106: THE BREAKTHROUGH; 28 June 1944; South of Grainville-sur-Odon, Normandy, France
CH107: TUMULT FROM THE CLOUDS; 9 April 1940; Sola-Stavenger, Norway
CH108: ASSAULT ON A PARTISAN HOME BASE (generic solitaire mission)

108566.description:
Volume 6, No. 2 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine, containing articles and scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader

The following articles are included:
- Intro to Stonne 1940 (introduction to the ASL module of the same name)
- The Making of Stonne 1940 (designer notes for the ASL module Stonne 1940)
- Scotland the Brave CG3 (an after action report of Campaign Game 3 played at Mad Vet Con)

The following 12 ASL scenarios are included:
Stonne#7: DOWN ON THE STREETS; 16 May 1940; Stonne, France
Stonne#8: SHATTERED LINES; 17 May 1940; Stonne, France
CH128: A FEW RARE MEN; 23 May 1940; Thulin, Belgium
CH129: ST HOMME SKIRMISH; 23 May 1940; St Homme Crossroads, Belgium
CH130: NO QUARTER AT QUENIAU; 23 May 1940; Le Queniau, Belgium
CH131: BLOOD BROTHERS; 31 May 1940; Burnes, France
CH132: DEFENSE OF ORPHANAGE FARM; 23 May 1940; East of Calais, France
CH133: GROUP IRON; 10 May 1940; Kannes, Belgium
CH134: STURMTRUPPEN; 11 November 1944; Goldap, East Prussia
CH135: THE RIVER DANCE; 1 September 1939; Brahe River, Poland
CH136: DESPERATE STAND; 25 December 1941; Stanley Village, Hong Kong Island
CH137: ASSAULT ON FORNEBU; 9 April 1940; Fornebu, Norway

It also contains two new Campaign Games for the Stonne 1940 game:
CGII: THE CRUSHER; 17 May 1940; Stonne, France
CGIII: INFERNO OF STEEL; 15 - 18 May 1940; Stonne, France

108567.description:
You are the leader of a team of adventurers, using special cards and scrolls to deploy your men. The goal is to get rid of your hand as quick as you can, dodging the dangers like dragons, golems and so on. Who will be the first to complete this quest?

Blanc Noir plays like a themed version of UNO as each card has a color and number, and on a turn a player can play a card matching either the color or number of the last played card. If he can't do so, he must draw a card from the deck. Cards with numbers higher than 9 have special powers, such as the standard Reverse and Draw actions, but also Scroll cards that are drawn from a separate deck and played for beneficial effects.

108569.description:
