In the Using Phase the child draws cards, if the answer is correct a chip is placed on the corresponding number.
In the Training Phase players hold 8 cards each and play one to top the card of the previous player, the cards do not show the result, only the question, so the children need to calculate.

110020.description: 5500 questions and answers in a new edition of the former noris quiz games, a new name and new graphics, the categories are: History & politics, nature and environment, sports & games, art & culture, heaven & earth, fairy tales and folk tales, technology & science, general knowledge. New is the possibility to advance on a money scale for correct answers.
110020.name: Das Familien-Quiz um Millionen

101829.description:
Free translation of the back of the box

At the gate of Raveleijn the adventure begins for Joost, Thomas, Emma, Lisa and Maurits. Here starts a dangerous excursion through the woods, on the way to free the city Raveleijn. As knights you fight together against malicious Graffers. Use your special strength to become as strong as possible for the ultimate fight.
In the final battle the powerful count Graveheart awaits you. Only the bravest knights survive this last fight.
Who becomes the hero of Raveleijn?

This family game was made to promote the new attraction 'Raveleijn' in the Efteling amusement park.

Goal of the game: Free Ravelijn city of the mean count Graveheart and his Graffers

Each player chooses a color and the accompanying character. Each character has a special characteristic that he can use in the fights against the Graffers.
On one side of the board you will fight against the Graffers by rolling the dice. Other players can come to help you. For each "hit" you get a card. After the defeat of all the Graffers (5), the board will be turned and you will prepare for the final fight against count Graveheart.
The player who has the smallest value with the obtained cards gives up his character and will play count Graveheart.
The obtained cards from the previous round will give you life points for this fight. The better you fought the Graffers, the stronger you are to fight count Graveheart!!
Each time you can beat the count in a fight, you will get a coin. As soon as the count looses all his life points, the player that has the majority of the coins wins the game.
Count Graveheart wins the game if he can defeat all other players.

110022.description: The children are little gardeners and try to have as good a harvest as possible in their garden. Each has his own garden with 9 squares, in the middle of the table there are 12x3 vegetable cards, 4 watering cans, 4 x weeds and 4 x parasites. One card after the other is turned over, vegetables are placed in the garden. So are weeds, for a parasite a vegetable has to go out, for a watering can one can turn over another card. Who has managed to plant 3 cards each of three different kinds of vegetables in his garden has won the game. 2 game variants are given.

110024.description: The little mermaids playing in the moonlight ride with beads on fishing, diving for treasure or maintain her long hair. Animals and Plants of the water are their best friends and in three different games, children can dive into the world of mermaids. In the picture game players form an underwater picture with the cards, in the collecting game, each child must find 5 cards of their color, and in the memory game, there are 40 pairs from the world of mermaids.

101834.description:
"The Off-Balance Game For Levelheaded People"

This is a vintage dexterity game from 1969. Based on the business executives shown on the cover illustration Trial & Balance was the kind of decorative item a corporate ladder-climber would keep on his desk.

The challenge is based on a fulcrum and balance beam with six slots spaced at regular intervals. There are six small weighted tokens that are maneuvered in these slots during play as the beam wobbles like a teeter-totter.

101836.description:
The object of Triple Flip game is for a player to have the least number of disks in his or her goal after all disks are in the goals. This battery-operated game has air blown through holes in the game board which allows disks to move on a cushion of air.

Contents:

1 Battery-Operated game unit (with 3 sets of flippers)
1 Plastic stopper bar
3 Plastic goals
12 Game disks

101837.description:
Players try to slide the puck off the bumpers into the right holes. Object is to be the first to get 4 in a row to win the game.

Contents:

2 part electronic game base
2 sliders
16 yellow discs
16 red discs
6 super rubberbands
8 pegs & 4 legs

101840.description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Scott Alden´s favorite questions.

name.#text: Wits & Wagers: Scott Alden Personality Card Promo

101841.description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Richard Borg´s favorite questions.

name.#text: Wits & Wagers: Richard Borg Personality Card Promo

101842.description:
User Summary

North Star Games made this personality card with 7 of Alan R. Moon´s favorite questions.

name.#text: Wits & Wagers: Alan R. Moon Personality Card Promo

101843.description:
Released in Spielerei No. 3

A game based on an idea from the movie "Quintett" from Robert Altmann.

Each player receives 3 playing pieces in one color. Additionally 3 dice are required.

A game is played in three rounds, each round consists of two phases: At the start of a round, a game chief is determined by rolling dice. This chief places one playing piece of each player on the hunting circle, to determine the hunting order: The order shows, which color can be attacked or must defend itself from the other colors.

Afterwards the players place their remaining playing pieces on the game board. Depending on the dice numbers they move their pieces and try to attack the appropriate colors. Certain dice combinations are keeping the own playing pieces safe. The game chief can redistribute the hunting order during the round. The winner of this phase plays against the game chief in a second phase. The player with remaining playing pieces on the game board wins the round.

110037.description: An LPS bonus mini-game, War with a Vengeance is a solitaire simulation of the defense against the V-1 (Vergeitungswaffe or Vengeance Weapon) campaign against Great Britain. Each turn represents 10 days where a random number of V-1 rockets are launched from sites in France Against London. The player takes on the role of the English defense forces to deploy assets and intercept the incoming V-1 Rockets. Options allow the English to commit forces to direct interception, launch site interdiction, or to support the Normandy invasion in an attempt to capture and neutralize the launch sites. With limited resources you must decide as the English how to best protect London and eliminate the threat of "Hitler's Vengeance".
110037.name: War with a Vengeance!

101846.description:
Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 5.

Each player receives 6 playing pieces of the same color, representing the sheeps and a differently colored playing piece, representing a dog.

With help of their dogs the players try to chase the sheeps into their enclosure. The sheeps start the game on their starting spaces. The dogs are in their kennels.

A player's turn consists of two actions: Firstly, he moves his dog one space in any of the eight directions. Secondly, he moves all sheep standing on one of the orthogonal or diagonal lines away from his dog.

The first player with all his sheep in his enclosure wins the game.

101847.description:
Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 6.

Besides the game board the players need a pencil and 4x 6 basic playing cards with values ace, 2, 3, 4 ,5, 6.

The goal of the game is to visit all 8 planets starting on earth and to come back again.

At the start of the game the positions of the planets are randomly determined. Afterwards every player gets 3 cards to move his space ship. The numbers both determine the distance and possible changes of the direction. The planets need to be visited in numbered order.

First player back on earth wins the game.

Its German version Space Explorer from book Beyond Competition

101849.description:
Released in magazine Spielerei No. 8.

Both players receive 12 playing pieces and places them on his base line.

Players take turns and move a single piece when it is their turn. The playing spaces both determine the distance and the direction of the moving pieces. White - one space, yellow - two spaces, red - three spaces. Spaces with own playing pieces are ignored during the move, opposite playing pieces are removed.

Last player with playing pieces wins the game.

101850.description:
Place 5 at the "Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb 1989".

Released in the magazine Spielerei No. 15.

You try to geet the most victory points at game end.

The playing board shows a game track, a points track and a bonus track. Players start with 3 playing pieces on the game track. By rolling a die they move the pieces on the game board. On certain spaces the playing pieces can move from the game track to the points track and further on to the bonus track. Players can remove opposing playing pieces.

Game ends as soon as the first player has no playing pieces left on the outer track. All players count the points on the spaces of their playing pieces. Highest score wins the game.

101853.description:
Hexteroyd is an abstract strategy game for 2 players with a background theme of Asteroid Mining. It plays in approximately 20 minutes.
Players take turn placing and removing pawns (the Colonies) on an hexagonal board (the Asteroid belt) with 5 hexagonal cells (the Asteroids) per side.
Playing the Colonies allow to have the controls of the cells through double-sided discs (the Mines).
Aim of the game is having control of the most valuable group of Mines (a Chain): the value of a Chain is given by the sum of the values of the adjacent Colonies.

The game will participate in an Abstract Strategy Game Design Contest in the mathematics festival "Tutto è Numero" in Caldè (Italy) at the end of July 2011

What's so special about Hexteroyd ?

Hexteroyd is a kind of connection game but with several twists:
- First and foremost, you don't need to connect distant parts of the board. You must connect points to... gain points !
- The pawns you use are shared between the players and have a double role: they allow the players to make actions and they are the points themselves: positive if you connect them on the board, negative if you keep them in your hand.
- You don't directly place the connecting pieces on the board: they come into play as a consequence of your playing a pawn, whether you place it on, or remove it from, the board.
- Connecting pieces (the discs) aren't fix, they have a certain degree of variability as the result of players' actions: once they are on the board, they remain on their cell, but they change owner, therefore changing the connected pawns.
Thanks to these characteristics, some parts of the board (usually the peripheral ones) are constantly subject to subtle but meaningful changes and the victory is somewhat uncertain till the end.

The strategic aspect of Hexteroyd originates in the different ways in which you can use pawns: if you tend to empty your hand, you will have more territory control but less mobility; if you keep them in hand you risk to lose points in the end if you can't get rid of them.

110047.description: In the 44-year long history of the Cold War, few conflicts symbolize it as fully as those in Vietnam. To contemporary observers, it was a war between the two ideological blocs of Communism and the West. From the forces of the Viet Cong and NVA and the American, South Vietnamese, Australian and other Free World forces, the wars that ravaged Indochina throughout the second half of the 20th century can be recreated with Vietnam, the latest companion volume for Force on Force. Orders of battle, scenarios and special theatre-specific rules give players an immersive experience of gaming in in the jungles, fields and towns of Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia.
110047.name: Ambush Valley

101859.description:
The game consists of two phases, a placement phase followed by a movement phase. The two players White and Black each have twelve pieces.

PLACEMENT PHASE:
Beginning with White, the players alternate placing one of their twelve pieces on one of the 37 crossing points on the board.
Once all pieces have been placed, the movement phase begins. A piece can be captured during this phase (see below).

MOVEMENT PHASE:
The players alternate moving one of their pieces to an adjacent and empty crossing point. A piece can be captured during this phase (see below). If a player has only 4 remaining pieces, they are allowed to move their piece to any empty crossing point.

QUADRATES:
A quadrate occurs when a piece is placed such that the 4 corners of a square are occupied by that player's pieces. Quadrates come in 6 different sizes. To form a quadrate, a player must have their pieces on all 4 corners of a square composed of either 2,4,8,16,18, or 32 triangles.

The table below indicates the number of possible quadrates composed of a given number of triangles:

No. of Triangles/No. of Quadrates
2 - 24
4 - 12
8 - 13
16 - 5
18 - 4
32 - 1

For any of the larger quadrates (8,16,18,32), the quadrate is invalid if there is an opposing piece on any position along the side.Only friendly or empty positions are allowed along the edges (sides) of a quadrate.

CAPTURE:
If after placing a piece, a quadrate is formed, the player can remove an opponent piece which does not itself form a quadrate with 3 other pieces.

Once a player has only 3 remaining pieces, they lose the game. If the same position occurs 3 times, then the game is declared a draw.

Notes:
o In rare cases, all of a player's pieces may be trapped thus requiring the player to pass.
o Danish Quarto has some similiarities to the Morris family of European board games, but also shares important features of a Chinese game named `Fang`
101859.name: Danish Quarto

110052.description:
Background:

When Charles II of Spain died in November 1700 the both mentally and physically weak king had no heir to the crown. His kingdoms included not only Spain but both parts of the Low Countries, Italy and colonies in the Philipines and the Americas. Now two dynasties claimed the Spanish throne, the French Bourbons and the Austrian Habsburgs. Charles last will proclaimed that Philip, Duke of Anjou (grandson of Louis XIV) was to be offered the whole Spanish empire. However, the German emperor, Leopold I had launched his son the Archduke Charles as pretender to the throne. England preferred the Electoral Prince Joseph Ferdinand of Bavaria who was Leopold’s grandson. In February 1701 the 17 year old Philip was crowned in Madrid and was reluctantly recognized by England. In the same time French troops secured the Spanish Nederlands and cut of England and the United Provinces from Spanish trade. This resulted in the Treaty of Den Haag 1701 which formed the great alliance between Austria, England and the United Provinces and was later supported by Prussia, Hanover, Denmark, the Holy Roman Empire, Portugal and Savoy. The treaty did actually recognized Philip as the king of Spain but more important, it retained the Spanish trade, gave the Spanish territories in Italy as well as the Spanish Nederlands to Austria and formed a defensive alliance against France. On the other side Bavaria and Cologne supported the French in this upcoming conflict. When Portugal joined the great alliance the focus turned to put Archduke Charles on the Spanish throne.

The war now started slowly in Italy where an Austrian force commanded by Eugene of Savoy invaded the Duchy of Milan, one of the Spanish territories in Italy, which prompted a French intervention. Things are now set up for A Throne Vacant™ to begin.

The game:

A Throne Vacant™( # 107-1 ) is easy to learn and is played in a fast phased manner. The units are blocks in regimental and army size for greatest flexibility in taking steps and differentiating the quality and strength of the troops, like in its sister game Pax Baltica. The high quality map is divided in territories which you have to conquer order to control it. This is made by taking each and every town in a territory. Navies will also play an important part in ATV in the sense that you have to keep the sea lines open to the colonies, and of course transport British troops to the continent. As this intriguing conflict covers the whole of western Europe the map covers a large area from the Atlantic coast in the west to Prague in the east, from northern England in the north to Oran in the south. Playable nations are England/Great Britain, France, Spain, Austria and The United Provinces. Other countries represented in the game are Portugal, Savoy, Bavaria, Denmark and The Holy Roman Empire.

So, why don’t you enter the roles of some of the great military commanders of history, Marlborough, Prince Eugene, Villars or Vendôme. Lead them to great victories and secure the Spanish crown for your pretender to the throne. We are quite sure that this game will bring a Machiavellian smile to your face.

The game, packed in a book case includes a 50 x 70cm-size full color map, 80 high quality wooden blocks, 4 dice, various markers and rules, including different scenarios.

101861.description:
From the back of the box:
Are you ready for your mystery date?
The game with the electronic talking phone
The game changes every time you play!
So use the clues you hear and see if you can solve each mystery

Mystery Date: The Game With The Electronic Talking Phone

This is the 1999 version of Mystery Date but is vastly different than the others. This is more like Electronic Dream Phone!

The classic mystery game for girls is updated for the new millennium. With 3 kinds of fun mysteries to solve - Dating Line - Mystery Line - Party Planning Line.

Dating Line: Be the first player to find out which boy wants to ask you out on a date. (There is only one secret Mystery Boy chosen per game - the same for all players. It changes for each new game you begin)

Mystery Line: Be the first player to find out who the Mystery Boy is depending on one of threee randomly selected themes:

What boy was voted class president and how many votes did he get? or
What boy won the science contest and how much money did he win? or
What boy is the captain of the soccer team and how many goals did he score?




Party Line: Be the first player to get six boys to come to your party.

Game play is generally calling one of the boys (from the cards in your hand) and listening to the clue he gives, look at the pictures in the frames, and then record the information on your clue sheet.

101862.description: Game produced by Identity Games Int. at the request of the dutch army. Its for 2-4 players and take 1-2 hours. The gameboard shows different countries where peacekeeping-operations can be done. Each peacekeeping-operation has 3 different sub-missions (Humanitary-aid, Peace-keeping, Peace-enforcing). When landing on a country the player takes a Oppertunity & Threats card which shows what mission needs to be prefomed and what is needed to complete it. The player also takes a Strategy card that can be used for special effects. Completing missions and being in charge of a region (on of the board edges) gives victory points. depending on the number of players 5, 7 or 11 victory points are required to win.

name.#text: Global Challenge: The game of international peacekeeping-operations

101864.description:
This Pack is only in German and English and contains 13 cards:

Harruli (Hero)
The level 1 and 2 adds 1/2 attack +1/2 per revealed spell. Level 3 adds 4 attack and allows you to draw three cards and add one spell cards to your hand.

The English version of this promo was included as part of the first Promo Pack.
101864.name: Thunderstone: German Promo Pack Harrulier (Harruli)

101865.description:
Gripping Beast's Dark Ages miniatures skirmish. Each side has between 25 to 73 miniatures, organised into groups of 4-12 figures. Miniatures are classed as Hearthguard, Warriors, or Levy, and an army comprises of 4 or 6 points of units (1 point = 4 Hearthguard, 8 Warriors, or 12 Levy figures).

Each faction - Anglo-Danish, Viking, Welsh, Norman - has its own battleboard of command options, which are selected depending on the roll of your Saga Dice. Saga Dice have special icons and give your command choices for the turn.

Combat and shooting are simple and based on six-sided dice rolls, the real challenge is to use the options from your battleboard as effectively as possible. The core game comes with a battleboard for the four main factions, with future battleboard releases intended to cover other armies/factions.

102994.description:
Malifaux: Twisting Fates, released at GenCon 2011 adds Avatar rules and Avatar stats for all Malifaux Masters. Avatars are in-game master replacements.

It also adds new Minions for all factions.

101871.description:
Monster in My Pocket Battle Cards is a simple game played by two or more. The game features a deck of 48 cards, each displaying a Monster in My Pocket monster (eg. 'Werewolf', 'Hobgoblin', 'Manticore') along with five statistics: intelligence, strength, speed, weakness and point value (a total of the other categories), plus two Wild Cards.

After the deck is dealt out, each player turns over their top card. A die is rolled to determine which category is being assessed (rolling a 6 is 'you pick') and players compare cards. The player with the highest value in the chosen category wins the cards in play and puts them at the bottom of their pile. Ties are resolved by playing another round, with the eventual winner collecting all of the acumulated cards. Wild Cards win a round automatically.

After each round the die is passed along and rounds are played until one player has won all of the other cards.

The game came packaged with two Monster in My Pocket collectible figures ('The Beast' and 'Witch').

name.#text: Monster in My Pocket Battle Cards

101872.description:
The object is to win, and not to lose. Win, Don’t Lose is a fast, fun and hilarious card game with only a handful of rules. While there are routes to victory described in the rules, many of the cards supply their own way to win, such as setting your opponents on fire, or managing to stick around long enough to get your tax return. The game has multiple "modules", which can be added over time, so that a new player can play the basic game after only a minute of explanation. Each module adds another rule to the game, and the game builds on itself.

Win, Don't Lose is a public domain game, so anyone is free to make their own copy of the game.

101874.description:
From the back of the box:

The blades will get stuck in the planks of the deck, but the pirates need great skill to throw their knives in an empty space. If you hit a space that is already occupied, it is the next players turn. Who is the first one to get all his knives stuck in the wooden deck?

A safe game with a magnetic knife that demands instinctive feeling.
101874.name: Capt'n Sharky: Lancer de couteaux

101879.description:
From publisher blurb:

See who can act out the most fancy words in this game that will make you giggle! Packaged in our colorful carry-along bag that's made for the fun-lover on the move...Games to Go!

Contents: 48 action cards, 10 card stands, 21 game chips, colorful carry-along bag

User summary:

On each turn the current player will draw an action card, and then perform in sequence from memory the actions of any previously drawn action cards as well as the card just drawn.

Players get a number of chips to trade in for hints should they not be able to remember a portion of the sequence; the player who can perform the longest sequence correctly without running out of chips is the winner.

The action cards have both the name of the action as well as a picture demonstrating the action for children too young to read.

110073.description:
Smaller than Reinhold Wittig's Spiel, tinier than the Spiel expansion 55, Abacusspiele presents Wittig's Spiel Mini, which consists of a pyramidal base, twenty dice of the same color, and a plastic lid to keep everything in place.

Like Wittig's Spiel, Spiel Mini is a game system in which users are encouraged to create and submit their own dice games to Abacusspiele for inclusion in the produced version of the game. Spiel Mini will initially be released at Spiel 2011 in a "barebones" edition that includes all of the components and none of the rules.

Reimplements:

Spiel

110084.description:
An educational game (as are all the other games by this designer). Again, it uses his principles of a Lotto mechanic. Players will learn to recognise vowel sounds and vowel combinations. When a player recognises a vowel sound, he then checks his card and if that sound is also in the name of an object on his card, he may match with it.
Part of the publishers Phonics series. Aimed at children from 5 to 10 years old.

110086.description:
Each Player gets three additional tokens with a special feature. During the game a token can be used to buy a fourth action OR to use the special feature. Then it is discarded. For example one token allows you to write a history about one of your own monuments. At the end of the game you may use any tokens you have left AFTER the usual end of the game. In case you have all tokens left, you are even allowed to write a history then!
Antipatros is a free give away in Essen 2011 and is a limited edition.

101898.description:
Essence is about what defines a person's being.

Essence: The Game of Insights is a communicative game that invites 2 to 7 players to get a more profound understanding of themselves and see each other with new eyes. Eight essential questions and about 340 phrase cards provide a broad range of traits, activities and values allowing the players to assess one another in many different ways. Whoever proves to be most accomplished in perception, reflexion and empathy wins.

In contrast to so-called party games in which exposures, embarrassments and gloating are commonplace, Essence lives off the sincere curiosity about the multifaceted human nature, the joy of authentic openness, vivid discussions and an esteeming look at personal potentials and resources.

Since the game contents are in German as well as in English, Essence can be applied within a multinational context for intercultural exchange.
101898.name: Essence: Das Erkenntnisspiel

101899.description:
Tangentopoli is a trivia game about the history of bribes, corruption, scandal, intrigue, mafia, terrorism was born as a result of the political scandal happened in Italy in the first '90.
It consists of a competition culture to reach the Great Contract (the last box of the track).
Wins the first player exceeds the 47 boxes of the path by responding to questions from time to time for commentary, history, cinema, literature, sports and journalism.
The feature of this game is that it can move forward on the path without actually knowing the answers, just pay a bribe to an opposition player who is able to respond to your seat.
But not enough. After the finish line as winner of the race has yet to undergo the final survey which rewards the competitor who has not made use of bribes.
Contents of the box:
1 board
over 500 questions
60 fiches
1 die
6 pawns/puzzle
rules

103000.description:
"Wer weiß es?" - Das große Schul-Wissen-Spiel
is a german language educational game for children pre-school and during elementary school.

The game map shows a school with several class rooms. The players use dice to walk to the class rooms to get question cards from the different areas (Reading, Writing, Language, Calculating, Geography, Nature, Traffic and School Court, for Level 3-4 also available English and History). If they answer a question correctly, they get point cards and a school certificate card.

In the basic version, the first player who has collected all school certificates has won. In the advanced version, players can collect additional points for helping others to answer questions and get additional markers for this.

The game map has two sides, one for elementary school level 1-2, the other for level 3-4. Four sets of questions corresponding to the school levels are available. In the advanced version (Lvl 3-4) they can additionally collect “happy” and “unhappy” teacher cards.

Game content:
Game map
44 point cards
40 school certificate cards
8 happy/unhappy teacher marker
4 “Schlaumeier” marker
4 wooden meeples
1 dice
Each Question sets must be bought extra. Four question sets are available (Level 1-4)

101906.description:
In the year of 1787, Brazil was still a colony of Portugal.

The Portuguese empire imposed high taxes (called "Derrama") upon the wealthy ones, trying to get as much gold as possible. Under pressure, influential Brazilians gather to organize a liberty movement by writing articles, poems and manifests, spreading freedom ideas taken from USA's recent act of independence and from the French Revolution.

A group of conspirators, called Inconfidentes, gathered on the state of Minas Gerais, a place that concentrated a lot of gold and valuable gems.

There are six characters on the game, five of them are Inconfidentes: the poet, the farmer, the bachelor, the soldier and the priest, each of them with a unique power. The last one is an imperial guard.

On each round, players choose and move the Inconfidentes, however more than one play may select the same character. Whenever this happens, they must blind bid to decide who will be the leader of that character.

Players vie to spread the ideas through publishing texts (tiles) and hide them around the city, Ouro Preto, formerly named as Vila Rica, and get the population's approval, supporting the struggle to make Minas Gerais free from Portugal. These conspirators also made part of Freemasonry's secret association, and they try to build the first Freemasonry's secret house to support their fight.

When they publish their own texts and get the texts from the others, players make "inconfidência" points (victory points). Furthermore, a character may become a Freemason. If a player manages to get to the 33rd. degree of Freemasonry (all five characters become Freemasons), he becomes a Master Freemason. This gives an alternative ending to the game by finishing the game earlier, and changes Brazilian history! setting Minas Gerais free from Portugal.

If no one gets to be a Master Freemason until 1789, the year of the ninth and last round, everyone goes to jail.
The player with more points (tiles) from texts published by other players, gold retrieved and Freemasonry degrees is the "inconfidência" martyr and the winner.

Not to forget that the historic martyr, Tiradentes, became widely famous afterwords, although was unfortunately killed, hanged for treason by Portugal.

110100.description: One may still be able to remember the last Grand Prix season with it's dramatic finale, but who can tell what has happened in the seasons 50 years ago? The game has 165 cards with more than 1000 questions in three categories: Cars and Technology, History and Drivers, Grand Prix Aktuell. The players roll a die and move forward accordingly . For each roll of the die he must pay with chips, also for wrong answers. For correct answers a player receives up to three chips, for overtaking another player 1 chip. If a player has finished one round (or more, if wanted), the player with the most chips is the winner.

110101.description: How do I get more pocket money and what I do best with it? This eternal question of children's attempts gets answer with this game, with all sorts of activities players may spend their pocket money. Players learn to count money and also convert one currency to another - there are Deutch Marks and Euros in this game. The mechanism is simple - roll - move - follow instructions of the target field.
110101.name: Mein Taschengeld

110102.description:
Siberia has a reputation for being a land of vast resources, and players are going to do their best to exploit those resources and convert them into as much loot as possible.

To set up the game, place two different resources at random on each area in Siberia, place the remaining resources on their supply spaces, draw four of the 20 investment tiles from the bag and lay them on the game board, give each player his own playing panel and workers/salesmen, then place all the action counters in the bag.

Siberia lasts an unspecified number of rounds. Each round consists of two phases: (1) drawing and placing action counters and (2) performing actions. In the first phase, all players draw six action counters from the bag, then place them on their individual playing panels. Most action counters show both a resource (five types possible) and a person (four types), while managers are on counters of their own. Each playing panel has columns for the five types of resources and the five types of workers, with space for two counters in each column. Players can also allocate counters to the "research facility" below their panel.

In the second phase, players take actions one at a time until everyone has no actions remaining or passes. A resource or worker action can be taken only if both spaces are filled in the appropriate column; when a player takes an action, he removes all action counters in the column, returns them to the bag, then takes the action.

• The "research facility" action must be carried out first, with the player taking the designated resources from the supply and placing one resource in any location that doesn't already have that resource available.

• The worker actions allow a player to place a salesman in a stock exchange, place a worker in Vladivostok, move workers up to three spaces, move a manager to any action space, or claim an investment tile; each investment tile corresponds to a particular resource or worker action and is placed on the player panel permanently, allowing the player to take this action more easily in the future since the column is always half-filled.

• Each resource action allows a player to remove that resource from all areas where he has a worker, then immediately sell them on one of the stock exchanges where he has a salesman.

A player can keep up to ten action counters on his playing panel at the end of a round, allowing him to prepare for and build up actions for future rounds. The game ends at the end of any round in which three of the five resources have no supply remaining or eight areas have had all their resources removed. (Once an area is exhausted, nothing can be placed in it for the remainder of the game.) The player who has the most money wins.

110103.description: Rows of three fruits are the aim of the game! Strawberries, grapes and pears are depicted either in a square, a circle or a triangle in yellow, blue or red. The tiles are heaped face-down and each player draws three tiles. In your turn you place one of your tiles on the board to complete a row of three either of the same fruit or the same color or the same background shape. Each completed row of three earns you a chip, and of course you can complete more than one row with one tile and use rows already placed as part of a new row. When all spaces on the board are filled you win with most chips.

families: HABA My Very First Games series
110104.description:
A collection of games featuring funny dwarves and offering three different ways to play:
Back into Pixies Land! Is a collecting game, each player has a board, frameless side up, You throw the dwarf dice stick and take a corresponding part, pants, head or hat, when this spot is still empty on your board, and place it. For the stars you take any missing part. If you have filled your board first, you win.
Let’s go home together! is a cooperative game, the boards are placed frame up. You throw the cloud stick. For a cloud you place a corresponding part, for the stars any missing part. When all dwarves are complete, all players have won together. Let’s visit King Dopey! is a stacking game. First, you take a board and place all parts for a complete dwarf. Then you throw the dwarf stick. If it shows pants, head or hat you take the necessary part and place it on the table to achieve a correct dwarf, first pants, then head and hat. For the stars you take the next missing part, if you finish your dwarf first, you win.
110104.name: Dwergenland

families: HABA My Very First Games series
110105.description: With the components of this toy/puzzle/game box you can play a cooperative roll & move game. The board is put together - side without stripes up. The boat base sits in front of the board at the side with the red wind mill, the other wooden parts are distributed on their images on the board. You roll the die: For a color Sam the Sailor advances to the next space of this color, on a red-yellow ring he must stop and place the corresponding part on the boat. For Sam himself all players applaud, but he stays in place. When you roll the boat, you advance it one sea space. If Sam reaches the boat, all win together, if the boat leaves the board before that, all have lost together.
110105.name: Matroos ahoi!

110106.description: The 3 sides of the 25 wooden pieces show different characteristics (form, colour, number and filling) of symbols. Player may alternately turn or relocate a piece to bring three correct pieces into a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line. To be correct they must be a trio and a trio must have each of the characteristics either the same or completely different on all pieces. Who forms a trio may take it out of the game, the player with the most trios wins the game. Variant of the card game Set.

110107.description:
There are 3 symbols in this game: sword, hear and scale, all with their strengths and weaknesses.

Each player represents one of the symbols. In the game, players turn to different means to achieve this primary goal. They try to uncover and capture enemy stones. You bluff by pretending certain strategic positions with their hidden rocks or by seeking an unexpected winning condition.

Contents:

30 triangular pieces (10 each in white, red and black).




In every color there are 3 stones sword, 3 scale blocks, three blocks and a heart stone eyes.

folded game board inside the pyramid-shaped game-box)

110110.description:
Objective: be the first to move your three meeples (cars) back home. Simple 'roll and move' game, combined with educational touch (learning road signs). Your meeples (Wartburg 311) can't be thrown out, but you should try to block your opponents.

Second (better known) edition 1965/68 by 'Spika'
110110.name: Augen auf!

110111.description:
This pack provides 18 Advanced Squad Leader (ASL) scenarios covering a variety of actions in the Budapest campaign in Hungary during WWII. The 18 scenarios include a good variety of scenarios from large to tournament sized.

Included also are two new boards; FE 1 is a rural board with some farms, a gully and some small hills; FE 2 is a city set on a hill. The boards are on heavy card stock and each comes in two pieces that connect along the Q hex row.

110112.description: Tabletop miniature rules for the period 1480-1700 including army lists. The ruleset allows you to recreate any battle from the pike and shot era and is designed for 15mm or 25mm figures, but the rules could be adapted for any scale. The army lists allow you to dive straight in to your chosen period with an army representing a standard formation from the period.

110113.description: Tabletop miniature wargame rules for the period 1450 to 1700AD. The rules allow the recreation of battles from the age of pike and shot to be made using either 15mm or 25mm figures. Rules are included to cover field battles as well as sieges and assaults.

101922.description:
Calciocart is a game of simulated football with special cards that reproduce all the tactical and technical situations that may occur during a football game.
The cards are divided into three groups: Attack, Defense and Goalie.
The game is played between two players. Each choose 12 attack cards and 12 defense, which wants to use among the more than 100 that make up their decks, depending on choice of tactics.
The first player plays a card of attack (usually a passing) if the defender has a defense card that cancels that played by the opponent, he becomes the attacker, otherwise the first player may shoot at goal.
If an attempt on goal is saved the game will restart with the roles attacker / defender reversed, otherwise the attacking player has scored a goal.
After playing for 45 minutes, the first time end and pass on second.
After 90 minutes of play the player who has scored the most number of goals wins.

101923.description:
The Fortune Building Securities Game.

Starting with $10,000 players buy stock in leading corporations- selling them back for profit or loss depending on whether they're in a Recession, Depression, Prosperity or Recovery.

First player to reach $50,000 in cash and stocks is the winner.

110116.description: Army Lists suitable for use with rules in the Warfare through the Ages series and adaptable for Wargames Research Group Renaissance, Tercio and Newbury Fast Play Rules. The lists cover every major battle and nation for the period, from English Civil War through Rennaisance Europe, to Japan, North America and Africa. Each army list is accompanied by a descriptive paragraph explaining which troop combinations are allowed and what the army's historical basis is.

name.#text: Army Lists for the Revolution in Warfare: Volume 1 1550-1660AD

110117.description: A comprehensive set of WWII army lists for British, German, American, Italian, Russian, Japanese, French, Hungarian and Czechoslovakian forces. Each nations entry is preceeded by a brief overview of that nation's forces, followed by a set of diagrams showing how the various organisations employed by that nation were organised. This is then followed by a number of suggested armies for tabletop battles. All the inmformation contained within the book is set out for use with three rulesets in mind: Combined Arms, Cambrai to Sinai and Wargames research Group.

101926.description:
To all budding chefs – utensils ready, set, cook!

Either on your own or in teams, complete the challenges in L'atelier des Chefs set by the chef and become his right-hand man. Separate eggs, sabre champagne, flip as many pancakes as possible – in your hands the cards will become kitchen utensils and fine dishes. You will have to throw them, catch them, look at them, sort them, put them on top of each other...all under pressure from the egg timer! You will have to combine dexterity and ingenuity in order to beat your opponents.

Keep the game going over a hot stove with ten interactive recipe cards, concocted by the Chef's kitchen experts!

101927.description:
In this game win the player who manages to defeat the evil Limburger after managing to avoid the enemies encountered on the board, and avoid the dangers encountered on the elevated ramp.
Once you reach Limburger, the player has three chances to be able to hit the figure of the wicked and drop it.
Each player has its own character who will move on the board trying to collect cards that allow access to the elevated road. In this attempt they must defeat the enemies they encounter.
The elevated road contain dangers and traps to be avoided by players to reach the point from which they can shoot with the catapult at Limburger and win the game.

101929.description: This game combines elements of boardgames and miniatures, in a system that is card-driven. Cards drive the impulses that take place during each turn, and each player has a deck of cards, made up from the troops under his or her command. Each soldier's "deck" of cards reflects abilities and traits-- perhaps about how well they shoot or how slowly they move or how attracted they are to things like fresh milk, hot food, or loot. There are some Soldiers (called "Characters") included in the base game (Day of Days) which are common, but the others in DoD and all that are purchased separately have unique characteristics (which all balance out to be "equal" according to a complex math formula which is seamless to the players). So players can only get the best out of their forces after they have learned each soldier's strengths and weaknesses. "Day of Days" includes moveable mapboard tiles, hand-painted 20mm miniatures (by FAA), scenarios, cards (several decks!) and everything needed to play. Additional Soldiers give more choices and more fun.

name.#text: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Day of Days

publishers: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
101930.description:
Think Ferris wheels, roller-coasters, carousels, flying swings, and bumper cars! Open your Carnival for business before the other carnies do by building four of the five available rides along your Midway. Then cue the Carnival music and watch the crowd rush in!

Carnival is a card game of set collection for 2-4 players, ages 12+, that utilizes dice to determine actions. Each turn, a player rolls three dice and chooses two of them to perform actions which can allow them to gain and discard cards from their hand and/or Midway. Each player also has three tickets that may be discarded to affect the dice rolls or block other players' actions.

101932.description:
This game attempts to capture the feel of a Horror Movie in a Board Game. Players start off as survivors of an airplane crash, they know that something is wrong but not what. They must first leave the safety of the abandoned village and collect clues from other island locations. Once they have collected enough clues a Horror themed Goal is revealed that usually requires gathering certain objects and bringing them to a given location (eg. To escape from the island you must take the motor from the docks and repair it in the workshop, and return with the keys and gasoline to escape).

As the players move about the island they will come under attack from the Peril Deck. The hand of cards each player holds represents the energy they have to escape from the attacks, attacks chip away at your hand (the Action Deck also represents how much daylight is left). If you ever run out of cards in your hand after an attack you die... but the player can always return to the village to grab another survivor to wander off to find out what is going on.

The game contains a few horror themed cards including "I know what to do", "it's now or never", and my favorite for twist endings "It's not what you think" all balanced to bring a horror movie to your tabletop in about half-an-hour.

NOTE: All files necessary to play the game are located in the files section below :-)

101934.description:
Publisher blurb: "Death Ride - Hafid Ridge provides a small, introductory game into the Death Ride system by Grognard Simulations. It is a platoon level tactical game with forces representing the British 7th Armor Brigade in front of Hafid Ridge during Operation Battleaxe. The result of this battle caused the removal of General Wavell from his command in the desert. 5th Leichte Divisions', soon to be 21st Panzers', PanzerJager battalion and some supporting flak elements withstood a determined attempt to force them off the ridge and move north toward Ft Capuzzo.

Main elements of change from the Death Ride Kursk games is a move to use silouhettes for the armor units and double sided counters. There will be more player aids and the size of this game will be perfect for those looking to finish a play through in a few hours. This game may hopefully become a tournament game since the challenge to both sides is quite high.

Players will find this game very easy to start playing and will then be looking for the meatier elements of the Death Ride Series after they are bitten by the Death Ride bug. The amount of critical decision making and knife-edge suspense will have you wanting more. And we will find you more."

101937.description:
From the publisher:

You are a young captain in charge of your own fleet of ships, seeking fame and fortune. Conquer the islands and increase your wealth so you can be a powerful admiral.

Have you found a section of ocean where there are several islands that are not under the power of any kingdom or country and it is your duty to land on them and claim its riches for you. Be careful as other pirates have been established on nearby islands and are in search of new domains, you will fight them, showing who is the most powerful captain, using your ships to take out your opponents.

Have fun, managing your ships, conquering islands landing in their ports, increase your wealth, and if necessary destroy your opponents by blowing up your traps. Who will be the most successful captain?

The board represents a section of ocean with several islands, each with its port and wealth. Each island has a number that represents wealth and every time you take possession of an island, its richness is added to the total wealth of the player.

Each turn each player can make up to six actions that can be: Build, move or disembark. Additionally, the player may attack one or more opponents or blow up one of his traps.

There are two ways to end the game:

1 - Time limit: At the beginning of the game a limit of time is proposed. Upon completion of the time the winner is determined by the number of ships that the player have on the board and the wealth earned.

2 - Total Victory: The game ends when one player remains on the board or when a player takes possession of all shipyards.


Del editor:

Conviertete en un poderoso capitán acumulando riquezas y dominios.

Eres un joven capitán a cargo de tu propia flota de barcos, buscando fama y fortuna. Debes conquistar la mayor cantidad de islas, aumentando tu riqueza para que seas un poderoso almirante.

Has encontrado un sector del océano donde se encuentran varias islas que no están bajo el poder de ningún reinado o país y es tu deber desembarcar en ellas y reclamar sus riquezas para ti. Ten cuidado, ya que otros corsarios se han establecido en islas cercanas y se encuentran en la búsqueda de nuevos dominios; deberás enfrentarte a ellos, demostrando quien es el mas poderoso capitán, utilizando tus barcos para eliminar a tus oponentes.

Diviértete, manejando tus naves; conquista islas desembarcando en sus puertos, aumenta tus riquezas, enfrenta a tus oponentes y si es necesario destruyelos haciendo explotar tus trampas. ¿Quién será el capitán mas exitoso?

El tablero representa un sector del océano con varias islas, cada una con su puerto y riquezas. Cada isla tiene un número que representa su riqueza y cada vez que se toma posesión de una isla, su riqueza se suma al total de las riquezas del jugador.

En cada turno cada jugador puede realizar hasta seis acciones que pueden ser: Construir, mover o desembarcar. Adicionalmente el jugador puede atacar a uno ó mas oponentes o hacer explotar una de sus trampas.

Hay dos formas de terminar el juego:

1- Límite de tiempo: Al comienzo del juego se propone un límite de tiempo determinado. Al terminarse el tiempo establecido de juego se decide el ganador según los barcos que se tengan en el tablero y la riqueza ganada.

2- Victoria Total: El juego termina, cuando queda un solo jugador en el tablero o cuando un jugador se apodera de todos los astilleros.

110130.description:
Ha-Shin is a tabletop miniature wargame set in fantasy medieval Japan, where the forces of Light battle the forces of Darkness. It was published in issue #9 (February 2002) of Ravage, a French miniature wargaming magazine.

Each mini has several stats describing its ability to move, shoot, fight and use "Chi" powers. The most important is Action Points (AP) which represent the character's life energy.
A player's turn begins by choosing one of several tactics. Tactics influence how many figures can be activated, how many APs are recovered at the end of the turn and what figures can recover APs. The player then chooses which figures to activate, and expends the figure's APs to move, charge, use a ranged weapon or a Chi power. Each fight is duel; duel are resolved by secretly choosing a combat action for each combatant (which can give bonuses or penalties to die rolls), then rolling for initiative, then trying to beat the opponent's Armour score with 1d6 + the fighter attack score. Each damage point lowers the victim's APs, minis with no APs left must make a save roll each time they are wounded to avoid death.

The last player standing wins the game, also players are encouraged to create scenarios and alternate victory conditions.

The rules include two army lists with classic Japanese folklore figures (samurais, ninjas, shaolin monks, kappas, onis...), a set of markers and tactical advice for both featured armies (Light and Darkness).

Scale: skirmish (1 mini = 1 combatant, 1 cm = 1 m, a turn = a few seconds)

101942.description:
This map represents the combined areas of Pennsylvania and New Jersey. Also printed on the map are various details about many towns in the area, and some history.

It is a pre-printed map that requires the base game to play.

From the map:

In order to settle this region, you need the game pieces and cards from The Settlers of Catan game. You will also need additional markers for iron commodities and victory points (VPs)tokens; you can use chips from the Seafarers expansion, coins, or whatever else is handy.
101942.name: Catan Geographies: Penn/Jersey

110137.description:
Founders: A More Perfect Union is a trivia-plot game for 2-3 players or teams. Each turn involves roll and play, as well as the possibility of play cards.
Each player has authored a draft of the Constitution that contains the principles and protections necessary to unify the states. However, in order to present the draft at the Constitutional Convention, each author, must convince a certain number of states to join his or her delegation in support of the draft. Once the delegation is large enough, the author can travel to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and present the draft before the convention in Independence Hall. If you are successful in persuading the convention in your favor, your draft is ratified and becomes the Constitution of the United States! Players will have to study up to prove to these learned delegates will test your knowledge and reason before choosing to give you their support.
Answer trivia questions to get your state cards necessary to go to Philadelphia, but be careful, another player might have the play cards needed to steal a member of your delegation, or just send them packing home!

101946.description:
Wer weiss mehr und traut sich auch? ("Who knows more and will dare too much?") is a party game for 2-5 teams (2-15 players) that will test their powers of concentration and cultural knowledge. In each round, the teams first bid on how many items they can name from a particular category – flowers, car brands, fish, alcoholic drinks – then the team with the high bid sees whether they can live up to their claim. If they fail to do so, the other teams could score points instead. The team that collects the most points wins.

The Box Contain:

1 Board
5 Pawns in different colors
6 Gray token used to mark the category choosed during the game
1 Black token used to mark the number of terms declared
110 Category cards: total of 660 categories!
1 Mechanical timer

The Game will be presented at Essen Spiel 2011 - Booth 5-34 at the W&L SpielSpass stand.

name.#text: Wer weiss mehr und traut sich auch?

110139.description: Urban Structures is an expansion pack for Flash Point: Fire Rescue. It is initially printed in low quantities in 2011 for supporters of the Kickstarter project for the base game. It is now available commercially. It comes with 2 additional maps as well as a "Structural Engineer" role card.
110139.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Urban Structures

110141.description:
British roll-and-move game, If you land on the red spaces, follow the instructions.
First to complete a pre-set number of laps, wins.

Silverstone, in Northamptonshire, was opened in 1948. The site was a British ex-WWII airfield.

101951.description:
Erudition™ jump-starts the road to reading. The game takes players on a fun adventure through literacy land, complete with common land marks and street signs. You will enjoy an ice cream cone, encounter a construction site, ride a train and play on a playground. Recognize a sight word and you earn a bonus roll. Be the first player to reach the library and you are a winner!

The sight word game cards represent about 50% of all English text. Game cards are categorized by reading level so children of all ages can play together. Through interaction with sight words, new readers enhance their reading skills while playing a fun game.

Game cards are categorized to promote differentiated instruction so children of all reading levels can play together! They choose from one of four game cards:

26 blue game cards – upper and lower case letters and their consonant and short vowel sounds
94 green game cards – beginner level sight words
95 yellow game cards – intermediate level sight words
95 red game cards – advanced level sight words

101954.description:
Description from the package back:
Push your luck as you bury, capture and steal bones in this exciting Pirates dice game. Actual bone shaped dice. Roll the bone dice to Capture, Bury, Steal or Lose Em All. Bury the most bones, score the most points and you win. Take and play anywhere with the mesh storage bag for your bones.

Play Description:
Beginning the game each player takes one bone from the bone yard (pile), youngest player rolls first. Each bone (die) is marked with 4 symbols (Skull and crossbones, a sword, a bone, and a shovel.
Roll a bone draw another bone from the bone yard (roll all the bones again unless no bones were available)
Roll a sword and steal a bone from another player (roll all the bones again, unless no bones were taken)
Roll a shovel and you can bury one bone
But watch out, if ye rolls a skull ye loses all yer bones (except buried ones)

When all bones have been buried each player rolls all they have... The most skulls rolled is the winner.

A game should not last more than 15mins.

Game Contents:
14 Plastic Bone Dice
1 Brown Mesh Carry Bag
1 Rules Set

name.#text: Rollin' Bones: Pirates of the Caribbean (On Stranger Tides) Dice Game

110147.description:
Intoduction:

Author and game designer, Elree Ellis, is the mind behind "The World of Lucidia". Lucidia is a living, high fantasy world manifested though a series of epic works. These epic works include a series of novels, graphic novels, short stories, board games and a role-playing game. The first of his works, Islandis: A World of Lucidia Boardgame, will be released in 2012 via Time Warp Games.
Theme:

Entitled Islandis: A World of Lucidia Boardgame, this prologue will transport players to the humble beginnings of Lucidia, to a place far removed from the mainland, to a time before time, to the very birth place of life.
Islandis is the largest and most populated island in the Tokelau Sea, serving as the cornerstone for the exploration and settlement of the Asazi Isles. The island is teaming with culture, beauty, bountiful sea life, a seemingly endless supply of resources, and all of the essentials for a growing populous.
In time, through innovation and exploration, neighboring islands are discovered and populated. The new found islands introduce the Asazi people to previously undiscovered resources, thus giving life to a perpetual network of trade routes, and an incessant market place.
Island life is sublime, until...
Villages wake to the sound of chaos. The island pulses and cries with anguish. Families stumble out of their bungalows and into the night, only to find themselves dodging debris from the sky. Turning toward the summit, screams echo across the sea as bursts of lava erupt into the night sky. Dark clouds loom overhead, and no stars are watching from the night sky. Almost word for word, prophesy unfolds. This way of life is coming to an end,it is time for a new beginning.
In Islandis, each player takes on the role of a great leader of the Asazi people. It is each player’s charge to lead their tribe in this prophetic time.
Each player has a whole host of strategic colors in his pallet. Some may decide to stay on the island and continue to gather resources, make trade, and nourish culture. Others may gather resources to build vessels, explore and settle undiscovered islands. The most successful leaders will exhaust both of these options in perfect harmony. Whether choosing to make significant contributions in trade, develop high culture, or spread the seeds of their people across the vastness of the great sea, one common goal remains: To not be forgotten, to make your mark on the history of the World of Lucidia.

Game Play:

At its core, Islandis is a 1-4 player, turn based worker placement game for ages 13+; however, due to the nature of epic works, players will find that Islandis is truly a set of mini games within the whole part. In accord with the worker placement mechanic, players will enjoy fending off sea creatures, making trade, exploration, variable player powers, dice rolling, set building, and empire building (including conversion sites, villages, monoliths, colossi, and temples).
There are five primary building resources found on Islandis (Stone, Iron Ore, Gold Ore, Cotton, and Timber). These five resources, in many cases, will need to be converted into their more useful forms (Ashlar, Iron, Gold, Textiles, and Lumber). In order to upgrade resources, you will need to utilize your conversions sites, and workers. Dice serve as workers in the game and the results of a roll indicate the productivity of workers. Throughout the game players will find ways to "inspire" their workers to be more productive with the assistance of innovative tribesmen and women!
In addition to the five primary resources, and their upgraded incarnations, players will find many uses for the four major imported goods (Copal, Bamboo, Dyes, and Fruit). These imported goods are earned by lending workers to the four neighboring islands as trade.
Finally, and most important, players will need to feed their people! Players will rush for the opportunity to fish from the shore, however, due to limited space, most will be required to employ their sea vessels to earn fish. The most successful players will begin planting fruit trees early in the game to supplement the demands of fishing.
During the game, players will be able to develop culturally, allowing for a variety of new uses for the 14 resources. These cultural advancements include heirloom recipes, jewelry, musical instruments, and more, each lending their tribes the ability to earn victory points through trading cultural goods.

Goal:

The goal of each player is to earn as many victory points as possible before Islandis is destroyed by molten lava. Victory points are earned in a variety of fashions: Trading resources at the markets, developing cultural items and trading at the markets, fighting off sea creatures, surviving deadly storms, building villages, monoliths, colossi, and temples on newly discovered islands.

name.#text: Islandis: A World of Lucidia Boardgame

110151.description:
Players take turns to throw small rings made of rubber at the target board. If the ring catches on to one of the scoring hooks, that score is added to the player's total so far.

First to reach a pre-set total, wins. Or, it can be ended after a pre-set time limit and then the player with the most points, wins.

110152.description:
1-4 player co-operative card game that lets players take control of a post-apocalyptic, retro-future, caravan.

"It feels like Race for the Galaxy Vs. Magic the Gathering with a splash of euro gaming with a nuclear fallout post apocalyptic setting."

Why are you in a nuclear desert?
Players control a rag-tag caravan that contains elements of how society was before the bombs dropped. Everything from road-converted steam engines to solar harvesters staffed by inviting female engineers, and it's your job to get these guys the-hell-outta-here.
AtomPunk makes use of some inventive new puzzle-mechanics and loots the best ones from elsewhere. It steals the best bits of card interactions but dispenses with the "Spend loads of money to play with our new cards" CCG crap - it is one game. It uses resource tokens like some of our favorite euros, but keeps them in an elegant card format. Its core puzzle mechanic means that players will have to use your mind to work out the best path in this treacherous dystopian backdrop
You and your buddies are alone against the harsh wastelands. The riding is tough. Horrific mutants, shady merchants, hardened outriders, religious tech zealots and crazed robo-emus. BUT on your side you have have speed, cunning, all the guns you can handle, and transformer-like laser beam trains.

What are the mechanics?
1. You control 5 caravan elements in a horizontal line that give each card to its left and right static bonuses. These bonuses activate special abilities on the elements. You will constantly need to be thinking about getting these in the best configuration.
2. An event deck throws everything at you from crazy cleaning robots, twisted mutants, resource giving oasis, and caravan weaponry upgrades
3. Each turn pits you in a certain land. This land card tells you what resources you need to move on to the next land. After 5 of these you will come up against the 6th and final hard-as-nails boss land which will tell you the final quest you need to complete.
4. Not only do you need to conquer these 6 lands, but each player has a secret achievement goal card that they MUST complete in order to be allowed into the winning team. Will you tell your team mates yours?

How do we win?
Once you fulfill the requirements to bear the 6th and final quest land the "players" team will be successful. But only if you have succeeded your secret mission goal will you truly win, otherwise you have not won or lost, but you are cast back into the wastes, to win another day...

110160.description:
In Old Men of the Forest, players collect resources that enable them to rescue orangutans – but if you waste resources while doing so, you'll be punished at the end of the game.

To set up, shuffle the fifty-card deck (cards in five suits, numbered 1-10 in each suit), then deal each player ten cards. Shuffle the 16-card orangutan deck, then lay out 4 or 5 cards face up, depending on the number of players; each orangutan shows one or more suit cards on it, and a player must possess matching cards to claim that orangutan.

Each round, the lead player lays a card on the table, then each player follows, without regard for suit. Whoever played the highest card claims one card played by another player, then either places it on the table before her or uses it (possibly with cards collected earlier) to claim an orangutan. The player discards all cards needed to claim the orangutan, and tucks any remaining cards collected under that orangutan.

Each player must claim one card, if possible, adding it to her collected cards or claiming an orangutan. Discard any unclaimed card. After all players are finished, lay out new orangutan cards (if needed), then play another round.

Once players have played all ten cards in hand, the game ends. Each player sums the points on the orangutan cards she claimed, then loses one point for each excess card tucked or collected card still on the table. The player with the highest score wins.

All profits from sales of Old Men of the Forest will be donated to the Orangutan Foundation UK.

102961.description:
From the publisher:
300 questions & answers and simple rules. The questions are about music and entertainment around the world. Get 6 right befor the end, and you've won!

101988.description:
Updated Game Play Tutorials - www.youtube.com/user/giantgoblingames

Welcome to world of Storm the Castle!, a 1-4 player semi-cooperative game in which you take the exciting role of one of the four marauding Dark Forces armies in a race to breach Castle StormHaven's walls, overrun the defenders, and claim victory by reaching the castle's keep first.

Breaching Castle StormHaven's thick walls is no easy feat. It takes a desire for loot, hordes of your minions willing to be led to certain death (err, victory), cunning strategy, and a touch of treachery. The first player whose Dark Force unit enters the keep, by the end of turn eight, is truly the mightiest champion and claims total victory for his army.

The Story So Far - The Invasion Begins!

Castle StormHaven is guarded vigilantly by brave defenders comprised of an alliance between Men, Elves, Halflings, and Dwarves. For over 300 years, these defenders have repelled numerous invasions from the Badlands, home to the subterranean Dark Elf marauders and the mysterious sect of arcane bending wizards, the Arcanists. StormHaven is the first and last line of defense from keeping the fertile farmlands and gold mines of Western Holmenstein from being overrun.

Years ago, a mysterious masked and exceptionally short villain appeared with the goal of uniting the Badlands and ruling over Holmenstein. Dubbed "the Boss" by his cohorts, he promised gold and power to those who would follow him. First the Dark Elves, then the Arcanists joined his Dark Forces. Soon after, the Orc pirate raiders joined the growing army and brought with them their crazed goblin allies and monstrous cousins, the giants. Knowing The Boss' army needed further strength to overwhelm Castle StormHaven's defenses, he revealed the last piece of strategy for domination, the Undead Horde of the BlackSoot Swamps.

Now the four dark force armies – Dark Elves, Arcanists, Orc and Goblins of the Green Tide, and the innumerable Undead host – begin their long march east.

Dark Force Army Overview

Choosing your army is part of the fun of Storm the Castle! Each Dark Force army has unique units, power cards, combos and strategies. Is one better than the other - no! It’s how you use your strengths while minimizing your weakness. Each army has a fair opportunity to win.

The Green Tide: Orcs, goblins, giants, and other humanoids make up this loose tribal alliance. Specializing in brute force and strange Eastern technology, players who enjoy large explosions, brute strength, and dangerous yet untested weapons will enjoy smashing their way to victory with this army.

Pros: Hard hitting units with lots of equipment upgrades. Power cards primarily focused on attacking and smashing. The rock lobber is one of the most effective siege weapons in the game. Goblin sappas provide for cheap, hard hitting units.
Cons: Moderately expensive units. Lack of diversity in their power cards utility. Equipment can be deadly for both you and foe!

The Arcanists: Mixing metal with magic produces stunning results. These masters of the forbidden arcane arts use their talents to manipulate the minds and outcomes of events of their allies and enemies. Players who enjoy using tactics that harness deadly magics and powers to manipulate events will surely enjoy the awesome power of the Arcanists.

Pros: Incredible power cards that can shift game elements to your favor. Several long range spells and abilities to generate quick magic.
Cons: Many of your units have low health and are easily destroyed.

The Undead Horde: The walking dead from the Blacksoot Swamps know of one thing - how to feed! Their power derives from their ever increasing numbers and ability to sustain damage while pressing forward. Players looking to overwhelm the Fantasy Defenders with hordes of undead while using dark magic will find great pleasure in fielding this army.

Pros: Your units cause fear and can take quite a bit of damage. Inexpensive units allow you to swarm and overrun the Fantasy Defender’s defenses.
Cons: Though your units are many, they don’t hit hard. Magic can be hard to build up as its dependent upon how many undead units you have in play.

The Dark Elves: From the deep recesses of forgotten lands nestled deep within the earth come the masters of marauding, the Dark Elves. Known for their exceptional arts in battlefield tactics and archery, no foe is safe from the tips of their arrows to the teeth of their treachery. Players who revel in treachery, backstabbing and shooting should choose the Dark Elves.

Pros: Awesome ranged attacks and power cards to support them. Treacherous power cards give you a unique competitive edge against other players.
Cons: Squishy units means you’ve got to know when to fight and when to move in. Players may give you strange “can I trust you” looks. Lack of strong melee units.

110185.description:
Qubic games evidently used same 3D board for two games, Qubic and Letter Go.

Letter Go is a 3D game to form 4 letter words on a 4x4x4 grid. The contents included the 3D board and cardboard letter chits. draw chits blindly and score points for words.

101996.description:
Pokemon Pom Jong the new game with a 5000 year old tradition.

Pom Jong is a game derived from its similarities to Gin Rummy and Mah Jongg.

Pom Jong characters are easier to learn than Mah Jongg characters, and the rules of the game are simpler.

As with Mah Jongg, the game of Pom Jong has its roots in China and is comprised of 81 plastic tiles of different suits and symbols showing your favorite Pokemon characters!

The tiles are collected and discarded by players one by one as they try to build sets, much like Gin Rummy, until one of the players acquires a winning hand.

Players may join or leave at the beginning or end of any hand.

Pom Jong is a fast and exciting game than can be played between 4 players and appeals to all ages.

It can be a family game, a teen game, an adult game, or solitary pastime.

This is a family game to be played by old & young alike!
101996.name: Pocket Monsters Family Pom Jong

110189.description:
Expanze 2 is the first expansion pack for the Czech talisman style boardgame Duchové, Démoni a Draci.

The expansion contains 48 new cards that are added to the games basic stack, and introduces several new statistics.

The player does now have to defend himself from three new types of attack (Hypnosis, Venom, Black magic) and a new creature ability is introduced (Flying).

The goal of this expansion is to increase the difficulty of the game, playability, replayability and entertaining value.

The designer of the game said, that the expansion is best played when two sets of the new cards are used.

110192.description: An even greater peril awaits with More Brutes! Expand the Brutes Fantasy Microgame with this add-on that includes 12 new Disposable Heroes Paper Miniatures and a total of 15 new character, weapon, and armor gimmicks/traits.

families: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)
110193.description:
Game description from the publisher:
Beginning the second cycle of Adventure Packs for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game, The Redhorn Gate allows players to experience the thrills of a mountain voyage full of surprises.

When some of Middle-earth's greatest heroes volunteer to escort Arwen to Rivendell, their pass through The Redhorn Gate begins an epic journey that will take them through bone-chilling snowstorms and hordes of enemies, into the twists and turns of the entire "Dwarrowdelf" cycle of Adventure Packs. With 60 new cards, including a new scenario and three copies of each new player card, The Redhorn Gate builds upon the encounter sets from the Khazad-dûm expansion to offer players exciting new challenges during an all-new narrative set in the Misty Mountains!
110193.name: Der Herr der Ringe: Das Kartenspiel –  Der Rothornpass

110194.description:
1959 Toy Rocket Space Game by the Trans-o-gram Co. Yep, the same company that made cookie cutters and other baking products!

Cover states: "Force enemy rockets out of orbit.... and CONQUER OUTER SPACE!

A simple game with a spinner (1-6 values) where players move their rockets to knock others out of orbit by moving their rocket on a atomic symbol shaped track to collide with an opponents rocket to take it out of orbit.

102005.description:
Scalaparola is a collection of 10 games to play with words, for 2-6 players.
The box includes tiles and cards featuring letters of the alphabet.
The characteristic of this collection is that the words formed during play earn more value if they match a category choose at random before starting.
The games are:

CROSSWORDS
Is to form words on the board with the tiles, making them cross each other.

ANAGRAMS
The goal is to earn more points by transforming or composing the words on the board.

SCALAPAROLA
Words are made using the cards you receive at the beginning of the game. Player who gets rid of all their cards win.

MIXER
Extracted 18 cards, players must form words and intersections using all 18 letters.

LONGEST WORD
Players must form the longest word using the 18 cards drawn at the beginning of the game.

THE HIDDEN WORDS
From a grid of cards, players turn as many cards as the value of the roll of a dice. If they can form a word with these letters withdraw the cards, otherwise they turn and make them available to other players. The memory component in this game rewards players.

TOUR OF WORDS
Players are given a card and select a category. Who can form a word that starts with the received card receives points. Whoever reaches the target score early in the game wins.

WORDS OF INTRIGUE
Players must make up the largest number of words with 18 letters selected at the beginning of the game. Player who arrives first at the target score.

PASSWORD
A player secretly made up a word of at least 5 letters. So put 30 cards on the table and represent how many letters the word is formed that has made. The other players must turn round a card, the first player declare whether it is part of his word, the player who first manages to figure out what was the word formed early in the game win.

WORD FOR WORD IN
Select a category, players are dealt 7 cards. They must form a word, as long as possible, inherent to the category selected, and the letters received. Player who first reaches 50 points.

102008.description:
In this game each player must first form a team, moving on the path outside of the board, meeting events, financing, buying players.
When his team will be ready to enter the central area of the board, will play the matches.
Games against neutral teams (not represented by any player) the points value of the team will determine the winner, while against teams of the other participating in the game, you will shoot to door with the special ball, to determine the outcome of the challenge.
The victory means the gain of a card-challenge, the player who at the end of the game earned the highest number of cards-challenge win the game.

102009.description:
This game simulates a football match.
Each player builds his own team by buying pieces until you reach the number of points determined at the beginning of the game.
Each piece has a different buying value. Pieces are marked on the values ​​of defense, attack, movement and power of the player that they represent.
It possible deploy its own team in the field with the classic patterns of football: 3-5-2, 4-4-2, 4-3-3 (defenders-midfielders-forwards).
A match lasts two periods of 16 rounds for a total of 32 rounds.
