The first player of the round secretly looks at two of the three suspects, optionally swapping the victim for one of these suspects. He then places a colored accusation marker below one of the suspects. The next player looks at the two suspects not just marked with an accusation marker, then places a colored accusation marker of her own, covering any markers already beneath that suspect. This continues until all four players have placed an accusation marker, with each player not being allowed to look at the suspect just accused.

The round ends, and players reveal the suspects. Who's the culprit? The suspect bearing the highest number – except if the #5 is among the suspects, in which case the suspect with the lowest number is guilty. (The suspect with no number is always innocent.) Anyone who has accused the correct suspect receives his accusation marker back. Any markers incorrectly placed are flipped colored-side down and given to the player who owns the marker on top of the stack. The first player token rotates clockwise, then a new round begins.

The game ends when any player has no colored markers available to place or any player has collected eight or more markers, whatever their color. The player holding the fewest markers wins the game.
102181.name: Hattari

102182.description:
From the publishers web site:

"Some fortunes are better left unread..."

"Greetings brothers, the time is nigh....Not all of us are strong enough to carry the blessings of the Ancient one. For his wisdom transcends the stars. His influence through our dreams and unspoken realms, deep beneath the sea, he waits. Dreaming for the day he shall be free. Even though we may be weak as mortals, he gathers strength from our devotion, hope through our determination, and power from our sacrifice. While we all wish to share in his gifts, the Great One only rewards those of purist faith. All others will be crushed beneath the waves when R’yleh rises from the deep."

Cthulhu Fu is a variant of the popular Cookie Fu system where players take on the roles of rival cultists in dark cult world of Cthulhu (circa 1930). The cultists summon / manipulate the forces of darkness against each other and claim victory in the eyes of the great overlord. There are many ways to defeat your opponent: summon the forces of darkness to rip apart your foe or by shattering the barriers that protect his mind.

This stand alone game comes packed in a black mini take-out pail, 5 dice, rules menu and "Miskatonic Mint" flavored Omikuji (fortune cookie).

102188.description:
Description from the box:

"An exciting game ...full of ups and downs !! Are you ready for it ..!! Enjoy the game of cricket in the form of board game with the same intensity and see if you can control your heart beat.

A unique double sided board with an option of two kinds of plays...either from the bowling side or from the batting side!! Interesting and captivating ...So what are you waiting for...!!!"

Actually, this game is a basic roll-and-move, collecting "world cup coins" aong the way according to instructions on certain spaces. When all players have reached the end of the track, the one with the most coins wins. There is not a single decision to make in the game.

The game was made for "Poundland" stores by Play Craft Traders, trade marked by Fun-Tastic.

110383.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Scramblitz requires fast thinking and faster fingers. Each player starts with a mat and a set of 16 double-sided tiles. Your objective: be the first player to arrange your tiles to match the puzzle card. The challenge: which sides of your tiles should face up? It takes plenty of flipping, flopping and swapping to win the game.

110384.description: Crazy creatures abound in this fast-paced, mixed-up matching race! Draw a card to reveal the challenge. Will you need to find the identical creatures within two differently colored frames, or do quick math once you spot the numbers? Race against your opponents to spot it or solve it. The winner keeps the card. Be the first to collect enough cards to spell “Look Look,” and you take the game! Game board is comprised of eight interchangeable frames, making it a new game every time you play. Includes 68 challenge cards. 2 or more players.

110385.description:
An abstract strategy game played on a special board. Two players, X and O, take turns placing a bridge between any two of their adjacent pegs not blocked by an existing bridge. The first player to complete a connected chain of bridges between their sides wins. Ties are not possible.

Visavis is a Shannon switching game on the edges and belongs to the same class of connection games as Bridg-It and TwixT (and to some extend Trellis). Even though a trivial winning strategy has been found for Bridg-It (called Connexxions on the server) Visavis consists of a more complex system of overlaid triangular grids that allows richer variety of play, and no winning strategy is known.

Michail Antonow points out that different tactics must be applied when blocking an opponent's rightward path as opposed to a leftward path. The path can be abruptly cut by a single piece in one direction only; in the opposite direction a single bridge will only divert the path and two bridges are needed for a successful block.

The rules state that a bridge can be placed between any two adjacent pegs of the same colour. However since it can never help to place a bridge between the opponent's pegs, then it is assumed that all moves are made between the current player's pegs. This also simplifies the board notation.
110385.name: Nexus

102194.description:
TRIAD 2 contains 3 new Aether Captains games -
BorderStrike - a mini war game on 6 hex map cards. Players take on the roll of the Aether Navy or the Federation of Air Pirates, each commanding 2 ships. On a turn players may either navigate, attack or repair their ships. Dice are used to resolve battle skirmishes and damage taken. 2 players 10-20 minutes

Black Raiders - Air Pirates have gathered to decide who shall lead them next, in trial by combat! Build the strongest airship, stock it with weapons, a fearless crew, and a fast engine. Then engage in a do or die dogfight to see who will have supremacy over the Federation of Air Pirates. Players take turns stocking their air ship sections based on combination dice rolls then battle each other. Last one standing wins 2-3 players, 10-20 minutes

Aether Shaman - Shamen of the two most powerful Northern Tribes meet once a year in a contest of wills and talent, shaping aetheric energy in a day long duel. Only one, however, can become an AetherShaman. Players use 6 cards as a game board adding markers based on die rolls to 5 different areas. Strategy involves using your dice wisely to control the game and victory points gained. 2 players, 10-15 minutes

Triad 2 also contains the following card expansions to the first Aether Captains: Triad game -

Celinian Trader:
2 Income cards: to keep track of gold earned during the game. Each player begins with nine gold pieces.

6 Trade Market cards: replace the original Trade Market card with these. Shuffle the six cards each round and turn one card face up to set Market Buy/Sell prices.

Intrigue:
1 Victory Point Track card for scorekeeping.

10 City State cards: shuffle cards at the beginning of the game. Each player should draw one card to determine their Ruling House and keep it hidden. Set the remaining City State cards aside.

Zeppelin Derby:
2 Derby Course cards: for a longer game replace
the original Finish Line card with these new cards.
The expansion features a new Aether Mine icon for the derby course.

7 Race Cards: shuffle these with the original cards for the extended game. Each player will be dealt 6 cards instead of 4. Set the remaining cards aside.

102197.description:
Cookie Fu: Grandmaster Chi Battles is a fast, fun, combat card game. Players take on the role of their favorite Grandmaster battling each other head to head in an all out Chi smack-down to see whose Cookie Fu reigns supreme!

Grandmaster Chi Battles is a DUAL PLAY product, usable both by itself and for the Cookie Fu dice game. No more fumbling with slips of paper for your Cookie Fu moves! Each card displays all critical battle information, an essential aid for any Fu Fighter.

Three decks are featured for this release and support the already existing Cookie Fu Clans: Chocolate Ox, Vanilla Hare, and Coconut Monkey. Plus, brand new allies from: Lemon Dragon, Orange Tiger, and the Berry Rooster Clans also make their appearance in the Fortune Decks to aid in the battle vs. the evil sorcerer Bok Choy!

Each fixed 56 card deck contains a customized set of all Fu moves released with the Cookie Fu base set dice game. This includes all Chi actions (Blast, Block, Heal) as well as all Clan specific moves found in the fortune cookies. Adding to the fun, Ally and new Clan moves round out each set - along with a few uninvited guests.

Using a unique mechanic of seeded and opening moves, players duel with rock, paper, scissors, against their opponent's moves. Utilizing attack and defense scores with a "refocusing strategy" as well as hand management all combine to make Grandmaster Chi Battles an enjoyable alternative to the Cookie Fu dice game.

Fast and furious, Grandmaster Chi Battles are different every time. Just unwrap, shuffle and play! With or without dice, Cookie Fu Fortune Decks are guaranteed to Kick Some Cookie...

Integrates with:

Cookie Fu

families: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
102198.description:
An exclusive set of 8 cards given to supporters of the D-Day Dice Kickstarter campaign. This small set contains a small sample of card types from the game and its first expansion. These cards will never be reprinted again, but similar cards might be included in later expansions (with different names).

Content:
- 3 Awards: Voluntary Service Medal, Good Conduct Medal, Order of the Bath
- 3 Regular Items: Cigarette, Sweetheart Pin, Field Telephone
- 1 Vehicle: Personnel Carrier
- 1 Decoration (from the Atlantikwall expansion): Sports Badge

102199.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to CampAntics, the board game of summer camp adventures, mischief, activities, and lots of social interaction. If you’re curious about summer camps, or have already been to one, you’ll love this game!

CampAntics is primarily for children from 7 to 14 years of age. The summer camp theme is also very attractive to older children, parents, and grandparents. Each trip around the board is one, very realistic day at camp. Campers decide how many days to play, and enjoy a social experience like no other. During a camper’s stay at CampAntics, points are won and lost with the ups and downs of daily life at a great summer camp. Each space on the board relates to an activity that you would do at camp. Some spaces will reward you for an activity and others will penalize you for let’s say... throwing a water balloon. You roll dice to move and each trip around the board is a day at camp. You choose the number of days based on level of play. The winner is the camper with the most points (acorns) at the end of the game.

102205.description:
Publisher Blurb:

You've defeated your opponent across all the terrain that the BattleTech Introductory Box Set has to offer and now you want more worlds to conquer. Grab your dice and start rolling, because this product is for you!

HexPack: Cities and Roads is a flexible map system aid for the BattleTech game system. Designed for use in conjunction with other pre-printed mapsheets (such as those from the Introductory Box Set), the system’s flexibility allows for easy modifications to existing mapsheets, increasing the enjoyment of a given scenario as players quickly change the terrain to bring new excitement to each game they play! A booklet contains two ready-to-play scenarios, which include expanded play options such as clearing woods, buildings and additional weather conditions.

Contents:

-One 18″ x 22″ full-color gameboard-quality mapsheet, with a different map printed on either side.
-Four punch-out-and-ready-to-play gameboard-quality HexTile sheets.
-Sixteen page booklet.

Miniatures not included.

110403.description:
Take a completed Sudoku and what can you do with it...how about getting a little more use before tossing it into the recycle bin...Sudoku Recycled are a series of pencil and paper games that you can play using a completed Sudoku. Currently, there are 3 different games you can play and all you need is a pencil, a completed Sudoku and the rules to the game you want to play.

There is:

Tic-Tac-Sudoku a simple Tic-Tac-Toe game for 2 players that brings Tic-Tac-Toe to a new level.

Snakedoku a 2-4 player game where you try and make snakes (the longer the better), but your opponents will try and stop you by cutting in front of you with their own snake. This game also has the Mongoose variant and everyone knows snakes don’t like mongooses.

Sudoku Warriors a 2-3 player game where you place you warriors around villages to gain control of their resources. When a battle breaks out you will need the village's resources to win the battle for a Province. Win the required number of Provinces and win the game.

Don't have a completed Sudoku to play on...no problem just make a Pseudoku.

102212.description: Expansion map for the China / Web of Power family of games. Available for online play at www.michaelschacht.net, where you could also print a copy of the map. It is a re-imagining / re-structuring of the territories and paths of China / Web of Power over the landmass of Scandinavia / Eastern Russia / Northern Europe.

102213.description: The game includes 400 different picture cards with unusual objects with various uses and funtions. Players try to guess or bluff the use/function of the item in play, and write a description on a note. These descriptions plus the right answer are then read out loud, so the players try to pick the right answer among the false ones.
102213.name: Bild-Rappakalja

102214.description:
A very easy educational board game for children where each player in turn must pick a thematic card with drawings, look at it secretly and name an animal, object, etc related to the card and beginning with the letter his pivot is on, starting with the "A" and advancing along the alphabet track.

Each player has 30 seconds to say a name, if he can not do it, he hands the card to the next player. The first person to reach the Z position on the board is the winner.

Contents:
-4 coloured pivots
-Track board
-16 thematic cards
-Rules (on the back of the cover box)

name.#text: Mil nombres de la A a la Z

110407.description:
In the distant world of Laar, wandering armies led by powerful magicians live a life of battle. For eons they fought for survival in this world, once scorched by fires of the Cataclysm. Now you have the chance to gather your own army and become the maker of your own fate. Perhaps your path will shape the fate of Laar as well...

In fierce battles in Berserk: Tactical Card Game - War of Realms, your life and the lives of your trusted armies will depend on your skill as a strategist and a warlord. And then, when in the heat of battle you forget about your wounds, forget about the future and about the past, you will understand why this is not simply a game. It is Berserk.

Berserk: Tactical Card Game was previously published in Russian as a collectible card game sold in randomized packs. This English edition of the game uses a fixed card format in which the same cards will be available in each standalone game and expansion pack. Two different ready-to-play decks are included in War of Realms, the first release in this new format.

Reimplements:

Berserk: Trading Card Game

name.#text: Berserk: Tactical Card Game – War of Realms

102219.description:
Launch it to win! Grab you launcher and send your checkers zooming through the air with three fast-flying checker challenges. Basic Frantic Launch challenges you to be the first to land four-in-a-row. The Championship Frantic Launch is your chance to flip to five points first and win. And the Advanced Power Launch is power checkers for maximum fun. So load ‘em up, launch ‘em up and try to connect ‘em up!

Includes 21 red checkers, 21 yellow checkers, 4 pillar pieces, 2 clear grid trays, 1 red checker launcher, 1 yellow checker launcher and instructions.

Fast-flying checkers game gives you three different checker challenges to prove you can connect ‘em up and win! Includes 21 red checkers, 21 yellow checkers, 4 pillar pieces, 2 clear grid trays, 1 red checker launcher, 1 yellow checker launcher and instructions.

For 2 or more players.
102219.name: 4 gewinnt Schnipp den Chip

102222.description:
This expansion was originally available only through mail-order and is now out of print.

From the rulebook:

Pits & Traps is a Warhammer Quest supplement that allows any party of adventurers that is bold enough to add two new areas to any dungeon they explore. While the new areas are dangerous, they offer rich rewards to those brave enough, or foolhardy enough, to venture into them.

When you use the new board sections it is assumed that the builder of the dungeon has decided to protect his lair (i.e. the objective room) with an additional ante-chamber protected by some of his fiercest warriors. He has also built in a short-cut to the objective room, concealed by secret doors, which leads to another part of the dungeon closer to the exit. Obviously only a great, powerful and, above all, rich individual could afford such safe-guards, so the rewards you expect to find at the end of the dungeon are somewhat greater than they would normally be.

102223.description:
This is an expansion for Warhammer Quest and was available through mail-order. The rules allow a player to play the Kislevite Shaman Warrior.

Description:

KISLEVITE SHAMAN

The Kislevite Shaman uses Mana to cast Blessings much in the same way the Wizard uses Magic to cast Spells. The Shaman begins the game with a Totem Staff and either a Raven or a Wolf Spirit Familiar.

Basic rules, Advanced Rules, and Roleplaying Rules are included. For example, rules for the Spirit Familiars are listed in the Basic Game, while 38 Blessings are included for the Shaman to cast in the Advanced Game, as are rules for visiting Settlements. A description of how the Shaman might act and react to people and events in the Old World are mentioned in the Roleplaying Section.

This pack contained only a rules booklet and contained no miniature, cards, or counters.

This is not a complete game, a copy of Warhammer Quest is necessary to use the contents of this box.

102224.description:
This is an expansion for Warhammer Quest and was available through mail-order.

This is not a complete game, a copy of Warhammer Quest is necessary to use the contents of this box.

Description (from the rulebook):

HALFLING THIEF

Well known for their nimble feet and even nimbler fingers, Halflings find themselves drawn towards the danger and excitement of stealing. As can be expected, the speed and agility of Halfling Thieves has been noted by many of those who seek their fortune delving into abandoned Dwarf Holds and performing mighty deeds in dungeons

Basic rules, Advanced Rules, and Roleplaying Rules are included in this booklet. For example, rules for the Halfling's Starting Equipment is listed in the Basic Game, while rules for visiting Settlements and new Special Locations are listed in the Advanced Section, in addition to many rules to deal with all of the trouble the Halfling Thief might get into. A description of how to use the Halfling Thief with a Gamemaster is found in the Roleplaying Section.

This pack contained only a rules booklet and contained no miniature, cards, or counters.

Recommended Citadel Journal miniatures (from the Halfling Thief Character Pack) were:

Bumblebean Lightfoot
Didy Bugry
Ned Neddley
Nifflet "Statue Stealer" Stumbly
Nikkit Kwik
Two-Feet-Tall Telworth Buttercup

This is not a complete game, a copy of Warhammer Quest is necessary to use the contents of this box.

Warhammer Quest fan - Halfling Thief

110424.description:
Who Let The Dogs Out (TM) is a new board game for all the family. The objective is to round up your four escaped dogs and get them back in your house with a bone for each. Remember - my doggie won't stay in if he don't have no bone.

The square game board is divided diagonally into four backyards, with a small house located in the middle of each edge of the board. The game commences with one of each players dogs placed on a marked starting position in each players backyard. Players then use game cards to move one or more dogs directly or to pick up sausages and/or bones to move their own dogs strategically towards, and eventually into, their own home. The first player to get all of their dogs into their house with a bone wins.

102237.description:
Drako is an asymmetrical game for two players, with one player leading a team of three dwarves who are experienced dragon hunters and the other playing a red dragon that has spread terror amongst local peasants. The dwarves have managed to trap the dragon in a shady valley at the foot of the mountain where it lives – apparently dragons can't resist the smell of freshly slaughtered sheep – but despite being in chains, the dragon is still young and ferocious, providing the dwarves with the difficult task of killing it without being killed themselves.

Each player has a unique deck of cards, and each card has symbols on it to indicate possible actions. The dragon can move around the game board, bite, shoot fire, fly (in a limited way), and defend itself from attacks; the dwarves can attack with their axes, shoot crossbows, move individually or in groups, protect themselves with shields, and cast nets.

Each player can have up to six cards in hand, and managing these cards and maneuvering their characters on the game board are the keys to victory. Has the opponent run out of defense cards? Can the dragon nip the strongest dwarf and take him out without opening himself up to attacks from the others? The dwarves can attack the dragon's wings to keep it from flying, chop its legs so it can't move, and cut its throat to prevent it from breathing fire.

If the dwarves kill the dragon before it breaks from the trap – that is before dwarves run out of cards – they win. If the dragon survives or defeats the dwarves, he will manage to free his trapped leg and fly away, triumphing over his opponents.
102237.name: Drako

102238.description:
GRAND PRIX EXPERT, the first boardgame simulating formula one ( F1) managing and racing (may be applied to Indycar) ! A game with no equivalent: build your team, choose your engine, tires, fuel, manager and pilot, and start a complete season of 16 Grand Prix, or even several seasons one after the other. ALL the elements of car racing are taken into account : team management, evolution of the car and even race events themselves. A revolutionary concept !

The game was presented in CANNES (international Festival), from February 23rd to february 27th, 2011). It is supported by the Belgian reference F1i Magazine.

110433.description:
imd-spelet is an abstract game, but with a loose word description, or rather inspiration of todays internet usage.

The game-play is based on placing and moving tiles according to dice throws, the goal is to catch the opponent's tiles. It use four tiles as two sided dice with the values 0 or 1 to create binary numbers. The dice are thrown in a decided order to create a number between 0000 = 0 to 1111 = 15.

The game is published as the cover of an educational catalog connected to the IT, media and design (imd)-program at Södertörn University, Stockholm, Sweden.

110434.description:
Farkle Frenzy adds an exciting new dimension to the classic Farkle dice game! As with traditional Farkle, players roll 6 dice, remove only the dice you want to use for points, then re-roll the remaining dice. Press down the funky Bubble Hub to vibrate and bounce the common die, and then let the fun begin! Take a risk and roll to collect scoring dice on the stepped Dice Risers, and race to fill yours first!
For 2 to 4 Players
Ages 8 & Up

110435.description: Quiz game on the subject of horses, with puzzles and poster, questions from the categories horse and humans, riding and sport, horse mannerisms, horses’ bodies, knowledge and horse breeds. The arrow is turned for the category, correct answers earn a puzzle part, one can place a tip for answers on other player’s questions and earn irons which can be changed into puzzle parts. The first player to complete his puzzle wins the game.
110435.name: Das grosse Kosmos Pferde-Quiz

110437.description:
On 32 cards there are 2 questions with three answers each, on the back with information and illustration on the subject. Players receive questions cards, in case of 3 and 4 players also betting cards.

The active player is asked by the quizmaster, if the first answer is right, he is asked the second question. If the answer is again correct, the player receives the card and places it with his betting cards. In case the first answer was wrong the left neighbour of the player can risk an answer and use one of his betting cards. If he answers wrong, he loses he card. When no one has questions cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

110438.description:
"The world of stars" in English
On 32 cards there are 2 questions with three answers each, on the back with information and illustration on the subject. Players receive questions cards, in case of 3 and 4 players also betting cards.

The active player is asked by the quizmaster, if the first answer is right, he is asked the second question. If the answer is again correct, the player receives the card and places it with his betting cards. In case the first answer was wrong the left neighbour of the player can risk an answer and use one of his betting cards. If he answers wrong, he loses he card. When no one has questions cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

102247.description:
OVERVIEW: A dice game for two players. Players create random FORCE POOLS, arrange them secretly into four Lines opposite each other, then reveal their setups and resolve combat. The leftover 5 COMMDICE may be added to a player's Line using SPECIALS [surprises]. Loser of each combat surrenders a die from that Line. After three rounds of play, the player with the most captured dice wins.
DETAILS: Each player starts with their own pool of 45 dice. Select 10 randomly and roll, repeating twice for a possible 30 dice FORCE POOL [some may be chosen over others]. Players then bid for a COMMON DICE POOL of 10 dice. Winner rolls the COMMDICE, keeps three and passes two to the loser. Players then secretly arrange their dice into four Combat Lines [hence the name]. Each opposing Line is resolved [with special dice that can remove, add or manipulate dice in their own or opponent's Line] with the loser surrendering one die. After three rounds of play, the player with the most captured dice wins.
COMPONENTS:
90 dice [total]
- 45 of one color [Player A]
- 45 of a different color [Player B]
- 10 of a third color [Common Dice]
a pair of hand-sewn dice bags
a 20 page rulebook [includes a complete game, in step-by-step example format]
a pair of laminated cheat sheets

102248.description:
Legend tells of a square island where ancient tribes built 9 temples to 3 gods named Tiki, Taki and Troika. Every summer solstice the neighboring island clans send their finest warriors to the island to compete in a tournament. The first warrior to control three temples in a row will receive the Crown of Three. And his people will rule all of the island clans for the following year.

In Troika (aka Tiki, Taki, Troika) warriors secretly choose Temple cards and Challenge cards in an attempt to control temples on the legendary square island. Temple cards are simultaneously revealed and if there is a conflict at that location, Challenge cards are revealed and resolved. Since Challenge cards do not move back to a warrior's hand until all four have been played, it would be wise to remember what the other warriors have played in previous rounds.

Troika includes three versions of the game.
Tiki - A simple and fast version of the game where the winner is the first player to get three in a row.
Taki - Introduces Bonus Row cards that are randomly chosen at the beginning of the game. Plus the game continues until all nine temples are controlled.
Troika - Introduces Temple Bonus cards. During the game players have the opportunity to take Temple Bonus cards that can increase, or possibly decrease their score at the end of the game.

102251.description:
Across this land, the people of the world bow before their kings in the name of power and glory. What they do not understand is that power and glory need not rest in the same hands. Let the kings have their glory, if that's what they call it. Let their names be written down and passed from father to son for years to come. We care not for such things... for now.

We are happy to stand above the stage in quiet darkness, pulling the strings and shaping the world as we see fit. We are the rulers of kings, and this is our land and in the end, we'll see where the true glory lies.

Of Power & Glory is played in several rounds. Each player has several pawns that represent nobles in a Western Europe that is ruled by eight Kings. Each Nobel may take one action per round. These actions may place the Nobles in the court of one of the Kings to garner the favor of that King, in a particular territory to postpone war in the area or perhaps hidden in the shadows to bring sabotage upon a King.

After all player actions have been taken, the territories represented by the three leftmost, uncovered territory cards are battled over by the kings in order. Immediately after each battle, the winning King will hand out favors to the nobles that are in his court. Nobles my choose the form of their favors. They may choice, among other options, Power to aid them in the future or Glory to advance them into the lead. Once all Battles have been fought and the end of round actions are completed, the next round begins with players taking actions again.

In Of Power & Glory, each player represents a noble family in Western Europe during a period of war. The war is being fought among Eight Kings in the area. Players will need to aid the Kings in order to gain power and then use this power to help themselves, perhaps at the cost of the very Kings that gave them power in the first place.

Of Power & Glory is a Machiavellian strategy game that rewards foresight, deceptive sleight of hand, and investing your influence strategically to better your position amongst the other noble families.

102253.description:
Spearpoint 1943 Eastern Front is an easy to play tactical wargame set in the Eastern Front of WWII. It is a new standalone game in the Spearpoint 1943 Expandable Card Game (ECG) series. The game plays best with 2 players but also includes a 4 player variant.

Designed by Byron Collins (4th published game design)

Highly Re-playable: Pre-game deck construction, dice, card drafting, and other proven mechanics ensure no two games are the same!
Fun and Fast: Easy rules with continual involvement by both players. Game sets up and plays in about 30 minutes.

Integrates with: Spearpoint 1943 (2010)
Expanded by: Spearpoint 1943 Village and Defensive Line Map Expansion (2012)
Expanded by: Spearpoint 1943 Eastern Front Heavy Weapons Expansion (2015)

Eastern Front introduces the Red Army and features 220 new cards, scenarios, and is backwards compatible with the original Spearpoint 1943 and the Origins Award nominated Village and Defensive Line Map Expansion.

110 Unit Cards feature an assortment of historical German and Soviet squad-level infantry, artillery, armor, and aircraft.

55 Command Cards give support, provide special functions, and may even modify die rolls.

25 Damage Cards apply unique Damage Effects to units as they reach their critical break point. These Damage Effects can force units to withdraw, take cover, or may immobilize tanks, knock out weapons, wound infantry, damage aircraft engines or ailerons, and more, adding to the battlefield chaos.

12 Scenario Cards take players through battles that occurred during 1943 on the Eastern Front including Operation Zitadelle.

10 Event Cards add chaos for both players when drawn.

2 Quick Reference Card sets for each player help keep the rules summarized and quickly accessible.

2 Card List Cards detail the included Units for each side.

Promo cards feature box art from the Spearpoint 1943 Series.

• 220 Cards (Soviet and German Units, Command Cards, Damage Cards, Event Cards, Scenario Cards, Card List Cards, Quick Ref Cards...)
• 4 D10 Dice (2 German, 2 Soviet)
• 1 Rules Booklet
• 12 Scenarios
• Promo Cards
• QR-Code linked Video Tutorial

102254.description:
Frontline General: Spearpoint 1987 is a new standalone modern combat card wargame from veteran designer James M. Day (Panzer, 88, Armor, MBT, IDF, Kaiser’s Pirates, and a host of computer games to his credit) and system designer Byron Collins of Collins Epic Wargames (the publisher).

The basic Spearpoint 1943 card-based system is applied to a near-modern 1987 European hypothetical conflict setting between the US and USSR, drawing from Jim Day's expertise on cold war era US and Soviet military equipment. This game includes Command, Unit, and Damage Cards, dice, tracking counters, rules and scenarios, and is expected to be released in 2012.

Box Art by Mark Mahaffey is coming soon with additional previews and information to follow.

102259.description:
The beautifully handcrafted, handfinished 17" wood board is laser-engraved on both sides, with handpainted accents. The larger grid accommodates 8 pieces each, numbered 1 through 8, for the two-player game and comes with 4 octahedral dice that let you roll up to the number 8.

On the other side of the board there is a 3-player version accommodating a simultaneous 3 player game with the original 6 pieces.

MANOOVER PLUS FOR THREE PLAYERS:

To play the three-player game, use the side of the Manoover Plus board that has three goals. The players are known as “Red,” “Blue,” and “Green,” and each has six pieces of his color.

To start a game, each player throws one die, and the one throwing the highest number goes first. If two or more players tie with the same high number, then those who tie throw again. After the first player takes his turn, the turn proceeds clockwise around the board.

The three-player game is generally the same as the game for two players. Each player’s turn consists of a control phase where one player rolls the dice that corresponds to the numbers on each of their pieces. For each number rolled they are allowed to move the piece in the direction it is facing or turn the piece one to the right or left. If a piece has been pushed/moved off the board or has already been scored the player gets one chance to re-roll that die. This is then followed by an automatic phase where all of the player's pieces move once in the direction it is facing regardless of consequence. Each player tries to get pieces (of any color) to enter his hexagonal goal near the center of the board.

MANOOVER PLUS FOR TWO PLAYERS:

This is the game Kate Jones created on the suggestion of a customer who liked the standard version but wanted something more complex. Each player has eight pieces instead of six, and the players throw four 8-sided dice to determine which four pieces to move.

families: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
102260.description:
Operation Neptune offers 6 new Battle Maps: 4 of them are normal Battle Maps and 2 are double-sized, giant Battle Maps. New features like the “Command Posts” and the “Few Good Men” rules give these new maps a character of their own. This expansion also includes 2 new Items, 2 new Awards and 1 new Specialist, the "Executive Officer", who comes in 4 different versions (depending on the player color).

The Battle Maps are:

Mission Albany
Mission Boston
Brécourt Manor
Juno Beach II
Operation Neptune (double-sized)
Operation Overlord (double-sized)

110453.description:
Koins is a simple and engaging game for three players.

The players all start out with a handful of coins. Each turn, the players bet one or more of their coins, the bets are called "hands".
If all hands are different, the middle hand is the winner (ex. 5 out of 2, 5, 7).
If two hands are the same, the third hand is the winner (ex. 2 out of 5, 5, 2).
If all hands are the same, there is no winner and the coins are put into the pool.

The player with the winning hand takes all the coins that were bet that turn, as well as the pool if there is any, and a new round is played.

families: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
102263.description:
The War Stories expansion contains 4 “mini-expansions” that are completely independent from each other, that can be added individually or as a whole to the base game. They consist of:

"War Stories": little scenarios that are written on a card, randomly drawn at the beginning of the game. These scenarios use tokens to add various effects to the game, like artillery fire, or to set specific objectives for the players, like trying to find dead officers on the beach. Some even simulate the rising tide or give the player added bonuses if they perform certain actions.

"Legendary Units": Now, every player plays a historical unit that fought in the Normandy landings. Legendary Units come with their respective Legendary Specialists and Legendary Items, which are always available, but only to their respective Legendary Unit. Also, each Unit comes with its own set of RWB bonuses, adding a lot of replay value and variety to the game.

"Grey Dice": The Grey dice take the color of the player’s choice, but can only be used in certain circumstances (or with the included Items and Specialist). Many optional rules are also included, offering a great variety of uses for these dice.

"Servicemen": The Servicemen cards represent individual infantrymen that join your Unit for a while. Each comes with resources: on every Serviceman card, 2 or 3 dice results are shown. You can discard the Serviceman whenever you want to add his results to your Final Tally (this might help you obtain some RWB bonuses).

families: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
102264.description:
This small expansion contains 4 new Battle Maps, using some of the new features introduced in the "Operation Neptune" expansion (including special rules if you don't own Operation Neptune).

The Battle Maps are:

Operation Tonga
Mission Chicago
Pegasus Bridge
Gold Beach II

110457.description: 32 cards show 2 questions with 3 answers each, on the backside information and illustrations on the subject are given. Players receive quest cards and betting cards for 3 and 4 players. The quiz master poses a question to his neighbour, in case of a correct answer also the second questions - if both are correct the candidate receives the card. If the first answer is wrong, the neighbour of the candidate can risk a betting card and try to answer. If he answers wrong, he loses the card. If nobody has cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

110458.description:
"Our bodies quiz game" in English
32 cards show 2 questions with 3 answers each, on the backside information and illustrations on the subject are given. Players receive quest cards and betting cards for 3 and 4 players. The quiz master poses a question to his neighbour, in case of a correct answer also the second questions – if both are correct the candidate receives the card. If the first answer is wrong, the neighbour of the candidate can risk a betting card and try to answer. If he answers wrong, he loses the card. If nobody has cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

102267.description:
Simple statistical replay game on tennis, featuring 4 sample tournaments (Wimbledon 74, Roland Garros 76, US Open 87, Australian open 2005).
It contains data for each player in the tournament, each rated for service, return and decision factor.
Game play is very easy: roll a percentage dice for the service of the first player; if the roll is inside the range, he wins the game, otherwise roll on the return factor of the opponent and see if he wins the game; if not, the decision factor and another roll of a die give the game to one of players.
Many expansion set forthcoming, even for such esoterica as mixed doubles!

110461.description: The game of MATCHET is played with 36 triangle shaped pieces. These pieces are tri-colored and have numbers from 1 to 10 at their points. The object of the game is to match the colors and numbers in multiples of 5, First person to get rid of all his triangles is the winner.

110464.description:
"Aviation and aerospace" in English
32 cards show 2 questions with three answers each, the back side shows information and illustration on the subject. Players have question cards and risk cards, the starting player chooses a card and the candidate on his left tries to answer the first question - if he is right, the second is asked. In case of two correct answers the candidate receives the card and puts it with his risk cards. If the first answer is wrong, the left neighbour of the candidate can take over by risking one of his risk cards - if he answers wrong he loses the card. At the end the player with the most cards wins.

102274.description:
Players take on the role of investors expandning their own business with new branches being established and opened continuously. They need to balance out all economic activity to be able to progress evenly and gain points in the best possible way.

Players use pawns moving on a circular board each Round (in a typical roll-and-move fashion), cards from variuos piles according to the spaces they land on and their own judgement in managing their branches.

110467.description:
"Planetary & Space Quiz Game" in English

32 cards show 2 questions with 3 answers each, on the backside information and illustrations on the subject are given. Players receive quest cards and betting cards for 3 and 4 players. The quiz master poses a question to his neighbour, in case of a correct answer also the second questions – if both are correct the candidate receives the card. If the first answer is wrong, the neighbour of the candidate can risk a betting card and try to answer. If he answers wrong, he loses the card. If nobody has cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

110469.description:
"Knights & Castles quiz game" in English

32 cards show 2 questions with three answers each, the back side shows information and illustration on the subject. Players have question cards and risk cards, the starting player chooses a card and the candidate on his left tries to answer the first question - if he is right, the second is asked. In case of two correct answers the candidate receives the card and puts it with his risk cards. If the first answer is wrong, the left neighbour of the candidate can take over by risking one of his risk cards - if he answers wrong he loses the card. At the end the player with the most cards wins.

110470.description:
"Our Earth Quiz Game" in English

32 cards show 2 questions with three answers each, the back side shows information and illustration on the subject. Players have question cards and risk cards, the starting player chooses a card and the candidate on his left tries to answer the first question - if he is right, the second is asked. In case of two correct answers the candidate receives the card and puts it with his risk cards. If the first answer is wrong, the left neighbour of the candidate can take over by risking one of his risk cards - if he answers wrong he loses the card. At the end the player with the most cards wins.

102281.description:
Family game made after the popular Danish series running on DR1. Meet the characters from the popular series and use your knowledge to move to the position of power.
Answer question and move around board, collecting gold. Move to the center and pay the needed amount to win the game. Be the first to achieve that and win the game.

102282.description:
A challenging and entertaining game for the whole family.
Come inside to James and Adam Price cottage kitchen and battle with the chefs Price brothers. The goal is to become the first to gather all the ingredients for a 3-course meal - but remember to have plenty of butter! James and Adam Price have great success on a DR1 channel ingested with their food program "Eating with Price," which has been followed faithfully by 1 million viewers. The fourth season of "Eating with Price" is shown on DR1 in autumn 2011.
The first player to collect enough ingredients for a 3-course meal is the winner, provided they have enough butter like shown on the board.

families: Die Fürsten von Catan / The Rivals for Catan
111255.description:
Johannes,der Advokat is the 2011 special card for "The Rivals for Catan".

This card was given out by Klaus Teuber at the SPIEL11 in Essen.

Text of the card:

Verlieren Sie durch eine Aktionskarte Ihres Mitspielers Rohstoffe, dürfen Sie 1 Gold zahlen und würfeln. 1-3: Fordern Sie 1 Rohstoff von ihm; führt er, dürfen Sie 1 weiteren von ihm fordern. 4,5: Sie erhalten Ihr Gold zurück.
111255.name: Die Fürsten von Catan: Sonderkarte 2011 – Johannes, der Advokat

110482.description:
A memory game that teaches you French.

Memory Mate uses simple object matching to improve your child's concentration. Trying to remember where the pig, dog and chicken are hiding is a fun way to hone memory skills - all-important building blocks of learning!

A pair of puzzle cards match by picture and fit, one puzzle card as the English word and the other the word in Spanish.

Spread out all the cards facedown on a large flat surface. On your turn, flip over two cards to try to make a picture match.

If you match a pair, fit them side-by-side and say the name of the object shown in English and French. Keep the pair and try again for another match by turning over two new cards.

If the two cards picked don't match, your turn is over. Flip the cards facedown and try to remember where they are for next time.

Players alternate turns and continue to match until no cards remain. The winner is the player with the most pairs.

110483.description:
Kuku is a Polish traditional card game for two or more players. It's slightly modified version of Kemps.

It is played with standard deck of 52 cards. Each player is dealt a hand of 3 cards, but one player is dealt a hand of 4 cards. The rest of cards are irrelevant. If any player has three cards in the same color or value he says "kuku!" and wins. After dealing the player with 4 cards gives one of his cards to the player on his left. One card (not necessarily the same) is going around until one of the players has three cards in the same color or value.

110484.description:
Six ways to play! Learn shapes, colors, animals, beginning letter sounds, counting and addition!

Object: Be the first player to shout "BINGO" by getting 4-in-a-row.

Game One: Color/Shape Match
Use the spinner, and cards with shapes on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the shape and color to which the arrow points. For example, "Blue Star!". Then all players search their cards for that color and shape. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling. For shorter games, just match colors or just match shapes.

Game Two: Number Match
Use the spinner, and cards with numbers on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the number to which the arrow points. For example, "number 9!". Then all players search their cards for that number. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling.

Game Three: Animal Match
Use the spinner, and cards with animals on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and calling out the animal and color to which the arrow points. For example, "Purple Lion!". Then all players search their cards for that color and animal. If they have a match, they cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling. For shorter games, just match animals. Or for a beginning letter challenge, instead of announcing the animal the caller says "the animal that begins with M". Players then place Tad bingo chips on ALL animals on their cards that begin with M.

Game Four: Add-Up and Match
Use the spinner with the addition equations, and cards with numbers on them. The youngest player begins by spinning the spinner and solves the equation to which the arrow points and calls out the answer. For example, if the spinner points to 9+1, then the player solves it and calls out 10. Then all players search for 10 and cover it with a Tad bingo chip. Play continues clockwise with each player taking a turn spinning and calling.

Winning:
A player wins when they get 4 Tad bingo chips in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row and they shout out "bingo".

110488.description: On the board in four parts schools of fish and corals can be found in varying numbers and colours. Colour die, dot die und symbol die together result in a combination of three characteristics which players should find on the board. The board is variable and thus always new situations form. A player discovering the combination wanted shows it and marks it with a chip. If a combination has already been covered, the chip goes to the treasure chest. If an octopus is rolled, all chips from the board are put on the chest. If the chest is rolled the chips from the chest are distributed among the other players. The player placing his last chip wins the game.

110489.description: The game comprises 110 cards with 220 situations taken from daily life. Each card describes the situation and suggests three different ways of behaviour, only one way is the correct one. Players roll the die and move their pawn, the end spot of the move determines what happens: On an empty spot they stop or buy another move with 3 Chips. On a "Benimm ist in" spot one draws a card and answers the question. A correct answer is rewarded with a chip. On the red "live"-spots one must enact the situation pictured on the board, the other players act as jury. Wrong answers send the player back 3 spots. The first player to reach the finish wins the game.

110490.description: Players start at the castle door and try to reach the tower, they have to pass 29 spaces and overcome ghosts. Good dice rolls and clever use of the results will help a player to be there first and win. In his turn a player rolls all 3 dice: To enter a spot a dice in the roll must show the number of the space or it must be possible to form the number from the numbers rolled. When the dice have fallen accordingly, one can enter several spots in sequence. If helmet and armour are rolled at the same time, one can move to the next armour chip. All players not in first place may re-roll one die per turn.

110491.description: 6.000 questions in three difficulties, the themes are technology, politics, sky & earth, history, nature, art and culture, sports and fun and general, players try to reach the golden finish spot as quickly as possible by answering questions in the colour-coded difficulty range their piece stands in. Correct answers allow movement, themes are determined by roll of the die.

110492.description: The 36 Good Night tiles show 6 times activities necessary before going to bed. Each player tries to be the first to collect one motif each. In his turn he rolls the colour die and moves to the next spot in this colour, on a Sandman spot he can turn over a tile and take it if he has not got the motif yet. On the purple corner spots one has to give back the motif shown. Older children can play with the number die, then the "6" sends a player to the purple corner spot.

110493.description: The game board shows an Indian camp in full swing, each player tries to find 8 tiles corresponding to his theme tile from a total of 48 tiles, colour coding makes it easier to spot fitting tiles. In his turn a player can turn up as many tiles as he wants - if "Überfall" is turned up the move ends and he receives no tiles. If he ends his move voluntarily he can keep all tiles corresponding to his theme. The first player who has found all 8 tiles can lay out all tiles on the board, ends the game and wins.

110494.description:
Ost ! is a medieval skirmish miniature wargame, originally published in Vae Victis magazine issue #32.

The game uses a simple chit-pull system (using common playing cards) to alternate minis activation between players. Each activated figure has 2 actions, which can be used to move, fight, fire, reload a weapon or perform a special action (such as climbing on horseback). Combat is resolved by an opposed d10 roll with modifiers (for fighters skill, armor, weapons...), ranged combat by a die roll on a table.

The game includes rules for ranged weapons, cover, armor, horse riding, morale, civilians and a scenario ("Les routiers sont sympas").

Scale: 1 mini = 1 man, 1 cm = 1 m, a turn = a few seconds

110495.description:
User Summary

Alphabet Land is a simple boardgame intended for young audiences (recommended ages 4-8). Players use a spinner to travel around the board collecting letters of the alphabet, which are associated with particular spaces. The spaces are shown as balloons. Landing on a space with a letter on it allows the player to collect that letter. Landing on a black balloon allows a player to take a letter from anywhere on the board. Landing on a purpler balloon allows the player to steal a letter from another player. A player is "stung" and must return a card to the board if he or she lands on a spot showing the Alpha-Bee.

The game ends when a player lands on the Finish spot with an exact spin. At that point all players count up there cards. The player with the most cards wins.

This title appears to take some inspiration from Candyland.

110503.description:
The Enemy is attacking your borders and you must withstand the three waves of invasion heading your way.
You must choose and deploy your units to destroy the Invader before it eliminates them all.
This dice game is a solo version of co-ordinate based battle games, like Battleships or Salvo.

You choose which Units to use - Bunkers, Guns, Tanks and Command. Then deploy them on the grid to outlast the attack of the Invader.

Near misses result in bombardments that cover multiple grid points, so a well thought out deployment is essential.

You need to survive three waves of attack to win the game.

110505.description: The ducklings race around the pond, but to make it more difficult each must find three items before moving. In his turn a player rolls the die and may move the number of spots rolled when he can find two more tiles showing the same item as the tile under the marker stone. He may turn over up to three tiles, if he finds two correct tiles he moves his duck, if not, can only move the marker to another tile. Je first player round the pond and back at the duck house wins the game.

110506.description: On the board fairy tale pictures are connected by moss hills with and without arrows, forming a circuit. Each player starts on any of the story spots, 24 story tiles are laid out face down. In his turn a player rolls the die and moves the number of spots rolled. If he reaches a moss hill, the turn ends. On a moss hill with an arrow he can turn up a tile and replace it face down. On a story spot he can turn up a tile and keep it if it corresponds to the story of the spot, and he has another turn. When all tiles are taken up, the player with the most tiles wins.

110507.description: Honouring the Mozart Year 2006 Noris offers a quiz game with 1320 questions and answers on the subject of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Players move their tokens over a historic map of Europe, following in the steps of Mozart. Each player at the beginning of the game receives several cities visited by Mozart during his travels and have now to visit those cities, too. To continue travelling a player must correctly answer a question. The first player to arrive back in Salzburg has won the game.

110509.description:
The "word crocodile" gobbles up all words it finds in its path, but cannot digest them and gives them back again letter by letter. A non-playing referee slides a card into the crocodile. At the beginning only the tip of the crocodile’s tongue is visible and the first letter of the word. Now all players guess which word the crocodile is spitting out and call out words. Each player may only call out one word for each new letter, if you call out more than once you are disqualified for this word. If somebody manages to guess correctly, the card is shown to all players and is given to this player. The referee enters a new card. If the word was not guessed correctly after the first letter, the next letter is slid out and all guess again. If you do not want to guess you need not do so. If the word is not guessed before the last letter appears the card goes to the player who reads out the complete word first.

At the end of the word a little picture clarifies and explains the meaning of the word and allows control if the guess was correct. The playing time can be varied by the number of cards used. When all cards have been played, the winner is the player who collected the majority of cards.

110510.description: The time robbers have stolen the hands of all the clocks, but the children can repair the damage and position the hands again. The cards are stacked hand-free clocks facing upwards. The bottom card is drawn, the picture on each card gives hints to the time-frame: A soup pot indicates lunchtime, a sleeping child night-time. You try to position the hands on the big clock as exactly as possible. The backside of the card shows the correct time - if you did it correctly, you receive the card. With 5 cards you win the game.

110511.description:
Third of the Spielbox Wallace Edition Games.

Barbarians invade the crumbling Roman Empire. Once they reach Rome or when the last coin has been taken from the board the game ends. Whoever held on to the most provinces on the board wins the game.

To start, every player places his pieces on provinces on the map, every province gets a coin as well. Possible actions per round are determined by throwing 3 dice per player, then placing a chit of this player in the corresponding box. Once every player has rolled and placed his chits the actions are taken, starting with the 1 box up to the 6 box. For every chit in the box one appropriate action is taken by that player.

1, 3 and 5 is a barbarian attack, 2 and 4 allows a player to attack, 6 is taxation.
Attacks are resolved by throwing 3 dice, any double causes one hit and eliminates the defending piece, a triple allows for a barbarian breakthrough and eliminates another piece adjacent to the original defender. Taxation allows for a maximum of three coins taken from the board.
110511.name: Das Ende des römischen Imperiums

110513.description:
Players are dealt 12, 10 or 8 cards depending on the number of players. The cards are three types - Land cards, Goods cards and Choice cards (which act as jokers).
The game plays a little like Rummy as players have to collect sets which are laid in front of them. You can add to your sets and you can add to opponents' sets.
The sets within the card types consist of a Question and related answers so a little trivia knowledge helps you not to overlook cards you need.
Winner is the one who plays all their cards first.

110514.description:
Card game which is a question and answer game for children.
All the cards are dealt out. Now the first player asks the person to the left of him or her (your neighbour in other words) a question. If they get the answer right, they get the card. If the answer was wrong, the questioner gets to keep it and it goes back into their hand. Now your left hand neighbour asks a question of his or her neighbour, and so on.
The one who gets the most answers right wins. Limited replayability I would think.

name.#text: Fragst Du mich ,,, neck ich dich

102324.description:
From the publishers website:
Hellapoliisi is a game based of the most popular Internet blog in Finland, which focuses on the division of different recipes. Reply with food themes to questions, learn more about different cultures, food delicious and the judge (or less ... delicious) dishes that your friends are cooking for the game! Entertaining dinner game where the most well done recipe wins the game!

Game play

You have 4 decks of cards, dice, hour glass and a large game board. Players go around the game board. On the game board you have two different versions of foods you have to make, then you have a bonus food and you have a time squares from 1-6. When ever you step on one food space, you have 30 seconds to draw 15 cards and make a dish out of them. The more things you use, the more you score.
When you hit a bowl with a star, you have no time limit, but you only get 5 cards to use. Players have a chart they can use to help them make the foods.
Game ends when one player reaches the number 6 space on the boards. Players then read their score. Winner is the one with the most points.

110517.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The sixth and final Battle Pack in "The Capital Cycle" for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, The Imperial Throne puts the focus on the Old World's greatest nation with roughly half of the 60 new cards (three copies each of 20 different cards) dedicated to the Empire of Man.

The Empire of Man is the greatest nation of the Old World, spanning the continent from the southern Border Princes to snow-clad Kislev in the north, and The Imperial Throne reflects the nation's richness and diversity. Imperial players gain a new Hero, Fortification, and Capital Center, as well as other units and support cards. The Empire's allies and foes also receive new units and support cards, including explosive new support cards and a means of making targeted searches through their decks.
110517.name: Warhammer Invasion: Der Imperiale Thron

102326.description:
Tactic release of the popular trivia game for the 60th anniversary of Donald Duck. The game is the same as the original Aku Ankka trivia game with added stuff.

A trivia game developed in cooperation with the Finnish Donald Duck magazine. The questions have a heavy emphasis on stories by Carl Barks and Don Rosa.

The board is divided into six decades (1950's through 2000's), representing six decades of the Finnish Donald Duck magazine. At the center of the board is the "Time Machine" through which players must travel from one decade to the next.

The object of the game is to travel to all six decades and earn a Donald Duck magazine from every decade by answering correctly to a trivia question about that decade's stories. The first player to return to the Time Machine with all six magazines wins the game. Along the way there are spaces that, for example, give you an Action Card that can assist in the game, let you continue on after answering a trivia question correctly, give you a new dice throw, or make you lose all your Action Cards.

102329.description:
From the publishers web site:
Here comes the adult game from the pipe (game box is cylinder), which includes seven adult dating games favored by the rules. Throwing dice, card games and beautiful components combine in this hilarious package, which is enough fun for the whole bunch! The game needed a stimulant substances are not included in the package.
The game comes with a lot of cards, including regular deck (two) and special card decks. Game has 7 different adult games from drinking games (2) to actual serious adult fun with scoring and also a trivia game for couples.

Trivia game:
Game comes with a special trivia cards and dice. Players play in couples and roll a dice. Dice shows the category from which the roller needs to answer. The weird thing is that couple needs to choose another couple from which to give the answer for. For each correct answer you keep the cards. First couple that knows other couples best and collect 6 cards are the winner couple.

Card game:
Uses 2 classic game decks. Can be played with 2 or with 4 couples. Each couple gets a deck of cards or 2 suits in one color. Hearts and spades in this game act as trumps.
Hearts are a life together and spades are the separation. Game is played in one full circle. With 2 couples the idea is to get rid of all the spades and collect all the hearts. Problem is that they both act as trumps, so getting rid of spades is hard, but there are special rules for Jacks and Queens in other suits that help to make that easier. When all cards are played, couples read their hearts and spades. Each heart is 2 points, each spade is -2 points, each Jack and Queen is extra 2 points (whatever suit) and each Ace is a free drink card (still a party game). Winner is the couple with the most points.
In 4 couple game, game is played the same, but the winning conditions are different. Couples now only score how many cards they have - each red 2 points, each black -2 points. Rest is the same with the exception that 0 is the worst result. That means the further you are from the 0 the higher your score is.

Couples game:
Uses the special trivia game cards. This is played in circles, couples sitting against each other. When the times comes to a player, he/she pulls a cards and ask one question from his partner about herself/himself. Partner then writes down an answer along side with the question asker. When the answer are more or less the same, they score one point (a kiss or a hug). Game lasts 10 rounds. Couple with more points (kisses) wins the game.

Other 4 are drinking games (one seems to be a sex game) where there is no actual winners or scoring of any kind. Like they say in the rules - all players are winners with these games.

110524.description:
Goblins, Inc. is a corporation dedicated to building unstoppable giant doomsday robots, and it's looking for a new Boss. Do you have what it takes?

Team up with your greed-driven fellow goblins and build the ultimate doomsday robot. Meet other teams in epic battles and blow them up, but always remember, only one goblin can win because there is no "G" in team work!

The game plays over two rounds in which you partner up with each of your fellow players to try to build the ultimate giant doomsday robot – but the other players don't know which hidden agendas you must complete to impress the Boss! During the four phases of the round, the teams take turns designing, building and piloting their robots in order to destroy the other team and get one step closer to becoming the next Boss of Goblins, Inc.
110524.name: Goblini s.r.o.

110525.description:
One treasure is hidden under each tree in the forest. As you move from tree to tree, you get to peek at the treasures you find. Can you remember where each one is hidden? When the king asks where one of the treasures is, players race to reach the castle with the right information.

Playable with only 2-4 players, Sagaland Mini is the smaller brother, the travel version of Spiel des Jahres-winning Sagaland (Enchanted Forest) with only 7 trees, 7 cards and a board consisting of fewer spaces.

Re-implements:

Enchanted Forest
110525.name: Phantasia

110529.description: The village pond has frozen over and many people enjoy a lovely winter’s day, and so do the players. They slide across the ice and collect tiles for hot chocolate or gingerbread. If you have found three identical tiles you swap them at the corresponding booth for a golden victory point tile. In your turn you roll two dice and move in two different direction, but not to and fro, for each direction you use the result of one die. If you reach a tile and do not want to take it you turn it up, open tiles are covered again. If you take a tile you replace it with one from the bag, and your turn ends. Action tiles you pick up you can use in your next turn. When two booths are empty, you win with the highest score from your victory point tiles.

110530.description: A dice game to accompany children through the year, in play they learn the 12 months with a typical situation for each month. The children learn the sequence of the months and can allocate the seasons with the help of the coloured bottom strips. Aim of the game is to collect as many month discs as possible, a player who places a disc on the correct month receives the disc.

110532.description: Players try to caper the most valuable treasures from each other and try to have the biggest treasure at the end. Ships are loaded with 8 chests showing dice tots from 2-5, the surplus chests are flotsam. In his turn a player rolls the die and takes a corresponding chest from a player or from the flotsam. For a cannon the bottom card of a ship can be turned over and the treasure taken when there is only one treasure left on the card. When the last card of a ship is sunk, the player with the most treasure cards wins, mice are valueless.

102343.description:
En Pointe Toujours !: Vent du Nord sur Hatten (Always ahead !: North wind on Hatten) is a campaign for En Pointe Toujours ! tactical wargame during the Nordwind Operation in Alsace (eastern France), January 1945.

The game includes 75 counters to mount and an A4-size map (map S). Rules are not included but available on Vae Victis website along with a bonus scenario.

The campaign covers 4 different scenarios :


"Surprise à l'Aube" (Surprise at dawn). Hatten 1945 (15 turns): Elements of the US 1st Battalion/242nd Infantry Regiment/42nd Infantry Division against Elements of the 25th Panzer Grenadier Division. This scenario uses 4 maps (G, H, I, J) available from Vae Victis 51 issue.



"Mourir pour Hatten" (Die for Hatten). Hatten 1945 (10 turns): Elements of the US 2nd Battalion/242nd Infantry Regiment/42nd Infantry Division and 48th Tank Battalion/14th Armored Division against Elements of the 25th Panzer Grenadier Division. This scenario uses 6 maps (A, C, G, H, I, J) available from Vae Victis 31 and 51.



"Sherman Ball Trap". Herrlisheim 1945 (5 turns): C squadron/43rd Tank Battalion against elements of Volksgrenadier Division 553. This scenario uses 4 maps (K, L, N , H) available from Vae Victis HS6 and 51.



"Assaut sur Wingen" (Assault on Wingen). Wingen 1945 (5 turns): Elements of 1st Battalion/179th Infantry Regiment against Elements of 12th regiment/6th SS Nord Division. This scenario uses 1 map (map S included).

name.#text: En Pointe Toujours !:  Vent du Nord sur Hatten

102344.description:
From the publishers site:
Card game with 110 card full of tornados, some crazier than others. Each player is the chaser of the tornados and try get the best pictures of tornados.
To get great pictures you must interrupt others in their way and play stronger tornados to swallow their small tornados or change the wind and push it near to you.

Be the one with the best tornado in the end and win the game.

110537.description: Question and answer card game for adults only. The risquè cards are shuffled and placed in the centre of the table. In your turn you draw the top card and ask another player the question, hoping to embarrass him or her. The most correct answers wins the game

110538.description: Players criss-cross through Austria, amassing cards as they get to certain cities. The first to visit a pre-agreed number of cities, wins

110539.description:
I expect this was a promotional game issued by the tourist board of the Salzkammergut region in Austria. Players criss-cross on a map of the region, answering questions about the places they find. Thus it would be an educational game as well as a tourist game.
First to reach home is the winner.

102348.description:
Intryga 13th Street (The Intrigue of 13th Street) is a board game for 3-4 players aged 12+. The average time of play - about an hour.

Each player takes the role of one of the characters, which are: Kenneth Carter (Councillor), Kathlyn O'Brien (Detective), Gareth Newberry (Attorney), Emily Winfield (Technology) - in the past they were embroiled in an unsolved investigation. The goal is to reach the farthest field on the bonus track by discovering evidence of crime in investigations of other characters.

The game was realized as a giveaway for Hallmark Channel. As the execution time was frantically short (competitive companies abandoned the topic), Kuźnia Gier has decided to alterate and adaptate one of its earlier criminal games - Inwigilacja. The game was well received by the customer, as evidenced by the second printing of the game in the second half of the year.

102366.description: Players move to the goal by answering trivia questions about teen sexuality, and explaining their answers to the other players. Just as in real life, being mistaken on a matter of teen sexuality may force you to deal with (special penalty questions about) teen pregnancy or sexually transmitted disease.

110564.description:
Billions of years ago, when the earth was just an incandescent globe that began to cool - big masses of rocks and ores, that were before in a liquid state, started to solidify, creating what we call today a terrestrial crust. The magma, still boiling and liquid, started big waves around an unstable soil and this huge rock layers collided and rose from the soil, creating the mountains. In the abstract game YN a player will experience the idea of creating these mountain rages using sequences of dices in a scenario that simulates the Earth at its formation process. The player with less numbers in the dices outside the board wins the game.

Each player have a bunch of dice (that represents mountains) and need to put in the board, but there's a problem: a dice only can touch another dice with a same value like a domino mechanic and after each turn a player can put a small token to create blockades to the opponent. The objective of the game is to be the player with few numbers in the dices out of the board.

110565.description:
(from MMP website:)

Roads Through Rome, the eighth “action pack” for Advanced Squad Leader, focuses on the war in the Mediterranean and the Allied drive through Rome and up the Italian peninsula. From the first engagement of American and German armor in Tunisia, to the entry into the “Eternal City” and beyond.

The ten scenarios included in Roads Through Rome require all ASL core modules.

Three double-sided 11"x16" mounted maps round out the package (boards 4a/b, 5a/b, and 6a/b). Each board is completely geomorphic, and compatible with previous ASL mapboards. Offering new and novel map configurations, these are sure to spark the interest of designers and players alike.

Roads Through Rome also includes optional “Australian Balancing System” (ABS) provisions for each scenario. ABS is intended to allow for scenario side selection via a series of escalating handicap bids. Among other advantages, this can help balance scenarios between players of varying ability.

Roads Through Rome contains:

3 ASL 11x16 double-sided geomorphic mapboards (4a/b, 5a/b, 6a/b)
10 ASL scenarios featuring the new maps





Roads Through Rome Scenarios:

AP73 Happy Valley (American vs German/Italian, Chouigui Pass, Tunisia, 1942)
AP74 Batty-P (British vs German, Battipaglia, Italy, 1943)
AP75 Gabriel's Horn (American vs German, Altavilla, Italy, 1943)
AP76 Smoke 'em (American vs German, near Persano, Italy, 1943)
AP77 Texas Flood (American vs German, near Persano, Italy, 1943)
AP78 Crossfire (American vs German, Acerno, Italy, 1943)
AP79 Rude Mood (Free French vs German, Esperia, Italy, 1944)
AP80 A Bloody Waste (American vs German, Artena-Valmonte Gap, Italy, 1944)
AP81 Lost Highway (American vs German, near Rome, Italy, 1944)
AP82 Coriano (Canadian vs German, Coriano, Italy, 1944)

name.#text: ASL Action Pack #8: Roads Through Rome

110566.description:
Quinella is a game that brings you the excitement of the racetrack.

Players bet on which of 4 horses will win the race. The horses are represented by the suits of a standard deck of cards: Heart, Diamond, Spade and Club. Each round one player acts as the caller, dealing cards to determine the odds. Bets are placed using chips. When all bets are placed the caller deals cards to move the horses. When the race is over the caller pays out the winning bets. The player to the left of the caller is the caller for the next round. The winner is the player who finishes with the most chips.

110570.description:
How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party.

As in the first 6 editions you have to ask yes or no questions. So you could find the black humor solution.

It's a perfect party game for big rounds, but also playable with 2 players.
110570.name: Black Stories 7

110571.description:
The object of the game is to have all your pawns arrive to the home squares of the same colour, located at the end of the course, before to the other players.

At start of the game, each player place 1 pawn at START box and 3 pawns on the boxes of his colour.

Each player rolls a dice and move only one pawn according to the result. In case of 6, player could move and re-roll, moving another pawn, or free one pawn placing it on START box.

If one pawn finish its moving on a box occupied by another pawn, this pawn will return on START box.

110572.description:
This is a game based on the TV show Winx Club and is meant for ages 4 and up.

Game has 3 levels: easy, medium and "difficult".

The aim of the game is to be the first to dress, make-up etc. for the Court ball of the evening.

Players roll the dice, enter in a room (i.e. dressing room) and take a card and resolve event, or complete a set of cards in order to dress and prepare her Winx for the Court ball.
110572.name: Winx Club il Ballo

110574.description:
This small card expansion contains 5 soldiers for the draft cards. It is additional playing material that is used when 3 biohazard stickers were pasted on the board

The soldiers work for all factions and will be played with the normal draft card rules.

The package was in the Spielbox magazine 05/2011, but also named on the rules card as "Essen Spiel 2011" giveaway.

User summary
110574.name: Risiko Evolution: Exklusives Zusatzpack

110575.description:
Info on this game gathered from the ELLIOTT AVEDON
VIRTUAL MUSEUM OF GAMES.

This is a Card game. There are 40 cards in the deck.

The set of 40 cards shows the flags of the United Nations. They are divided into 12 categories, mostly geographic as follows:
•1 United Nations UN
•5 Veto Countries VC
•5 South American Countries SAC
•3 Central American Countries CAC
•3 Island Countries
•2 Scandinavian Countries SC
•2 African Countries AC
•3 Emblem Countries EC
•4 Moslem Countries MC
•3 Picture Countries PC
•3 Costume Countries CC
•6 Other Countries
The object of the game is to get and meld complete categories (see above list). With two people playing, deal 9 cards to each, three playing, 8 cards, and four playing 7 cards.
