Place remainder of pack face down in center of table and turn over the top card to start the face up stack. Player at dealer’s left starts by drawing a card from either stack, or by calling for a card from some other player. He must have at least one of the cards in the category for which he is calling. If successful he may call again from the same person until unsuccessful and then must discard one card on face up stack, which completes his turn. Then, the next player to left follows the same procedure.

Complete categories, and meld them, face up, in front of you as fast as possible. A player may pick up all the cards in the face up stack at any turn, but must meld at least one complete category after so doing. You must meld at least two categories before you can meld the single UN card. When any player has no cards left after his discard - the hand ends, and he scores a bonus of 100 for going out. Cards held by other players are discarded for next deal and each scores the total of the value of each card in their meld. Play for time available - highest score wins.

name.#text: Game of Flags of the United Nations

102387.description:
The object of the game is to collect Cub Scout proficiency badges by moving around the playing board using a six-sided dice, answering questions on the chosen subjects. There are 26 subjects and 468 questions. (The questions are published at the back of the rule book.)

The winner is the first to gain a complete set of badges. The players' boards are images of sleeves, where the badges are placed, exactly like the real badges.

110583.description:
Munchkin Skullkickers – a 15-card, non-randomized booster with Fantasy Munchkin backs – features the characters from the Skullkickers comic book published by Image Comics.

Part of the Munchkin series.

110584.description:
Card game. First separate the Mammi cards from the rest. The Mammi cards are stacked face down on the table. The rest of the cards are the Little Negro cards and are stacked nearby. Each player gets three Little Negro cards, and one Mammi card is revealed.

In his turn, a player first looks to see if he has Little Negro cards that total 10 or more and match the colour of the revealed Mammi card. If so, he takes the Mammi card. If not, he draws a new Little Negro card and discards one.

The game ends when the Mammi cards run out, and the winner is the player with the most Mammi cards.
110584.name: 10 kleine Negerlein

110585.description:
Player crawl into a dungeon and try to get hand on mercenarys, golds and precious information about some Quest to mark points and win the game.
Each turn; the player have two choice.
Try to win room (where mercenary,golds and information are)
To do so, the player put face down one of is INITIATIVE counter on the appropriat card.Each player get 7 INITIATIVE counters (0-1-1-2-3-4-5) After, next player decide if i try to get the same room or Explore new one.
if he decide to explore new one, he must put one of is INITIATIVE counter on the new explored room.
When all player have play all is INITIATIVE counter the room was resolve one at time left from right.
Firts, return face up any INITIATIVE counter and countthe result. The player whit more INI win the room and resolve any event on room (if some) then take all supply listed on that room.
At the end, the player with the most information point and dead monstrers win the game

110590.description:
Thankfully Flying Cheese does not challenge players to shoot cheese into one another's mouths – but you will be launching "cheese" skyward to try to land it in your mouse home.

Each round starts with players laying their home tiles (4, 6 or 8 depending on the number of players) and 1-2 cat tiles one by one in the 25 slots in the game tray. The center is reserved for a 2-4 point tile, depending on the round.

Once everyone has placed their home and cat tiles, players take turns launching the cheese dice into the tray using their spoon-shaped catapults. Players have two chances to try to land a cheese die in the tray. If they land on a home tile, the owner of that tile earns one point immediately. Landing on a cat costs the player one point, while hitting the center tile earns 2-4 points. Land off the board or in an empty slot, and you get nothing.

After all twelve cheese dice have been launched, tally the face-up dots on each player's home tiles; each die has three blank faces and 1-2 dots on the other faces. The player with the largest total earns two additional points.

Flying Cheese lasts three rounds, and the player with the most points after three rounds wins.
110590.name: Flying Cheese

110597.description:
Shangri-La is the second expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110598.description:
In Isegrim, players are trying to collect a certain set of cards in order to win – but they don't even necessarily know what they're holding!

The deck in Isegrim consists of fifty double-sided cards, with each side of a card showing one of five animals in one of five landscapes. Each player starts the game with seven cards in hand, with a circle of fifteen cards laid out in a circle on the table. Players then exchange cards based on questions and answers between one another, trying to lead others down false paths while collecting the cards one needs in order to win.

110599.description:
PondWars is the third expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110601.description:
The Slaughterhouse is the fourth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

The theme of the expansion is the horrors of that dreadful place that all young piglings fear the most; the horrors of the slaughterhouse...

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110603.description:
The Blizzard is the fifth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

Snow has fallen in the sty, and the theme for this expansion is winter, but the battles in the sty is just as fierce and heated as always...

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.
110603.name: The Blizzard, PigWars Expansion Module #5

110604.description:
Splade is an evolution of Spline for 3 players that can be played with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4x4 holes board and spheres in 3 colors (white, black and red). It was inspired by the great Gute Nachbarn, by Alex Randolph.

How to play:

The board (n×n) starts empty.

Starting with white (then black and red), players take turns placing a marble of their colour on an empty space or platform (2×2 arrangement of marbles).

Whenever a full line with exactly 2 colors is formed, the game ends. The winner is the player with a color in that line whose position in the player order is immediately before the other player with a color in that line.

This is, for a 4×4 set, a 4-in-a-row on the first layer, or a 3-in-a-row on the 2nd layer, or a 2-in-a-row on the 3rd layer.

Example:

White makes a line of 3 on the second layer containing 2 white balls and one black ball and wins.

Variant:

Consider the colour of the previous player instead of the next.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

110605.description:
A fistful of truffles is the sixth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

name.#text: A fistful of truffles, PigWars Expansion Module #6

110606.description:
Return of the BBQ King is the seventh expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

name.#text: Return of the BBQ king, PigWars Expansion Module #7

102419.description:
When the Navy Walked: Conflict On Mars! is a miniature rules set that covers an alternate history set during the colonization of the Red Planet of Mars by the Great Powers. As the Great Powers vie for control of the planet’s few resources and the Red Planet’s native Red, Green and White Martians make tenuous treaties with them, something older stirs in the depths of the planet. Something dark and terrible that has been hidden for eons in forgotten crèches locked in a stasis of bloody dreams of conquest.

The Overlords are awakening from their deep slumber and returning to the planet’s surface once again! The Gray servants of the Skvani are gathering their Tripod War Machines! The future of Mars bears dark days of war!

WTNW is more than just a Victorian Science Fiction Game. It is a springboard for imagination and a high-level game of tactics and battles set amongst a 'what if' world inspired by the classic authors of Victorian Science Fiction and Retro Science Fiction. In WTNW, players take the reins and command massive armies of men, fantastic beasts and steam-driven vehicles of leviathan proportions. In the end, the thunder that cascades across the battlefield to settle in the souls of the fighting men will only be assuaged with the assistance of the landship.

This Conflict on Mars supplement is not a stand-alone game. You will require the full version of When the Navy Walked, Second Edition, to play the game. So grab your goggles and your Aethertech, and get ready for a good time filled with steam and adventure!

name.#text: When the Navy Walked: Conflict On Mars

102420.description:
T'shu-p'u is a Chinese race game dating from the first millennium A.D. It is similar to the Indian games of Chaupur and Pachisi, which also inspired the simplistic Western games Ludo and Parcheesi. Being such an old game, there is no recognisable theme.

Four players compete in two partnership teams to get their pieces from the starting position, around the cross-shaped board, and to the central square. Each player has four pieces, and pieces are moved according to the throws of a four-sided die. It is possible to knock other players' pieces off the track, returning them to the start.

110617.description:
Garanimals ABC Games comes with 52 letter/picture game tiles and a double sided board with two ways to play. Each tile has a letter on one side and a corresponding picture on the other.

A-Z Picture Match is played by turning all the tiles picture side up. Players take turns selecting a tile, guessing what letter the picture starts with, and placing the tile on the correct letter on the game board.

Turning Letters Into Words is played by matching the letter tiles to make words on the game board.

102435.description:
Navajo Wars is a solitaire card driven game which places the player into the role of the Diné (Navajo) from the time of the Spanish incursion in 1595 through the time of their subjugation at the hands of an American Army led by Kit Carson in 1864.

“Diné” (pronounced 'dih-nay') is the word the Navajo use to refer to their tribe. It means “the people.”

The term, “Navajo” comes from a Spanish rendering of a Tewa (one of the Pueblo tribes) word for “planted fields.” The Diné were and are still known for their planting of corn in the high desert of New Mexico and Arizona.

The objective for the Navajo player, hereinafter referred to as "player", is to avoid being subjugated by either the Spanish, Mexicans or the Americans, hereinafter referred to as "enemy". The player will be taking actions during the course of the game to try and increase both culture and military tracks. If both of those reach zero at any time during the game, you will be subjugated by the enemy and immediately lose the game. There are also cultural developments, in the form of a tech tree, that the player will have to develop to increase his chances of winning. The developments are; weaving, horsemanship, religion, masters of the Mesas and sharp trades each having three levels of development. Navajo Wars also has historical event cards for each period. These cards have their own rules and effects that really add a historical feel to the game.

As the player, you will be trying to get your family units, "counter" on the map. Your family units could consist of a man, woman and child. With those counters you will be conducting individual actions with your families that are on the map. These actions could include, raids on New Mexico, raids on an outpost, tribal warfare & tribal diplomacy both conducted against the Comanche or the Ute. Create trade goods, husbandry and travel.

During the enemy portion of the turn, the enemy will be conducting operations against the Navajo tribe. These operations could include: to subvert the natives (player), build outpost, build and subvert, raids (the enemy will try to send raids deep into the Navajo territory) and many other actions.

The enemy receives their orders by a unique order matrix. As the player, you are never sure what will be coming next.

Navajo Wars can be played as individual scenarios for the Spanish, Mexican and American periods. You can play all three periods as a campaign game.

102439.description:
Game Contents: Customizable game board, 1 Bag of Bumpers, 1 Bag of plastic rivets to hold the bumpers in place, 4 Plastic Monster on a roller base - including Godzilla, Mechanized Godzilla, Mothra,& Three Headed Hydra, 2 Skyscrapers, 2 Train Cars, two shooters (one red and one blue) and the instructions - all in Japanese.

The Board is set up in a maze fashion using the bumpers. The goal appears to be either to get your monster from the the start to the finish. Bonus points are scored for destroying skyscrapers, train cars or other monsters along the way.

110632.description:
Noah's Ark game Two by Two. It's up to you to save the animals! There's no age limit on fun with this family game that tells the story of Noah's faith and reinforces his long-ago mission to do God's will. First you must gather the animals into the ark! Then you must journey through the treacherous waters and land safely on Mt. Ararat! The journney is filled with perils- and rewards, too! Beware of the lightening bolt! Be thankful for a Rainbow! The game casts each player in the roles of Noah and his family. Play the PRECIOUS MOMENTS Noah's Ark game with family and friends.

Each player take an ark card and a characture playing piece. As players travel the game they will recreate the story of Noah and the Ark and collect animals as they go. Spin the spinner and move clockwise around the outer path of the game board. As a plyer lands of a colored space, the player may collect the animal associated with that color and place it on their ark card. A player landing on a sun space can collect any animal. Play continues until a player collects all 8 animals (2 of each kind), and immediately move back to start.

If during the game a player lands on a lightening bolt he must move 3 spaces back. Any player reaching start withou all 8 animals, must go around the outside of the board and continue until all 8 animals are collected.

Once a player has all of the animals and has moved back to start, he will spin and move along the inner trail. This path follows Noah's trip across the raging water. It is filled with perils just like Noah's journey. When the player reaches Mt. Ararat, he continues in turn to spin the spinner and unload his ark based on the number spun. When all of a player's animals are unloaded, the player contiunes to spin in turn and help others unload their animals.

name.#text: Noah's Ark game Two by Two

110633.description: The Biography Guessing Game. Spend some time with some famous people! Profiles is the new game that gets you up close and personal with 500 of the most famous people from the past and the present! Listen to the catagory, decide whether you want multiple choice, then hear the question. Score one point when you answer correct using multiple choice, three points when you answer correct all on your own. Reach the finish line first and win the game. But watch out! Pitfalls await you along the way to make your Biography Quest even more challenging!

110635.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The new Dust Tactics: Axis Hero Pack allows players to guide their Axis Zombie units with one (or both) of two new Heroes with the Blutkreuz Zombie skill.

Shrugging off small arms fire with his Damage Resilient skill, Grenadier X flings himself into Close combat with his circular saw where he cuts into troops and walkers indiscriminately. Any Allied forces that don't fall to Grenadier X and any zombie squad he joins may find themselves concerned by the sinister presence of TotenMeister. Not only did this Blutkreuz Korps experiment manage to cheat death and become both Damage Resilient and ferociously strong, but her supply of Wiederbelebungsserum allows her to recover from nearly any wound. With their unholy strength, these Heroes lend resilience to any Axis army, with or without squads of Axis Zombies to join them.

Additionally, the Axis Hero Pack introduces Stefan, a deadly Oberleutnant who uses some of the Allies' most effective tricks against them, literally fighting fire with fire with his Flammenwerfer 40.

name.#text: Dust Tactics: Axis Hero Pack – "Stefan / Totenmeister / Grenadier X"

110636.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Though they each come from different backgrounds and though they each pursue their own methods, the famous warriors of the Dust Tactics: Allies Hero Pack all share a talent for wiping out Axis units. (Action Jackson and Johnny One-Eye were previously released in a limited manner through FFG's Game Night Kits.)

Action Jackson drops onto the battlefield as a British paratrooper, armored in a high-tech ASOCOM battle suit and equipped with two 60W Phaser Guns. Phaser technology may still be new, but when it all comes together, Action Jackson can blast through even the heaviest Axis walkers in a single instant. Meanwhile, The Priest prefers to operate up close and personal, where he's a sly expert with his dynamite charges, and Johnny One-Eye may not be the first badass to walk the Dust Tactics battlefields, but he's the first Hero with the skill to prove it. His Badass skill means he's not the type of guy who likes running out of ammunition while Axis forces close in around him. Johnny One-Eye and any squad he joins gain unlimited uses of their limited ammunition weapons.

name.#text: Dust Tactics: Allies Hero Pack – "Action Jackson / The Priest / Johnny One-Eye"

110641.description:
Schatzinsel Ahoi! is an easy treasure hunting game for children with a memory element. The board is a grid of 36 squares, each showing a symbol / detail. A gold coin is placed on one of the squares.
There are 36 face-down tiles, each corresponding to a square on the board. Players reveal one tile, and if it fits a square adjacent to the own pirate, they can move there. Than the tile is turned face down again. The first player to reach the gold coin is the winner.

110643.description:
Le Retour de l'Empereur is a game on four battles of 1815: Quatre Bras, Ligny, Waterloo and Wavre, using the Vive l'Empereur game system.

"Vive l’Empereur!" is a series of simulation games using a standard rules system and a set of exclusive rules specific to each battle. These particular rules include an historical commentary and the victory conditions for each scenario. The aim of this system is to refight at the regimental scale the numerous battles fought during the Napoleonic Era in Europe, between 1805 and 1815. It uses a map on which the players move counters representing the combat units involved in these battles.

The present game simulates battles of the campaign of 1815 in Belgium that belongs to the legend. After he returns from Elba, Napoléon reconstructed an army and landed a preventive strike on the two closest armies, the Prussian army under the old and faithful Blücher, and the Anglo-Allied army under the Duke of Wellington. At first spread over a vast area, these two armies eventually assembled and fought four legendary battles at Quatre Bras and Ligny on the 16th of June, and then two days later at Wavre and of course Waterloo, called Mont St Jean by the French, and La Belle Alliance by the Prussians. This campaign is an impressive collection of missed opportunities on both sides. Now it is your turn to do at least as well, or better...

Components:

- six 22" x 34" maps (scale 250m/hex)
- 600 counters, including 300 combat units
- 2 rules booklets: the Standard Rules Version 3 and the special rules
- 10 charts and tables, including army losses
- more than 30 scenarios and what-ifs, including a 3-day campaing game

110645.description:
The New Wireless Card Game - Quickly teaches you to read Morse.

This is an older person's Snap variant. During the game you need to alike images and you need to know the Morse Code name for the letter (if that letter has a name identity). I think it probably dates from the 20's.

The winner is the one who ends up with all the cards.

The name was not made up by the publisher. It sounds as if it comes from a children's nursery rhyme, but it is the "conventional verbal representation of the dots and dashes of the Morse code" according to the OED. Troops were apparently taught to recognise whether a dot or a dash was being transmitted by the sound of the machine. A dot made an 'iddy' sound and a dash sounded like 'umpty'.

102977.description:
User Summary w/ Publisher Information

Produced by BOA Publishing, this unofficial expansion of the Ambush! family of games requires only the base game to play. This stand-alone mission is the first installment of a planned 4 part series.

Viva La Resistance places your squad in a semi-quiet sector of the front line in France. Your squad is ordered to make contact with French Resistance fighters who have arranged to link up with U.S. forces in order to pass off a downed B-17 officer that needs to be escorted through friendly lines.
Along with your normal choice of weapons your squad will be issued Rifle Grenades and two adapters. Rules on the use of these are included with the mission. You also receive 14 new soldier cards printed on hard cardstock. There are 6 pages of new paragraphs and 2 conditions also printed back to back on hard card stock. Set includes one minor vehicle (a horse drawn wagon), and a counter for this vehicle is included.

This is a long mission as far as time to complete is concerned. Quite a lot of game time is spent in Rounds instead of operations, which tends to slow things down quite a bit. This mission can also turn deadly very quickly. If you're using a squad built up during the course of the entire series be extra cautious, don’t win at all costs. Proper tactics will aid you during this mission.

[Note: correct French is "Vive la résistance" - "Viva" is Spanish]

name.#text: Follow Me!: Mission #1 – Viva La Resistance

110649.description:
La Guerre des Tuques is a team based party game where both team are in the middle of a snowball fight.
The goal of the game is for a team to create the largest Snow Fort while throwing SNOWBALL cards to the other players.
A player losing a snowball fight will receive a WOUND card that will affect him physically during the rest of the game. (example: Must now speak with its teeth clenched). Players that do not obey the wound cards will have their team lose a FORT card to the other team.

Hilarity ensues as the players try to build the biggest fort!

From the publisher. (french version)
Plongez-vous dans l’univers qui a marqué plus d’une génération d’enfants. Cette fois-ci, incarnez un des personnages cultes du film, rassemblez-vous en deux équipes et préparez-vous pour la bataille.

Tous les coups sont permis et les conséquences sont farfelues.

Construisez votre fort pour gagner la Guerre des Tuques.

110653.description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.




Here's a short description of ColorMio Art from the designer/publisher:


Open three dye cards.
You can discard all the palette cards that have the colors made by three dye cards after taking one palette card.
Discard one palette card after discarding the used dye cards and making dye cards three cards. After this, your turn is over.
The player who discards all his palette cards becomes a winner.


More details in the wake of Spiel 2011...
110653.name: Color Mio Art

110655.description:
Tiring of stone pyramids and all the work involved with them, Pharaoh the king of Egypt plans to build new pyramids out of gemstone cubes. How colorful, how novel – now you and the other players need to get the work done.

Each round in Pyramis is broken into two parts: the "mining" of gems and the building of pyramids. During the mining phase, players take turns drawing gems from the gembag, pulling 1-3 at a time. If they draw more than the specified amounts shown on that round's king card, then the player must give up that color of cubes along with extras as a penalty. Players can stop drawing gems at any time, and players score points based on the number of gems they draw in a round.

Players then build mini-pyramids of four gems, with more points being scored when the pyramids have fewer colors in them. You must use all of your gems each round, whether to complete pyramids started by others or to leave half-finished pyramids of your own.

After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

110657.description:
You are a renowned gold jeweler – a master craftsman – but are you proficient enough to claim the title Goldnaire?

Players start with a hand of six cards, with the cards showing various types of jewelry. On a turn, you lay down 1-2 types of jewelry on the table in front of you, then trade with other players for the cards in their hands while trading away what you hold. After trading, you may lay down additional cards from your hand if they match the two types on the table in front of you.

If you have enough points on the table, you can then trade them in for one or more gold bars from the stack. As the gold bars are claimed, the point value needed to claim more rises.

You can discard cards from your hand, but you receive a penalty point when doing so; alternatively, you can donate cards to other players. At the end of your turn, you refill your hand to six cards.

When the last gold bar is claimed, the game ends. Who will be the Goldnaire?

102472.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Time to put your inner "Wimpy Kid" to work and your wit on the game board. The Diary of a Wimpy Kid edition of Scrabble includes 50 exclusive bonus words, new Wimpy Kid rules, and a specially designed game board that features Greg and the gang, even Fregley and those pesky whirley street kids. Zoo-Wee Mama!

Just like the well-known game of Scrabble, players will play tiles to make words on the game board, scoring points for the letters used in the word and bonus points for playing over special spaces on the board or using all letters from the player's rack in a single play.

name.#text: Scrabble: Diary of a Wimpy Kid

102474.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A lab experiment has gone bad and monster parts are scattered everywhere. You are a scientist trying to make a special monster from all of the monster parts. Create your own monster. Collect arms, legs, a head and a body to complete your unique creature. The first player to mash-up a complete monster, no matter how silly he looks, wins the game. Game includes 54 cards and instructions for two levels of game play.

110672.description:
In Evas World there are buildings, a car, a tractor & trailer, a swimming pool, trees, a pasture and much, much more. All those things are pictured on 48 discovery cards, items are presented as seen from all possible directions. On the game board with 12 inner squares all those things are pictured when being looked on from above, as you would do from an airplane.

In your turn you roll and move your marker around the 12 central squares on the board. Then you look at the squares adjacent to the square with your marker and try to imagine how the situation would look if you were standing in the road instead of looking down. Then you take the corresponding pictures from the display of discovery cards. Your left neighbour controls your choice, he can turn over the cards, the correct solution is given on the back. When all discovery cards have been given out, the player with most cards wins.
110672.name: Eva's World

110674.description: In a display of 8 open cards and a stack you place your filly and then move it around the display for the number given on the top card of the stack. Then you decide on a card in the row with your Filly, you can take the top card from the stack, too. Or you pass. Cards taken are placed in your personal stack, you must not look at the stack during the game. Gaps in the display are filled from the stack. When the stack is finished, your personal stack is scored. You score 1 point, for 2 identical cards, 2 points for 3 or more identical cards, task cards that you can meet score 1 to 3 points depending on the number and kind of symbols. For task cards not met you lose 1 point. You win with the highest score.

name.#text: Filly Unicorn Abenteuer auf den Kristallinseln

110675.description: Rainbow island and tower are set up, the crystal meadows laid out and the crystals stacked. In your turn you roll the dice and can jump your filly over a crystal stack showing a crystal of a color rolled, and again for the 2nd die. You can jump from the island on all meadows and from one meadow to the next one or back to the island. If you cannot jump or do not want to take the colors, must discard a crystal. For a set of one crystal in each color you receive a rainbow chip, and you can swap crystals 2:1 with other Fillies. You win with three rainbow chips.

110680.description:
"Greek for the holidays" in English
The heart of the game are 55 double-sided cards, thus presenting 110 important phrases, words or questions, specially geared to holiday needs and packed separately in a plastic box for easy transport. A ring-track on the board shows empti spots and spots with city names. Players roll the die and move their token, if it lands on a city name the player can try to translate one card. It the translation is correct he receives one chip. The first player to collect 5 chips wins the game.

110683.description: 33 slits in the board carry carrots, one slit is empty. In his move a player pulls out a carrot - if it is good and without worm the player puts in into his rabbit den. A bad carrot with worm goes back into the field in any place chosen by the player. The first player to collect 5 good carrots wins the game. In a variant the board can be turned 90 degrees after each move.

110691.description:
In a article titled Three Dimensional Chess: Reflections and Speculations by Benjamin Grosbayne on page 74 in British Chess Magazine, Volume 85 (1964) there is one terse paragraph describing a 3D tic-tac-toe game.

"The simplest beginning for the whole 3D concept in the field of board games can be seen in QUBIC, the 3D tic-tac-toe (tick-tack-too) made by George M. Fox of Shelbourne Falls, Mass., U.S.A. This elementary game has three boards superimposed, each of five squares. The rules are as in the 2D game played by children except that the players move in three directions. The levels are held together by thin poles and the whole may be assembled or taken apart and then packed into a very small space. It should serve as a good introduction for young children and beginners in some of the following 3D games."

The only arrangement for the boards that would make sense for 5 spaces an "X" pattern.

Shelbourne Falls is evidently a misspelling since there is no such town in Massachusetts. It should be Shelburne Falls.

It is really odd that the 4x4x4 version of Qubic would later be published by "Qubic Games" in Shelburne Falls, Massachusetts.

Fox had been an employee of Milton Bradley. He evidently got the McLoughlin Brothers copies of a lot of children's books when MB bought McLoughlin. He later donated his children's book collection to the San Fransisco library.

Similar to:

3D Tic Tac Toe - Which is played on 27 spaces in a 3x3x3 grid.
Qubic - Which is played on 64 spaces in a 4x4x4 grid

102502.description:
Subtitled "The Game that turns your living room into a street corner ."

Players of Monopoly (q.v.) will find themselves in very familiar territory, as players roll dice to move around the game board and purchase property. The houses and hotels from Monopoly are replaced by fields and factories. Players determine the end game conditions by mutual agreement but the winner is the player with the most money.

110697.description:
"Welcome, fellow survivor.  You've talked about it with your friends. You've watched the movies. It's happening now. There is an outbreak of zombies. You have five minutes to grab whatever you can. I hope you're ready. We're heading for the hills to build our own survival camp."

Survival Camp is a dice and card game based on survival of the fittest. A zombie outbreak has occurred in your town and you must grab what you can and run. You’ll never be able to come back. It’s time to build your survival camp.

Players will build tasks based on their resources, stealing from neighboring camps and protect what they have with weapons against approaching zombies. First one to build camp stays alive.

Survival Camp is a travel-friendly game for 2-5 players.

Expansion packs will create more zombies for strategic play. Additional tasks for a more complex camp building.

110698.description:
Editions vary, but a familiar phrase or name is hidden on the gameboard. The number of words and the number of letters in each word along with the category of the puzzle is on the clue sheet chosen at random. The gameboard is marked thusly. Before guessing letter, a player must spin the eponymous Wheel of Fortune to determine how much each letter, if revealed, is worth to one’s account. Every spin is risk, however, because one could lose a turn or spin "Bankrupt" which means lose a turn and forfeit one’s earnings! Consonants only can be guessed after spinning the wheel; vowels can be guessed at a cost.

A player can continue taking one’s turn until a wrong guess is made and then the turn passes to the next player. Only the player who solves the word puzzle can keep the earnings made for that round. The player who has made the most money after a predetermined number of puzzles is the winner.

As the title of the game suggests, this version of the game is designed for portability and to be played without a gamemaster to verify responses. The players can check their own responses without revealing to much of the puzzles ahead of time.

The game is a faithful adaptation to the wildly popular television series.
110698.name: Junior Edtion Travel Wheel of Fortune

110699.description:
“It was a terrible, indescribable thing vaster than any subway train—a shapeless congeries of protoplasmic bubbles, faintly self-luminous, and with myriads of temporary eyes forming and un-forming as pustules of greenish light all over the tunnel-filling front that bore down upon us, crushing the frantic penguins and slithering over the glistening floor that it and its kind had swept so evilly free of all litter. ”
–H. P. Lovecraft, At The Mountains of Madness

It started out as a harmless boast in a quiet Innsmouth pub. But what seemed an unlikely drunken yarn will quickly become a living nightmare, as you and your fellow investigators set out to find the truth behind rumors of ghastly human reanimation! Can you solve the mystery behind these gruesome rituals, or will you become their next unholy sacrifice?

‘Til Death Do Us Part is the third Print on Demand story expansion for Mansions of Madness! Designed by Tom Jolly (Cave Troll, Wiz-War), ‘Til Death Do Us Part tells a story of love, loss, and dark arcane rituals. Enlist the posthumous aid of an unlikely killer’s past victims... or you might just join them for eternity.

‘Til Death Do Us Part includes:

Three double-sided reference sheets
Two Keeper Action cards
Five Event cards
Three Objective cards
35 Clue and Exploration cards
Four Infection cards
Nine Lock and Obstacle cards
110699.name: Le Case della Follia: Finchè Morte non ci Separi

110706.description:
Définimages is a riddle and charade-like game, where players solve puzzles based on definitions and with 60 picture cards, which illustrate monosyllabic words.

Variant A: The 60 picture cards are displayed so they can be seen by all the players. Each round, a player is a appointed as "Game Master" and reads a definition; the first player to find the cards (2, 3 or 4) illustrating the syllables of the word defined wins the points of that turn. After a round (10 definitions: 10 turns), an other player is Game Master for the next round; a game can have up to 10 rounds (of 10 turns).

Variant B: The players agree on the number of cards (from 30 to 60) to be displayed and a time limit (or to not have a time limit). The players try to make as many words as possible by picking the picture cards illustrating the syllables of a word. All the players play concurrently.

In both variants, each word is worth the number of cards it required to illustrate the syllables of the word.

There's also a variant for children.

110707.description: Honeyz are collectible bears well-known from TV commercials, this game introduces four new ones: Never-Endy, Carefully, Silly and Cleverly are in Schlaraffenland and want to eat as many sweets as possible. The active player rolls the die for his bear of the round and depending on the bear has different number of rolls for moving the bear and may take different amounts and sorts of sweets cards. If all cards are taken or nobody could take a card for two rounds the game ends and the player with the highest score wins.

110709.description: The heart of the game are 55 double-sided cards, thus presenting 110 important phrases, words or questions, specially geared to holiday needs and packed separately in a plastic box for easy transport. A ring-track on the board shows empti spots and spots with city names. Players roll the die and move their token, if it lands on a city name the player can try to translate one card. It the translation is correct he receives one chip. The first player to collect 5 chips wins the game.

110711.description: Kikaninchen is the identifaction character for the children’s TV channel of ARD and ZDF. In this roll-and-move game KiKaninchen and his friends want to fill the empty harvest basket with apples which they want to pluck from the tree on the last track card. Players must bet on the winner of the race and the winner of the game is the player who has guessed the winner. Between the start card with the basket and the finish card with the tree you place any number of cards you like. Each player chooses one of his color dots and thus bets on the animal that will reach the finish first. In turn each player takes both dice and moves the animal of the color rolled as many steps ahead as the number dice die demands. When you roll red the player puts back an animal of his choice the rolled number of steps. When the first animal reaches the tree the winner is the player who chose this color dot.

110713.description: Cards are shuffled, each player is dealt 5 cards, the chips are distributed evenly. The player with the most chips at the end of a pre-agreed number of games wins. After dealing the phase improve cards is played, each player in turn draws 4 cards and then reduces his hand to 5 cards to form the most valuable combination possible. Then in three rounds players bid chips or pass, after that the players still in the game reveal their hand, the player with the best hand gets all the chips.

110716.description: Four puzzles with farm szenes are put together to form a big picture, each puzzle has 12 parts. Each player receives a frame and in his move turns up one of the parts - if it fits into the picture the player takes it, otherwise it is put back. Contour drawings in the frame help to fit in the correct parts. The first player to complete his picture wins the game.

110718.description:
A game with first class illustrations.
It is a set collecting game, like a Quartet but with a difference. You are collecting the four quarters of an animal. A full set will be numbered 1 to 4 but in the early stages you may well collect the wrong animal part because you did not recognise it correctly. It also has child appeal because the box illustrates wrongly assembled animals, with a good sense of humour on behalf of the publisher.
The winner is the one who collects the most correct animals.

110719.description:
Objective:
Be the first to reach the finish line

Simple 'Roll and Move' game with cute drawings and - of course for games from the former GDR - fancy meeples

110722.description:
Photoloco is a drawing game game with some basic similiarities to Pictionary but with alot more going on! Photoloco is a fast paced, incredibly fun game with some hilarious moments and lots of interaction!

Photoloco is a brand new game that is fast, fun and more often than not- hilarious. In Photoloco you've got 90 seconds to draw anything you want on a giant game photo to get your teamates to say as many of nine hidden words associated with that photo as you can. Hand gestures are greatly encouraged! While the results of your efforts as an artist might seem obvious to you, your teammates might not be so sure! It's been a while since a game has come along that plays so well with people of all age groups. Photoloco can entertain children (8 and up) and yet still become the life of a party with adult beverages.
110722.name: Photo Loco

110724.description:
3-Squared is a dice rolling game where players try to score the lowest number of points. The game ends when one player reaches 150 points.

Overview:
The game begins when the first player rolls the 9 3-Squared Dice. 8 of the dice are colored with blue (3 sides), purple (2 sides) and red (1 side). The 9th die has 3 blue sides with a 10 on it, 2 purple sides with a 20 and 1 red side with 40 printed on it. The object is to NOT roll all of the sides with the same color and complete the 3-Square.

After the dice are rolled all players examine the results. The Score Die is set in the center of the play area and all other dice that are the same color are set along side it. If all of the other 8 dice are the same color as the Score Die, the player has completed the 3-Square, the round ends and the player who rolled the dice scores the points showing on the Score Die. If any of the other 8 dice are not the same color, play passes to the next player. The second player rolls all of the remaining dice that do not match the color of the Score Die and the other dice that were not set aside. Play continues in this manner until all of the dice match the color of the Score Die and the player who completed the 3-Square.

There are two little tricks however that can alter the gameplay. The first is the 10th die...called the Event Die, it has six different sides that can change the results of the dice rolls. One can end the round immediately, even if the 3-Square has not been completed. One can allow the player who completed the 3-Square to pass the points to a different player, others double, or even triple the points showing on the Score Die.

Each player is also given 3 Pass Tokens which they can use to skip their turn rolling the dice, shifting the turn to the next player. The 3 Tokens are not renewable so players must be careful when using them.

Contents:

3-Squared Dice (10 Total)
Pass Tokens (18 Total)

110729.description:
"Around the dog" in English
2.200 questions and answers on the subject of dogs, frequent play can make an expert of the players. Each correct answer can earn a chip, if the playing piece sits on the corresponding colour spot in the outer parcours. The first player to collect all 8 chips wins the game.
110729.name: All about dogs

110730.description:
Set thousands of years in the future, the board game DarkStar is based on classics such as Dune, Cosmic Encounter, and Diplomacy.

Strategically, DarkStar plays out something like Chess, although the game mechanisms are wildly different. Your key pieces are squadrons that you move around the board in stacks. The board itself being gridded into systems (where resources are located) and subsectors (empty space). Squadrons move from square-to-square on the board as in Chess. As the game proceeds, stargates twist space so that squares change their position relative to one another.

Another big difference from Chess is that conflicts are resolved using tactical core cards that will feel to you more like rock-paper-scissors. Unlike in Chess, attacking pieces won't always win. Furthermore you will get free moves and other kinds of special actions through playing Imperial edict cards.

The most destructive force in the game are antimatter missiles. You build missiles in stages on your systems and launch them during your turn. These missiles are the reason why the goal of the game — collecting three different deep-defense codes — is so important. Missile detonations destroy everything in a square and even burn up the square itself so that nothing can enter it. Owning three colors of deep-defense codes makes some of your squares immune to antimatter detonations, upsetting the balance of power and giving you a chance to win.

102539.description: 3-D Bullz Eye Dartz, takes the tradition wall-mounted dartboard and lays it on its side. The dartboard is magnetic and can be played flat, or in 3-D mode. It comes with 2 sets of magnetic darts that are launched from spring-boards. Any number of traditional dart games such as 501, 301 and Cricket can be played on the table-top board.

102540.description:
From the publisher:
Game made after a local kids show Mojje. Show is for children and in the show the kids will have to sings like animals. This game made after the show comes with a soundtrack from the show and a DVD as well.
Game itself is easy and short. Game has a lot of identical puzzle pieces with a piano string on them.
The game comes with a bunch of cards, one picture on each of them.
At the start of the game parent start the soundtrack. It has about 30-40 short songs on it. Every time Mojja says on the CD "Let's sing along" players add a new piano piece to the board. Game ends when all piano pieces are in place.
Players get each 8 cards at the beginning of the game. Now every time they hear a noise one of the cards in their hands make (dog, cat, pig) or named item (bananas, oranges) they have to mimic it and then play the card. First player to get rid of the cards is the winner.

102541.description:
From the publisher:
Look for the cats among the many discs as you learn colors! A new game in the popular "My first game series." 30 tiles representing either cats or mice, and back have different colors. Spread the tiles face down. Turn the large color dice made ​​of wood and pick up a tray of corresponding color. Is it a cat? Keep the tray! Is it a mouse? Turn up the washer, but let it remain. When only mice are still on the table is the one with the most cats won.
102541.name: Katės ir pelės

102544.description:
In Ihmevekotin ("Wonder machine"), players race around the board, trying to remember where the parts of their machine are scattered. Collecting parts requires doing mission cards, which require all sorts of activities, like making an ugly grin or buzzing like a bee.

The game has a purpose; it's goal is to teach how to express different emotions. The game itself is a fairly simple roll and move, with lavish production.

102545.description:
GOL In the Board Game Gol players play in the board by eleven pawn for the player like in the real football.
The Game Gol is like chess because is on the time (players have ninety second for move),.
In this time can moves yours contenders and kick the ball. In this game we don’t use dice, player must in his ninety second calculate how hard to kick and in which direction.
Time of game is ninety minute.
Number of players is two.

GOL is made by Slawomir Kakietek

110739.description:
To run away from Gargamel and his cat, the smurfs left their village and escaped to the woods.
The players must find them in their six hideouts on the board, bringing them in couples back to the village inside a little caddy, moving it in the paths of the wood.
This with the help (or the tricks) found in the 20 "surprise cards", to be revealed when passing near Gargamel's castle.
The player who manages to finish first his mission, moving with the caddy the assigned couples to the village, will win the game.

110740.description:
Players build a football team one player at a time in Fußball Poker, but they're never assured of getting the player they want since all of the other team owners are bidding at the same time as you.

Each player starts the game with €100 million; someone shuffles the 48 player cards, then places them in a face-down pile. On a turn, the active player draws and reveals four cards, then places a bid face-down on the table; while the bid itself is secret, other players can see how many money cards you included in the bid. Each player in turn places a secret bid, then they reveal these bids. Whoever offers the most money takes the footballer of his choice and places it in an empty position in his team line-up on the game board, then the second-highest bidder does the same, and so on. If a player has no money, he takes the last card on offer. The active player position rotates to the left, then players each bid on and draft another card.

In addition to acquiring high-valued footballers, players are trying to fill their team with a proper line-up of players – midfielders in the midfield, three defenders and a keeper in the back, and so on – as they score bonus points when those sections have the properly positioned players in them. When a player drafts an "ersatz" (substitute) footballer, it can replace any footballer already in play and it counts as being in the proper position; the drawback is that an ersatz player is worth no points on its own.

After twelve rounds of drafting, each player will have a full line-up and one player on the sidelines; this player can be substituted for any other footballer already on the team, even if the substitute is not labeled "ersatz".

Players then tally their player points and any bonus points for completing a section with the proper footballers. The player with the highest score wins, with ties being broken by the money still in hand.

110741.description: The picture boards and a total of 27 picture tile show images for children. Animals from the front and from the back, penguin, pig, cat, raven and dog, a baby in three different versions and many different children. The tiles are spread face-down, each player gets a board. In your turn you turn up a tile: If you have this exact image also on your board, you place the tile on the board. If not, you put the tile back face down. The first to fill his board wins the game.

110742.description: A game of memory combined with a kind of lotto. Depending on the number of players each players receives 1, 2 or 3 boards. These boards show one of the characters on a color background and a few items belonging to the character. These items are taken out and placed backside up on the table. In your turn you choose a disc: If it fits your board you can place it. The first to fill his board wins the game.

110743.description:
Trivia game with more than 200 questions about coffee, cultivation, roasting, different types of coffee and more. Players choose for each question how many points they want to make and how big a risk they are willing to take.

Aim of the game: Having the highest number of points after a certain number of question cards have been played (number to be decided by the players at the beginning of a game). Points are earned by correctly answering questions.

Gameplay: The starting player takes a card from the card stack, chooses a letter and reads the corresponding question and its answers. There are two types of questions:

- Questions with one to three correct answers: For each question, there are four answers. One to three of them are correct, at least one is wrong. When all the answers have been read, the players place their chip(s) on the betting boards for the answer(s) that they think is/are correct. Each player (including the one who read the question) can place up to three chips. Players who put their chips on one or more wrong answers don't get any points this round. Players with exactly one correct answer get to advance their pawn one space, 2 correct answers means advancing 2 spaces, 3 correct answers 3 spaces.

- Questions whose answers have to be put in the correct order: For each question, there are three answers. When all the answers have been read, players put their chips in the order that they think is correct (the chips are numbered 1-3 on one side). Players with all three chips in the correct order advance three spaces. Players with one correct answer advance one space.
110743.name: Welt des Kaffees

102554.description:
Head Hunter is a set of four Head Hunter expansion cards for the base game Show Business. The cards should be shuffled into the original deck and played together.

Head Hunter cards apply all original rules from the basic game. As a special skill Head Hunter can be played as one of 10 other professions like Groupie, DJ, Trend Expert etc. Simply, it is a sort of a joker.

Head Hunter cannot perform the action "Trend". It cannot manipulate any of 4 trend dice.

Head Hunter expansion is free and will be available on publisher stand during Essen fair 2011.

---

Edit: The Head Hunter card turned out to be a misprint that was done in the wrong size, so it couldn't be shuffled into the deck. There never was a correct version of this expansion at all.

110747.description:
The Sproutz: Race to the Stage is an education board game that teaches children about nutrition, exercise and growth hormone deficiencies.

The game play is simple: draw a card, answer a question and if you are correct, move that many spaces. Players collect tokens as they land on specific spaces that can be used as a tiebreaker.

The goal of the game is to be the first person to make it to the stage while making sure you have more tokens than anyone else who might also make it to the stage on their last turn.

name.#text: The Sproutz: Race to the Stage

110752.description:
The Deck of Change is a deck of 64-cards with 8 numbers and 8 symbols. It is an open game system designed primarily for fun. It is versatile, multipurpose, and mathematically satisfying to play around with.

These cards might just bring out the most fun you can ever have with your family, friends, and even strangers. Kids from age 7 to 107 can enjoy the different games for 1 to 16 players. The deck has 64 cards, 8 numbers (0-7), and 8 symbols (yin, energy, force, space, matter, entropy, time, yang).

There are 3 versions of the deck. They are practically the same deck. The main difference is in the visuals. Deck #1: The AiTiA is designed for functionality. Deck #2: The Gauntlet is designed for imagination featuring artwork by Patrick Enrique. And, Deck #3: The Cauldron has bigger cards designed for creativity and brainstorming.

101745.description:
Samuel Brown is an official entry to the Heroscape collection. He was approved, tested and designed back before D&D Heroscape came out.

Character Bio (From Colby Dauch designer): "A while back Wizards asked us to design a couple of potential repaint exclusives. We made Agent Skahen and one other. The other was a patriot by the name of Samuel Brown and he was never used. We recently asked Wizards for permission to release the card and were granted permission."

Samuel Brown can be made by converting one of the figures of the 4th Massachusetts squad available in the Utgar's Rage "Minutemen and Wolves" pack.

110764.description:
Goal is for players to earn as many segments and units as possible and to have the most money on their money tracking card at the end of game play. Player rolls dice and subtracts one from the other, lands on a given segment and must answer a question from a given math strand if they want to gain credit for that segment. Once a segment is owned, player receives a card showing him/her the fees involved when someone else lands on that segment. All fees are derived from different mathematical questions that are related to the name of the segment owned.
Mathopoly offers students the opportunity to learn mathematical concepts and formulas in a fun, relaxed environment. Mathopoly the math game incorporates the mathematical diversity required to ensure success for kids in today’s challenging curriculum.

110772.description:
Objective:
Reach target line (= opponent's start position) with as many of your 10 cars as possible.
Each player/team starts with 10 cars (red or blue), moving them by die and turn.
For any obstacle (building, park...) you have to make side steps; you may choose ANY of your cars to be moved, opponent's car(s) may be thrown out. Game ends if one player/team has moved all their cars into target line.

110773.description:
Turbo Kutas is a Polish traditional card game for three or more players. It's slightly modified version of Kuku.

Basic rules are the same like in Kuku, but when a player has three cards in the same color or value, instead of saying "Kuku", he places those cards on the table (usually quickly and noisy). At that moment every other player has to put his cards (regardless of colors and values) on the table as quick as possible. The last player who layed his cards receives first syllable of "Turbo Kutas" title - Tur. If this player loses another round he receives the second syllable - Turbo, and so on. When one of the players collects all 4 syllables he is the loser and gets the title - "Turbo Kutas". All other players are the winners.

110774.description: 10 colourful pictures and an arrow to determine a letter of the alphabet - with these components from Kaleidos A-Z Bilderquiz offers several rule variants. In one game players try to be the first to name a thing on the pictures with the current letter, in the second game players try to find the majority of words and in the team-variant players name words alternately.
110774.name: A-Z Bilderquiz

110778.description:
Not Under My Roof! is a fast-paced fighting game in which opponents battle their way through a building. Rather than sitting at a table, the cards you play knock your opponent from room to room until somebody is tossed through an exit. Some cards work better if an object like a lamp or TV is in the room with you. You will fight through the building until somebody throws you out and yells NOT UNDER MY ROOF!
(From The Game Crafter page)

110784.description:
Objective: Avoid collecting too many plastic 'French fries'
(= penalties you must take if the potato 'bomb' makes music)

Starting player gets potato
1. Rolls the die and draws a corresponding card
2. Pushes the potato button (primes it)
3. Shouts a word which must be related to the term on the card
4. Throws the (hot) potato - direction was told on the card - to another player, who has to catch it
5. Player must respond with a word related to the last mentioned term and passes the potato further on - hopefully still making music
6. If the potato stops making music - that player should pick up a golden plastic chip
7. Game ends if anybody picks up the last chip

Content:
1 making music potato (with timer), 1 special die, 1 chip box, 30 chips, 1 card box, 56 cards, 1 rule sheet

similar approach compared with 'pass the bomb', but a bit easier to play
110784.name: Kuuma peruna

110787.description:
"Gamer Geeks, this game is going to rip you a new one, in a good way!" - Father Geek

"Overall, this game is just phenomenal. It brings a fresh type to the table top and hours of replayability. I cannot wait to be playing the finished product in my living room." - Demo Player Richard Nava

"I'm not a game player in general and I was surprised how much I got into (Specimen), playing the first time. I was PISSED when my flamethrower was going to be used against me. PISSED. And I was thrilled for the player next to me when she went for a move that was balls out ballsy…these guys are the real deal…FUN STUFF, FOLKS!" - Demo Player Rebecca L

SPECIMEN is a two-player card-driven board game that pits a group of human astronauts against a predatory extraterrestrial life form.

Each turn comprises four action rounds, where each player can perform one of several possible game actions. The Monster's movements are hidden from the Crew player behind a game screen, and the Monster's location is only revealed when the Monster attacks...or if the crew is lucky (or unlucky) enough to find it!

At the beginning of play, a mysterious specimen in the cargo hold has been let loose as a result of the damage caused by a meteor collision. This SPECIMEN is in an embryonic stage and evolves throughout the game, becoming more difficult to kill as the turns progress. In addition to attempting to kill the crew, the monster can also destroy sections of the ship, forcing the human players to divide their efforts between defense and structural repair. The monster can win the game by either killing all seven members of the crew or damaging enough sections of the ship that it breaks apart. Adding the destruction of the ship as an alternate victory condition allows for varied strategies on the part of both players. The human player can use tools to effect repairs, construct weapons and trackers to hunt down the monster…or ultimately blow up the ship if all seems lost.

The SPECIMEN player constructs his/her monster from a selection of 25 different attributes (offensive, defensive, or special abilities), providing new and different threats to the human player each game. This constantly changing monster, combined with 90 event cards driving game play, allows for infinite replayability. No two games should ever be the same.

102597.description:
Fire, air, earth, and water: To these Greek classical elements, established centuries ago, Aristotle added a fifth element — aether — as the quintessential, most perfect element, the stuff that stars are made of.

To win Quintessential: The Fifth Element, you must combine the more common classic elements to produce the elusive fifth element. The game is divided into a series of rounds, with cards, worker tokens, and dice as elements. All players begin as elementary students of alchemy. You draw from a common store of knowledge and share a laboratory, but it's up to you to determine how best to combine the elements available to you. The first player to collect five fifth element dice wins.

102598.description:
From the box:
How is "pirate" written? Put the correct letter with the appropriate word to your picture. How many characters you may place, will show you the cheeky parrot on the turntable. Whether you've written the word correctly or not, you can check the image back to control yourself. Thus, children acquire reading skills in a fun way.

Clear 5 pictures to win. Can be any number, that is predetermined.

Each turn players turn the parrot spinner to see what symbol cards and how many they can place.
Then they have to choose a litter cards from their hand to complete the word (picture) in front of them. You have to look pictures and symbols. Sometimes spinner shows you another picture, then you add another picture card next to the one you already have. First player to complete 5 pictures is the winner.

102599.description:
From the box:
Product information: Hannah Montana "Secret Star"

The racing game with great scenes from the Disney TV and film star Hannah Montana.

The players are enthusiastically looking forward to their next appearance as secret popstars! However beforehand they have to: sign autographs, swap the snapped guitar string and change their outfits. Who will be lucky enough to win the race to the stage and provide the fans with a great show?

Box Contains
36 playing cards
1 flip card dice
4 playing pieces
1 stage
Instructions

102601.description:
The players have an upright 4 x 4 grid between them, into which dice can be placed so they can be seen from both sides. A number of letter dice are rolled and a timer is started. Players now take turns putting a die into the grid, trying to fill it in a way that words appear on their side. This should be done as fast as possible, as the game is timed. When all dice have been placed, the remaining time starts running for both players. They now have some time to note down as many words as possible that are contained in their grid. If a player thinks s/he has found all possible words, s/he can end his/her turn early for bonus points. Each word counts the number of letters used. The player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

110794.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Catan Scenarios: Oil Springs settlers arriving on Catan will cry "Eureka!" as they discover black gold on the island for the first time. This resource brings great opportunity but also danger to the intrepid settlers as they make their mark on the island, claiming it for their own.

First, the good news: Oil can increase resource yields and allow a settlement to grow much faster than normal. The bad news is that players need to monitor the damage their oil use does to the environment and will eventually have to contend with global climate devastation which can result in all players losing the game!

Catan Scenarios: Oil Springs brings home the challenges and opportunities of the current global economy to players while adding more fun and complexity to the Catan experience.

Catan Scenarios: Oil Springs is offered both as a PnP game available on the Catan website, as well as a published edition. The packaging states "revenue from the sales of the cardboard version of this scenario will be used to cover the expenses of graphics and printing. Further profits will support Worldwatch's Transforming Cultures Project."
110794.name: Catán Escenarios: Yacimientos de petróleo

110799.description:
Power Lines is a tile laying game for PiecePack in which players take turns placing tiles from a communal pool. One player is attempting to create rows, columns, or diagonals in which there are a majority of matching suits, while the opposing player is doing the same except for matching values.

When the 4x4 grid has been fully filled in, players score points for rows, columns, or 4-tile diagonals in which they have the largest matching set.

Although originally designed for the PiecePack game system, Power Lines is playable with a standard deck of playing cards.

102608.description:
The game contains 4 double sided boards, with a detailed image of location from France printed on each side. There is also a set of cards displaying objects that can be found on every board. The objects are hidden within the images so that they mingle with the background, making them hard to spot.

At the beginning of the game, a single board is selected. On each turn, a card is turned face up and players try to spot the object as fast as possible. The first one to do so wins the card. The winner is the player who accumulated the most cards.
102608.name: Cherche et Trouve: France

102609.description:
This expansion for Crossroads is one complete story that's played a bit differently than the normal stories. Normally in Crossroads, you plan cooperatively. In The Out Route, you play competitively in what they call a "friendly rivalry." The change in format adds some interesting twists to the game.

The Out Route is a story of migration to Jerusalem and the rebuilding of that story. Players compete to be the most successful in the journey.

A copy of Crossroads is needed to play The Out Route.

102610.description:
The Shitennō are the four great Generals of the legendary Shogun Togukawa Ieyasu who unified Japan at the end of the 16th century. The players will play these loyal and famous samuraïs, with the goal of becoming the Shogun's favorite by controlling as many provinces as possible.

In Shitenno, you do not fight on the battlefield, but through planning and manipulation in the Shogun's court. A game turn starts with a "distribution phase" in which the active player creates card lots, one for each player, but takes the lot remaining after all other players have taken their cards. (All part of following the Japanese code of honor.) In the next stage, players can gain control of provinces.

The rules are easy to understand, but if you want to win, you have to judge your opponents aptly and guess their secret intentions. Every choice is crucial, every move is decisive...

102611.description:
In this fantasy cardgame, players take role of ancient elemental mages. Creating powerful Talismans, acquiring different spells and gathering elements to cast them, players try to finish their rivals power down to zero.
Each turn players refresh their hands of elements up to seven cards, then they can either announce a power clash and enter a auction for an open spell, or they can have a random talisman card from the talisman deck. When players have spells on their spellbooks (gathered from auctions) they can cast them as many times as they like, as long as they have enough elements to cast them.
Players lose power (starting with 50) in power clashes, in talisman creation and with damages they suffer from opponent spells. First player to reach zero life loses game.

102613.description:
Go & move was developed under a project of the German Economy in Cologne. It is purely a board game without computer assistance. It should give pupils a hands-on introduction to the business world. The goal is to inspire these young people for the economy, to lead them in mind as representing diverse economic decisions for entrepreneurs can be. It is primarily for school lessons in the region of North Rhine Westphalia thought. Thus it can not be ordered or purchased outside of this region.

Players assume the role of owners of printing companies. They are advertising for their business, acquire orders that regulate the number of employees, advertise for public orders. They always have to make sure that the orders are fulfilled on time.
A particularly interesting element is that, the pupils, beyond the basic rules, can arrange their own ways of dealing with the taks: by making arrangements, joint ventures and transmission of orders. The game length is variable. The game ends immediately when a company becomes insolvent.

102619.description:
"Santa Claus is already a very old man and he also has a habit of forgetting things. Sometimes Santa Claus gets lost and then Mother Christmas becomes worried. Once again Santa Claus has gotten lost. Your task is to find Santa Claus and take him back to Korvatunturi to Mother Chistmas' gentle care."

Simple roll and move game for 2-6 players. Players roll dice or use action cards to move around gameboard and flip over any tokens they encounter. First player to find Santa and bring him back home wins.

102621.description:
This is a game with cards that have phrases that relate to car racing. The cards give and take away points during several races (rounds). The winning player has the most points at the conclusion of the racing season (agreed upon number of rounds).

Card draws determine racing team designation and order of play. The player begins a turn by rolling a custom die to determine how many "race" cards to draw. The player must immediately use or discard all cards drawn. There are rules that determine hierarchy among the cards. There are no choices to make, simply follow the card text and hierarchy rules.

The "Black Flag" card causes a player to miss two turns. The "Go Behind the Wall" card causes a player to immediately discard all cards until a "Return from Behind the Wall" card is drawn. It is a fact that in car racing the "Black Flag" causes a car to withdraw from the race for any number of reasons. And a car goes behind the wall when it requires more repair than is allowed in a pit stop. It is rare for a car to return to the race and some leagues do not allow a car to return to the race.

The game comes in an appropriately sized box that is sturdy with attractive graphics. There is a box insert for the components, the finger holds allow 1/3 of the cards to be removed. The cards are made from 90 Lb paper and have neither linen content nor plastic coating. The 1 inch custom die has images that are printed on the surface. The instruction booklet is in the list format without reference numbers and the order of the rules is not in relation to game play.

102622.description:
This is the game that introduces a unique concept of custodial trapping pieces and delaying their capture until a later turn. It is playable using a regular chess board and some of the pieces from a regular chess pieces, which start on the board in a set configuration. Since its launch, several other games by the same author have appeared which borrowed from the concept. These games include Crossing Stonehenge and King's Crossing.

In the game, players will end up trapping one or more pieces in a line between two of their own pieces. These pieces are then frozen and are not able to move. After this, a piece bookending the pieces will end up moving and occupying the space of one of the pieces it traps and removing it from the board.

Players win the game by either capturing the enemy Commander piece or getting their own Commander across the board.

110815.description:
Scene It? The Twilight Saga is new Scene It? game that has trivia, movie clips, and images from the first three Twilight movies: Twilight, New Moon, and Eclipse.

From the back of the Deluxe edition box:

Team Edward? Team Jacob?

Why choose! Scene It? The Twilight Saga Deluxe edition features tons of clips, trivia questions and on-screen puzzles from all three blockbuster films, including The Twilight Saga: Eclipse!

With new mini-games and engaging group activities, you'll go beyond trivia and immerse yourself in the Twilight Saga.

Relive the passion, action and suspense of Twilight, The Twilight Saga: New Moon and The Twilight Saga: Eclipse all in on captivation package!

Exciting Group Activities
Classic Scene It? Puzzles!
Use the Remote to Solve On-Screen Puzzles!
Unique Puzzle Types!

Hosted by Twilight's Dr. Carlisle Cullen

102625.description:
Target! Bearing 093 degrees! Is a solitaire card based game, where you take control of a submarine trying to sink the maximum tonnage of enemy shipping before you run out of ammunition and fuel.

You play a card to the board to reveal the target ship and decide if you wish to get closer. Play another card to determine the escort defence level, and decide if you want to attack. Choose how to attack and play another card to see the attack outcome. A final card play determines the cost of escaping from the targets escort.

You track fuel, torpedoes, gun ammunition and tonnage of ships sunk.

102627.description:
Publisher's Description

For those of us who like to get out and exercise... and for the rest of us, who are gamers... It's a metal water bottle with the Munchkin Zombies cover art, painted in a beautiful color we're calling Gan-Green, with a carabiner to clip it to your belt, backpack, bandolier, or whatever else you have handy. And it has a rule...

Munchkin Zombies Water Bottle Rules

You may use this bottle in any game of Munchkin or its sequels. It may be used during any combat.

1. Show everyone this sheet so they can read the rules.

2. The Munchkin Zombies Water Bottle contains three swallows of Zombie Juice. Each swallow gives +1 in combat. You must actually drink one swallow for each +1 you want. You may drink it all for one combat, to get +3, or spread it out between combats. If you use the Munchkin Zombies Water Bottle in a game of Munchkin Zombies, you may drink all three swallows at once for a +4 bonus in any combat (individual swallows still only count for +1 each). You may give swallows of your Zombie Juice to other players, but be careful not to share Munchkin germs, or you might lose a level.

3. After each swallow, mark off one of the three boxes below. When all three boxes are marked off, the bottle is empty for game purposes, though you should still finish all the Zombie Juice, because staying hydrated is good for you.

110822.description: For each game another Fun Park in Austria is selected as final destination and each player chooses a city where he wants to start. Then each player receives 5 city cards, these cities the player must visit on this way from start to finish. The roll of the die determines how many cities can be visited in one turn, a "6" allows to fly to any city. If a player passes through or reaches one of his cities, he may discard the corresponding card. The first player to reach the Fun Park without any city cards wins the game.

110823.description: Captain Sturmflut and his pirates Knollnase and Lücke flee the English fleet with the treasure they stole from the queen, which they want to hide on a lonely island. Monkey Kingo shows them the best hideout, but to become a real pirate Kingo has a lot to learn, especially to tie knots. In the game for up to 4 players the player will win who best remembers the story and is very good at knots.

name.#text: Auf der Jagd nach dem Piratenschatz

110824.description: Building towers, or rather build one tower by a joint effort. Who manages to place the roof or place the last block? The game is directed by cards. On a square basis area the triangular basis block is set up. The cards are stacked. In your turn you reveal the top building card - the cards determine which block must be placed with which hand. There are also cards offering free choice or change of turn order or cards demanding placement of a roof. If you can place a roof or the last block without tumbling the tower you receive a chip. If you collect three chips you win the game.

110826.description:
Puff foam marbles through archways

A somewhat different dexterity game - Pustekugel is played on the floor, you must puff the foam marble along a self-set-up track, either against another player or team or on your own against the clock. In a game against an opponent or opposing team only the cards showing three or less archways are used. You draw a card and then in turn players puff the ball through the archways. If you are the first to reach the starting point, you get the card. If you have the highest score from your cards after a pre-set number of rounds you win the game. If you race the clock you puff the marble along the track on your own, the fasted receives the card.
110826.name: Puste-Kugel

110827.description:
German card game. 31 cards. Each card has three types of train;
Personenzug = Local train
Eilzug = Fast train
D - Zug = Very fast train

Underneath each designation there is the name of a city which will have a railway station.

The game plays a little like Rummy in that you are trying to lay down sets of cities that are linked by one of the three train types. In other words, a train route.

First to play all their cards wins.
